description: Candace Madeira Arthur and Naim Mikal Warner Abdul-Malik were married July 15 at the Bourne Mansion in Oakdale, N.Y. The Rev. Calvin Gibson, a pastor at the Ebenezer Baptist Church in Queens, officiated.

title: Dana Grohskopf, Brett Buchness
description: Dana Van Tassel Grohskopf and James Brett Buchness were married July 15 in Edgartown, Mass. The Rev. Michael R. Nagle, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at St. Elizabeth Church.

title: Chris Koottatep, Charles Stark
description: Chris Koottatep and Charles Luke Alan Stark were married July 15 in Toronto. The Rev. Matthew Griffin of the Anglican Church of Canada performed the ceremony at the Church of St. Andrew by-the-Lake.

title: Clare Langan, James Donahue
description: Clare Antonia Langan and James Franklin Donahue were married July 15 in Pangbourne, England. The Rev. Heather Parbury, a vicar of the Church of England, performed the ceremony at St. James the Less Church.

title: Cynthia Loh, Ryan Jamieson
description: Cynthia Elizabeth Yue-ling Loh and Ryan Andrew Jamieson were married July 14 at Brooklyn Botanic Garden. Lindsey Fisher, the grooms sister who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Game of Thrones and Remember Me
description: Game of Thrones begins a seventh season with Cersei Lannister wreaking havoc from her perch on the Iron Throne. And Michael Palin of the Monty Python troupe plays the straight man in Remember Me.

title: Cardinals on Opposite Sides of the Hudson Reflect Two Paths of Catholicism
description: Two very different books about being Roman Catholic and gay were released recently, each with an endorsement from a cardinal who oversees an archdiocese along the Hudson River.

title: Whimsical Urban Debris as Art in Detroit
description: More than 30 years ago, Tyree Guyton began transforming the blighted street he grew up on. Now, he is dismantling a portion of what is known as the Heidelberg Project to begin something new.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $450,000
description: 125 Eastern Parkway, No. 4K, Prospect Heights

title: Donald Trump Jr., Macron, Senate Republicans: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: What Happens After Prison
description: The Times, in collaboration with the PBS series Frontline, followed 10 recently released inmates struggling to succeed on the outside.

title: Shes His Rock. His Parole Officer Wont Let Him See Her.
description: HARTFORD, Conn.  During Erroll Brantley Jr.s nearly two years in prison, his girlfriend, Katherine Eaton, visited him three times a week, the maximum allowed. She wrote him letters and spent hundreds of dollars on phone calls, during which the couple spoke of their longing to be back together in her three-bedroom house with the picture window. Amid the I love yous and I miss yous, she promised to help him stay off heroin and readjust to life outside.

title: Arson Suspected in Fire in China That Killed at Least 22
description: BEIJING  At least 22 people died in a blaze that gutted a two-story workers dormitory in eastern China on Sunday, and investigators suspect the fire was the work of an arsonist who used gasoline, according to local news reports.

title: The Secrets to Saving for College
description: When it comes to  financing a college education, the complex web of savings plans and strategies can seem like a big tangle. Saving for college is particularly tricky because each family has its own set of financial priorities and trade-offs. Do you want a public or private school? Are you looking for a four-year or two-year college?

title: How Food in Venezuela Went From Subsidized to Scarce
description: Venezuela was once the richest country in South America, but now the cost of basic groceries is about five times the minimum wage.

title: Erdogan and Supporters Stage Rally on Anniversary of Failed Coup
description: ISTANBUL  Less than a week after the largest opposition rally in Turkey in years, hundreds of thousands of President Recep Tayyip Erdogans supporters made their own show of strength by gathering on Saturday night to commemorate the anniversary of last years failed coup.

title: After N.F.L. Concussion Settlement, Feeding Frenzy of Lawyers and Lenders
description: The sales pitches were filled with urgency and emphasized familiarity. Act now or risk missing out on millions of dollars. Trust us because we are part of the N.F.L. brotherhood. You have nothing to lose, a former N.F.L. quarterback implored in one, but money youre entitled to and that you earned the hard way.

title: Saving Swimmers, Well Into Senior Years
description: From his wooden perch overlooking the shoreline, Gerry Lambert stood up and eyed three teenagers caught in a rough oceans sudden riptide.

title: Roger Federer Wins Record-Breaking Eighth Wimbledon Title
description: WIMBLEDON, England  In the end, Roger Federers record eighth Wimbledon singles title looked easy compared with some of the marathon finals he has had to win on this same patch of London grass.

title: After a Harrowing Flight From U.S., Refugees Find Asylum in Canada
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  There are many differences between the two Ghanaian refugees in Winnipeg, but the most significant comes down to a single thumb.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Every Year, the Sky Rains Fish. Explanations Vary.
description: YORO, Honduras  Things dont come easy in La Unin, a small community on the periphery of Yoro, a farming town in north-central Honduras.

title: As China Prepares for New Top Leaders, Women Are Still Shut Out
description: BEIJING  Chinas Communist Party leaders will gather this fall for a closely watched congress to decide who will take the party into its eighth decade of power. Yet for all the speculation about who will emerge at the top of the ruling party, one result seems certain: Few, if any, will be women.

title: Inside the Royal Box at Wimbledon: Astronauts and V.I.P. Strawberries
description: WIMBLEDON, England  To be among the few who receive an invitation to watch tennis from one of the 74 seats in the royal box at Wimbledons Centre Court is akin to getting an acceptance letter from Hogwarts.

title: A Photographer and His Subject Reconnect, 38 Years Later
description: In the summer of 1979, I was walking down East 193rd Street in the Bronx, just off the Grand Concourse, when I came upon a group of kids playing in the street. I stopped and asked three of them to pose, though one insisted that he turn his back to show off the name of his breakdance crew, the Rockwell Association. I popped a few frames and kept walking.

title: Trump Goes on Attack as Russia Revelations Appear to Take Toll
description: BEDMINSTER, N.J.  President Trump unleashed a new fusillade of tweets on Sunday morning, defending his son Donald Trump Jr., slashing the news media and tarring his long-vanquished opponent, Hillary Clinton.

title: Andy Serkis on the Ending of War for the Planet of the Apes
description: Caesar, commander in chief of the apes in the new War for the Planet of the Apes, has been the heart and soul of the franchise since appearing as a baby chimp, raised by humans, in Rise of the Planet of the Apes. In the next one, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, he saved his kind and kept them on the path of good, until a chance encounter with surviving humans led to battle.

title: Maryam Mirzakhani, Only Woman to Win a Fields Medal, Dies at 40
description: Maryam Mirzakhani, an Iranian mathematician who was the only woman ever to win a Fields Medal, the most prestigious honor in mathematics, died on Friday. She was 40.

title: Doctor Who Breaks the Mold With Female Lead
description: After 36 seasons and 12 doctors, the title character of Doctor Who has finally regenerated into a female body.

title: Scaffolding on Harlem Corner: Making Eyes Sore for at Least 17 Years
description: It is the bad neighbor that just wont go away.

title: 5 Cheap(ish) Things That Could Disproportionately Improve Your Life
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. Editor Tim Herrera emails readers once a week with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: A Brooklyn Murders Decades-Old Origins in Rural China
description: When Ying Guan Chen  stumbling and bleeding from the bullet holes in his face and lower torso  collapsed and died in a Popeyes restaurant in the Sunset Park neighborhood in Brooklyn, it was clear almost at once that his killer was a fellow Chinese immigrant named Wu Long Chen.

title: War for the Planet of the Apes Arrives to Ho-Hum Ticket Sales
description: LOS ANGELES  Euphoric reviews did not translate to blockbuster ticket sales for War for the Planet of the Apes, which collected $56.5 million at North American theaters over the weekend, or 22 percent less than initial results for its 2014 series predecessor.

title: Global News Quiz: Trump in Paris, Riot in India, Death of Liu Xiaobo
description: Did you stay on top of the most important stories last week? Test your knowledge of international events with our quick quiz, recapping major news headlines from across the globe. To take the quiz, click on an answer, and the correct response will be revealed after you choose.

title: Welcome to Manhood, Gillette Told the 50-Year-Old Woman
description: A 50-year-old professor and mother in Tuscaloosa, Ala. A 19-year-old woman in Toledo, Iowa. A 48-year-old man who lives in Seattle.

title: Bus Plunges Into Gorge in Kashmir, Killing at Least 17 Hindu Pilgrims
description: NEW DELHI  At least 17 Hindu pilgrims died on Sunday in Kashmir, in northern India, when their bus plummeted 100 feet down a gorge, coming to rest in a boulder-strewn stream, the police in Kashmir said.

title: DMX Pleads Not Guilty to Tax Fraud
description: The rapper DMX pleaded not guilty to 14 charges of tax fraud on Friday. After spending Thursday night in jail, he posted a $500,000 bond and was released. He is expected back in court on Monday, and faces up to 44 years in prison.

title: Iran Sentences U.S. Graduate Student to 10 Years on Spying Charges
description: An American student from Princeton University was arrested in Iran and has been sentenced to 10 years in prison on charges he was spying for the United States, an Iranian judiciary official said on Sunday, an action bound to aggravate relations between the two countries.

title: Roger Federer, Turkey, Donald Trump Jr.: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Hootie Johnson, Who Opposed Letting Women Into Augusta National, Dies at 86
description: Hootie Johnson, who forcefully resisted efforts to admit women as members of Augusta National Golf Club, home of the Masters tournament, died on Friday in Columbia, S.C. He was 86.

title: Queen Biopic Will Happen, Band Says
description: The long-gestating, controversy-laden biopic about the rock band Queen is finally moving forward  or so says the band.

title: A Russian Developer Helps Out the Kremlin on Occasion. Was He a Conduit to Trump?
description: MOSCOW  Russian Island, near the port city of Vladivostok in the far east, was a decaying former military base and home to a scattering of cattle when President Vladimir V. Putin suddenly envisioned it as a $1.2 billion campus where he could welcome heads of state for an Asia-Pacific conference.

title: If You Really Want That Job . . .
description: To the Editor:

title: Qatar Opens Its Doors to All, to the Dismay of Some
description: DOHA, Qatar  Take a drive in Doha, leaving behind the mirrored skyscrapers and palm-fringed avenues of this gas-rich city, and the protagonists of myriad conflicts are in easy reach.

title: A Dazzling Chinese Singers Riveting Song Cycle
description: Many composers from the West have been fascinated by Asian music and culture. Few, though, have immersed themselves in Asian styles and culture as deeply as Robert Zollitsch. Born in Munich in 1966, he attended a conservatory in Berlin, and then, with a scholarship to study Chinese music, went to Shanghai in 1993. That proved a turning point.

title: Home Delivery Memories
description: To the Editor:

title: To Increase Diversity
description: To the Editor:

title: How We Can Secure Our Election Process
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Loaded and the Amusing Pitfalls of Sudden Wealth
description: Dont think of Loaded, a funny series that starts Monday night on AMC, as Silicon Valley with British accents, though the pocket description might suggest that.

title: Review: Hi, Hitler and Other Tales From a Lively Household
description: Lucie Pohl proves to be a delightful raconteur in Hi, Hitler, her one-woman show at the Cherry Lane Theatre. Her story, though, ultimately is less engaging than she is, growing more amorphous as it goes along and slowing to a stop rather than reaching a peak.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Why, About the Science of Curiosity
description: The physicist Richard Feynman once wrote of the universes vastness: It does not do harm to the mystery to know a little about it. For far more marvelous is the truth than any artists of the past imagined! In his new book, Why? What Makes Us Curious, the astrophysicist and best-selling author Mario Livio writes about Feynman and other historical figures who have exhibited great and varied interest in the world around them. He also investigates the different shapes curiosity can take, how it expresses itself and the regions of the brain in which it appears to reside. Below, Livio talks about the latest research about the subject, how the book changed as he wrote it, Albert Einstein and Leonardo da Vinci, and more.

title: Review: Martin Denton, Martin Denton, Off Off Broadway Hagiography
description: Martin Denton, Martin Denton is about someone so great, they had to name him twice. Maybe that is the not-so-subtle message telegraphed by Chris Harcums hagiographical play about a certain denizen of the New York theater scene.

title: Refugees Confront the Past Through Art, at a Pop-Up Museum
description: AMSTERDAM  In 2010, Latif Mukasa, an artist and gay rights activist from Uganda, was forced into hiding after his name and photograph were printed in a newspapers list of Ugandas 100 Top Homos with the words Hang Them. When the police issued a warrant for his arrest, he escaped.

title: Yankees Split Doubleheader, Series, with Red Sox
description: BOSTON  The Yankees first winning streak in a month came and went Sunday in about six hours  the time that passed from their 3-0 win over the Boston Red Sox in the first game of a doubleheader to their 3-0 loss in the nightcap, the first time the Yankees have been shut out this season.

title: Exodus From a Historic Puerto Rican Town, With No End in Sight
description: LARES, P.R.  This picturesque mountain town, renowned for its rich coffee, peculiar ice cream and a historic, if short-lived, rebellion, now has a far less welcome distinction.

title: Charles W. Bachman, Business Software Innovator, Dies at 92
description: Charles W. Bachman, an engineer who created software to harness business data in the early 1960s, laying a technical foundation for modern digital commerce, died on Thursday at his home in Lexington, Mass. He was 92.

title: Bob Wolff, Sports Broadcaster for Nearly 80 Years, Dies at 96
description: Bob Wolff, who called Don Larsens perfect game for the Yankees in the 1956 World Series, the Giants overtime loss in the epic 1958 National Football League championship game and the Knicks two title runs in a record-setting eight decades as a sports broadcaster, died on Saturday in South Nyack, N.Y. He was 96.

title: In Golfs Birthplace, an Effort to Keep the Game Alive
description: WEST KILBRIDE, Scotland  For decades, Calum McPhersons father made golf clubs. McPherson played golf for Scotland as a teenager and eventually joined the family business.

title: Miscellany
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  In Marie Kondos best-selling book, The Life-Changing Magic of Tidying Up, one of the central tenets of her decluttering method is that if an item does not spark joy immediately upon picking it up, the owner should get rid of it.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of July 17
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: No Corrections: July 17, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, July 17, 2017.

title: Another New York Diner Turns Off the Grill, a Victim of Rising Rents
description: John Vasilopoulos and Nick Tragaras stood before an assembly line of egg sandwiches. Mr. Tragaras slid the eggs and bacon from the griddle onto the buns as Mr. Vasilopoulos followed to wrap and stack.

title: McCains Surgery May Be More Serious Than Thought, Experts Say
description: The condition for which Senator John McCain had surgery on Friday may be more serious than initial descriptions have implied, and it may delay his return to Washington by at least a week or two, medical experts said on Sunday.

title: Flash Floods in Arizona Kill at Least 9
description: At least nine people were killed and one person was still missing on Sunday night after flash flooding interrupted a family gathering in central Arizona over the weekend.

title: Mets Return to the Sunday Doldrums With a Loss to the Rockies
description: By Manager Terry Collinss reckoning, the Mets needed to win 51 of their final 76 games after the All-Star break in order to claw their way back into postseason contention after a disappointing first half of the 2017 season.

title: Behind the Velvet Ropes of Facebooks Private Groups
description: In recent days, Ive gotten to know beekeepers in Rhode Island, dental hygienists in New Jersey and Wiccans in Tennessee. Ive seen gardeners swapping fertilizer advice, flight attendants complaining about annoying passengers and fishermen arguing about which lures are best for catching muskies. I now know that there are hundreds of people who love creating memes about The Sopranos, and thousands who believe, with total conviction, that the Earth is flat.

title: For Syrian Actors, a Maddening Road to America
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A group of Syrians has been invited to stage a play this week at Lincoln Center in New York.

title: Wealth Advisers Set Up Shop With a Shared Back Office
description: When it comes to traditional financial advisers, Josh Brown of Ritholtz Wealth Management does not quite play to type.

title: Fittingly, a Blister Hobbles Marin Cilic in the Wimbledon Final
description: WIMBLEDON, England  Jonas Bjorkman knew before most that the Wimbledon mens final, which began with some promise on Sunday, would turn into a dud. Marin Cilic, the player Bjorkman coaches, was sending little signals to his team box that the blister on his left foot had returned.

title: N Is for Never
description: Dear Diary:

title: Venezuelans Rebuke Their President by a Staggering Margin
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Millions of Venezuelans signaled their disapproval of President Nicols Maduros plan to hold a constituent assembly by casting ballots on Sunday in a vote unlike any other in this nations history.

title: George Romero, Father of the Zombie Movie, Dies at 77
description: George A. Romero, a horror visionary who created the modern zombie genre with his 1968 cult film, Night of the Living Dead, which has influenced generations of horror enthusiasts, died on Sunday in Toronto. He was 77.

title: In Urban China, Cash Is Rapidly Becoming Obsolete
description: SHANGHAI  There is an audacious economic phenomenon happening in China.

title: State Party Takes Aim at Hijabs for Children. Also: Australian Is Shot in U.S., and Julie Bishop on Trump.
description: The Breakdown puts a selection of Australias daily news into context. Todays picks:

title: New York Schools for Off-Track Students May Face Stricter Rules
description: Martin Guichardos first shot at high school did not go well. While attending Franklin Delano Roosevelt High School in Brooklyn, which has over 3,500 students, he would skip class to hang out with his friends, and he rapidly fell behind.

title: A Top Republican Vows a Vote on Health Care, but Uncertainty Reigns
description: WASHINGTON  A top Senate Republican vowed on Sunday to bring the partys health care bill to a vote as soon as possible, even as detractors said they would use a delay caused by the absence of Senator John McCain to mobilize further opposition to the measure.

title: Former Barclays Executives Returning to Court; European Bank Chief Will Address News Media
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Sung Hyun Park Wins U.S. Womens Open, Edging an Amateur
description: BEDMINSTER, N.J.  Sung Hyun Park, a 23-year-old South Korean with a fluid swing and stalwart nerves, dropped a 20-foot putt on the 15th green and then a 6-footer on the 17th, capturing the United States Womens Open with the decisive birdies on Sunday.

title: Review: What the Singing Dead Remember in Spoon River
description: Dont expect the silence of the grave to be honored in the small-town churchyard of Spoon River, the exuberant musical from Soulpepper, the Toronto-based troupe in residence at the Pershing Square Signature Center this summer. Most of the characters in this production, adapted from Edgar Lee Masterss Spoon River Anthology, may be pushing up daisies.

title: Game of Thrones Season 7 Premiere: Welcome to Dragonstone
description: If you have designs on a dynasty, the first thing you have to do is get yourself a sweet map.

title: Martin Landau, Actor Who Won an Oscar for Ed Wood, Dies at 89
description: Martin Landau, the tall, intense, sometimes mischievously sinister actor best known for his role in the television series Mission: Impossible and his Oscar-winning portrayal of Bela Lugosi in the film Ed Wood, died on Saturday in Los Angeles. He was 89.

title: Quotation of the Day: Migrants Who Survived Ordeal in the Snow Find Refuge in Canada
description: That thumb I have left helps me a lot. I thank God for it.

title: Australian Woman Is Fatally Shot by Minneapolis Police
description: An Australian woman who was about to get married was fatally shot overnight Saturday by a Minneapolis police officer who did not have his body camera turned on, officials said.

title: Predictably, Chinas Year-on-Year Growth Maintains Its Steady Pace
description: SHANGHAI  Leave it to other countries to soar and swoon in their quarterly economic performance. China prefers a steady pace, at least in its officially reported data.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 10: Candy-Colored
description: Before his return to Twin Peaks, David Lynch had been working a lot with digital video, in various shorts and in his 2006 film Inland Empire. Lynch being Lynch, he often seemed more interested in accentuating the flatness and fuzziness of the image than in tweaking the technology to try to replicate the richness of film.

title: Bridget Everetts Luxuries: Beautifully Packaged Dry Shampoo and Raw Dog Food
description: The comedian, actress and musician Bridget Everett will be on the big screen this summer in Patti Cakes  she plays the boozy mom of an aspiring white female rapper from New Jersey. (Its in theaters Aug. 18.) She is perhaps best known, though, for her appearances on Inside Amy Schumer and Trainwreck and for her musical performances with her band, Bridget Everett and the Tender Moments.

title: Cosmo DiNardo Took a Dark Turn Before Bucks County Killings, Friends Say
description: BENSALEM, Pa.  Women blocked him on social media, saying he aggressively stalked them for dates and sex.

title: Poland, Turkey, Roger Federer: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Monday: Loaded and The Bachelorette
description: A cadre of British tech whizzes grapple with their newfound wealth and their mouthy American boss in Loaded. And Rachel goes home with the four remaining suitors on The Bachelorette.

title: Australian Diplomat Flips Back Trumps Appraisal of French First Lady
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Australias foreign minister briefly put diplomacy aside on Sunday with a sly retort to comments that President Trump made about the physical appearance of the first lady of France.

title: How to Find the Right Therapist
description: Searching for the right therapist is sort of like dating.

title: Aaron Judge Is Baseballs Most Powerful Hitter
description: Aaron Judge combines his imposing body (6-7, 282 pounds) with a technically proficient swing to become baseballs most powerful hitter.

title: How Aaron Judge Built Baseballs Mightiest Swing
description: When Milwaukee outfielder Keon Broxton went clattering into the center-field wall this month at Yankee Stadium to steal an extra-base hit from Aaron Judge, he also caught something else: the sight of Judge smiling at him.

title: Joe Bidens New Book to Be Released in November
description: In November 2014, six months before Joseph R. Biden Jr.s son, Beau, died after a battle with brain cancer, the family gathered in Nantucket, Mass. During what would be his final Thanksgiving, Mr. Biden told his father: Promise me, Dad. Give me your word that no matter what happens, youre going to be all right. Those words have inspired the title of the former vice presidents upcoming book.

title: What Happened to Ukraines 5,500 Lenin Statues?
description: There were once thousands of Lenin statues in Ukraine. Today there are none officially standing, so Niels Ackermann and Sebastien Gobert set out to discover where they ended up.

title: Smoking Marijuana While Black
description: New York City was scaling back its stop-and-frisk program even before a federal judge ruled in 2013 that the tactics underlying it violated the constitutional rights of minority citizens. Its hard not to look at marijuana arrests today without thinking of that saga. Although the city has reduced the number of arrests for low-level marijuana possession, black and Latino New Yorkers are far more likely to be arrested for smoking in public than whites, who are just as likely to use marijuana.

title: Indias Turn Toward Intolerance
description: Narendra Modis landslide victory as prime minister of India in 2014 was borne on his promises to unleash his countrys economic potential and build a bright future while he played down the Hindu nationalist roots of his Bharatiya Janata Party.

title: Save the Census
description: An administration uninterested in staffing federal agencies, at war with facts and eager to help Congress cut the budget is further endangering a cornerstone of American democracy: the duty to count all who live here.

title: The Benefits of Private Financing for Public Works
description: President Trump has announced the outlines of an ambitious $1 trillion agenda to rebuild Americas crumbling roads and bridges, outdated water systems and dilapidated public buildings. While the general goal of investing in infrastructure has broad bipartisan support, Mr. Trumps call for relying heavily on private financing has come under fierce criticism. As consultants and advocates for such public-private partnerships, we believe those attacks are wrongheaded.

title: How German Condoms Funded the Russian Revolution
description: The name Vladimir Ilyich Lenin is not often linked with wartime profiteering and black-market smuggling gangs. A noted prude, he lacked the gene for swashbuckling. Yet crime and speculation helped finance his activities in 1917. A good deal of the cash he needed to prepare the Great October Socialist Revolution was channeled through an import-export company that specialized in contraband pharmaceuticals, lead pencils and German condoms.

title: Trump Savagely Mauls the Language
description: I know that there are things of graver consequence in Donald Trumps regime than his diction, but as a person whose vocation concerns him with language, I am simply appalled by Trumps savage mauling of that language.

title: Republicans Leap Into the Awful Known
description: Sometime in the next few days the Congressional Budget Office will release its analysis of the latest version of the Republican health care plan. Senator Mitch McConnell is doing all he can to prevent a full assessment, for example by trying to keep the C.B.O. from scoring the Cruz provision, which would let insurers discriminate against people with pre-existing conditions. Nonetheless, everyone expects a grim prognosis.

title: Why Im Leaving the Southern Baptist Convention
description: OKLAHOMA CITY  The first time I was called a nigger to my face was by a fellow camper at a Southern Baptist Convention retreat near Oklahoma City. I was 13, and it was 1995. Devastated, I complained to a counselor who suggested I pray for the ability to turn the other cheek. Since then, I have done just that and more: Ive been an ordained minister in the convention for almost a decade.

title: South Korea Proposes Military Talks With North at Their Border
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea on Monday proposed holding military and humanitarian talks with North Korea, its first visible split with the Trump administration, which has said it will deal with North Koreas continued missile tests by stepping up sanctions and military pressure on the country.

title: What Happened to Ukraines 5,500 Lenin Statues?
description: When the statue of Vladimir Lenin in Ukraines Bessarabska Square started coming down on Dec. 8, 2013, Swiss photographer Niels Ackermann was watching it on television at a pizzeria less than a mile away. He left his food and raced to the scene.

title: The Brexit Talks, in 200 Words
description: Britain voted in 2016 to leave the European Union and will be out on March 29, 2019. Before then, it must agree on divorce terms and the basics of a new relationship.

title: Birth Pangs, Royal and Otherwise
description: LONDON  Dont be misled by the streamlined Scandinavian-style chic of Gabriella Slades cunning design for Bodies, the bleakly compelling Vivienne Franzmann play that opened Tuesday night at the Royal Courts 87-seat Theater Upstairs.

title: Liu Xiaobos Death Pushes Chinas Censors Into Overdrive
description: BEIJING  It came as little surprise when, after the death of the dissident Liu Xiaobo last week, Chinas vast army of censors kicked into overdrive as they scrubbed away the outpouring of grief on social media that followed.

title: Paraglide Over Peru in 360
description: Take a ride in 360 degrees with the paraglider Ricardo Mares, who is a regular over Limas cliffs.

title: Walter Shaubs Ethics Recommendations for the Government
description: The federal governments ethics agency has rarely received much attention in Washington. That changed with the arrival of President Trump and an administration stocked with unusually wealthy appointees who have ties to industries they now help regulate. Suddenly, the usually sleepy Office of Government Ethics was clashing with the White House.

title: This New York Love Story Subverts Its Happily Ever After
description: THE CHANGELING By Victor LaValle 431 pp. Spiegel & Grau. $28.

title: What Statistics Cant Explain About Life on Parole
description: Last Saturday my family and I took the ferry to Governors Island, where we happened upon a gallery hosting an exhibit, Escaping Time: Art From U.S. Prisons.

title: U.S. to Paris for $400? What Money Buys on the New Low-Cost Airlines
description: Perhaps youve been intrigued by the affordable (and in some cases downright cheap) fares being dangled lately by low-cost, long-haul carriers like Norwegian, Level and XL Airways. Fleeting introductory fares for a handful of cities are one thing, but everyday fares in and out of major hubs are another.

title: A Defender of the Constitution, With No Legal Right to Live Here
description: LOS ANGELES  She spends her days preparing legal strategies to help undocumented immigrants stay in the country. But at any moment, Lizbeth Mateo could be picked up for deportation herself. She is an immigration lawyer with her own immigration lawyer.

title: Departing Ethics Chief: U.S. Is Close to a Laughingstock
description: WASHINGTON  Actions by President Trump and his administration have created a historic ethics crisis, the departing head of the Office of Government Ethics said. He called for major changes in federal law to expand the power and reach of the oversight office and combat the threat.

title: For Four Days, She Was at His Side as He Descended Into Madness
description: She told him it was all in his head. No one was out to get him. No one was at the door. Those lights were from passing cars  not coded language that he said he alone could understand. She tried to steer him to hospitals, into ambulances and toward help.

title: The Cost of a Hot Economy in California: A Severe Housing Crisis
description: SACRAMENTO  A full-fledged housing crisis has gripped California, marked by a severe lack of affordable homes and apartments for middle-class families. The median cost of a home here is now a staggering $500,000, twice the national cost. Homelessness is surging across the state.

title: The Top Jobs in Trumps Administration Are Mostly Vacant: Whos to Blame?
description: President Trump has filled far fewer top jobs in cabinet or cabinet-level agencies than President Barack Obama had at this point in his presidency, according to a New York Times analysis.

title: Where Else Does the U.S. Have an Infrastructure Problem? Antarctica
description: McMURDO STATION, Antarctica  The American research station on the edge of this frozen continent may look like a mining camp in the wilderness, but it is actually one of the glories of American science.

title: Can Psychedelics Be Therapy? Allow Research to Find Out
description: In the last few years, calls for marijuana to be researched as a medical therapy have increased. It may be time for us to consider the same for psychedelic drugs.
