title: Trumps Fury Erodes His Relationship With Sessions, an Early Ally
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps staff is used to his complaints about Attorney General Jeff Sessions, but the Republican senators who attended a White House dinner on Monday were stunned to hear him criticize the man who was once Mr. Trumps most loyal supporter in the Senate.

title: Long Workdays May Be Bad for Your Heart
description: Working long hours may increase the risk for atrial fibrillation, or irregular heartbeats that can lead to serious cardiovascular complications, a new study in The European Heart Journal found.

title: At Age 15 (or So) They Shoot, They Score, and Millions Watch
description: Some of the best teenage basketball talent in the country went to a gymnasium in Manhattan on a Friday night in April to show what they could do, and some of the countrys best-known coaches  Villanovas Jay Wright, Georgetowns Patrick Ewing, Notre Dames Mike Brey  had turned up to see the show. And so when it came time for the weekends marquee matchup, the coaches watched particular players, and the players sneaked glances at particular coaches.

title: Has Sexism Become Worse After the Election?
description: The New York Times Opinion section would like to hear from women about whether they think sexism has become worse since the U.S. presidential election.

title: India Picks Ram Nath Kovind, of Caste Once Called Untouchables, as President
description: NEW DELHI  A Dalit was elected Indias 14th president on Thursday, a rare achievement for a member of a community once known as untouchables and one of the most deprived groups in India.

title: Finding the Date on a Map Image
description: Q. Is there any way to tell the age of a photo used in Google Maps Street View?

title: 2 Leading Online Black Markets Are Shut Down by Authorities
description: The American and European authorities said on Thursday that they had shut down two of the largest online black markets, AlphaBay and Hansa Market, and arrested their operators.

title: Exxon Mobil Fined for Violating Sanctions on Russia
description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department on Thursday fined Exxon Mobil $2 million for violating sanctions that the United States imposed on Russia in 2014 while Rex W. Tillerson, now the secretary of state, was the oil companys chief executive.

title: Review: Dunkirk Is a Tour de Force War Movie, Both Sweeping and Intimate
description: One of the most indelible images in Dunkirk, Christopher Nolans brilliant new film, is of a British plane in flames. The movie recounts an early, harrowing campaign in World War II that took place months after Germany invaded Poland and weeks after Hitlers forces started rolling into the Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg and France. The plane, having glided to a stop, has been defiantly set ablaze by the pilot to avoid its being captured. Its an image of unambiguous defeat but also an emblem of resistance and a portent of the ghastly conflagrations still to come.

title: When Syria Came to Fresno: Refugees Test Limits of Outstretched Hand
description: FRESNO, Calif.  The police responded to a call about a loud party on East San Ramon Avenue, but it wasnt just any party: A sheep was reportedly being slaughtered in a backyard.

title: Daily Report: Can Facebook Woo Back Publishers?
description: The publishing industrys relationship with Facebook has always had a certain scorpion-and-frog quality to it.

title: Jeff Sessions Not Stepping Down
description: Attorney General Jeff Sessions deflected questions about whether he can continue to serve in his post after President Trump in a New York Times interview took him to task for recusing himself from the Russia investigation.

title: Beijing Wants A.I. to Be Made in China by 2030
description: SHANGHAI  If Beijing has its way, the future of artificial intelligence will be made in China.

title: Cheap Date Alert: Met Operas, Screened for Free
description: One of New York Citys great cheap-date opportunities  the Metropolitan Operas annual free screenings of operas on Lincoln Center Plaza  will return on Aug. 25 with Ingmar Bergmans film of Mozarts The Magic Flute followed by 10 nights of Met performances.

title: A Sensor on Your Skin That Looks and Feels Like a Temporary Tattoo
description: Temporary tattoos arent just for style anymore. Scientists have developed a new wearable sensor that looks and feels like a henna tattoo but can monitor electrical muscle activity and body temperature, too.

title: The Secret Service Calls for Backup on Its Other Job
description: HOOVER, Ala.  The classrooms, tucked above a municipal court here in the Birmingham suburbs, are a long way from the White House. But walk through a set of secured doors and into the futuristic-looking work space, and you will find an important wager by the agency best known for protecting presidents, the Secret Service.

title: 5 Reads for Comic-Con Fans
description: Whether or not youre in San Diego for the convention you can get into the Comic-Con spirit by exploring these travel options.

title: Getty Museum Buys Art by Michelangelo, Parmigianino and More
description: LOS ANGELES  The Getty Museum has made the biggest financial outlay for art in its history, buying 16 drawings and one painting by artists including Michelangelo, Parmigianino and Watteau from an unidentified British collector.

title: Israeli Aid Gives an Unexpected Glimmer of Hope for Syrians
description: GOLAN HEIGHTS  Quietly, over the last year, hundreds of sick Syrian children and their chaperones have been whisked across enemy lines at dawn for treatment at clinics in Israel, slipping back home after dark.

title: A Diva Who Is Not Above Walking 3,100 Miles
description: On a recent weekday, a woman in hot pink exercise wear and a matching fedora strode briskly but effortlessly down a sidewalk alongside the Grand Central Parkway in Jamaica, Queens.

title: As Brexit Clock Ticks, U.K. Seems Adrift
description: LONDON  One was accused of trying to sabotage Britains exit from the European Union and of treating colleagues like pirates who have taken him prisoner. Two others were described as dangerous and deranged. As for the man leading Londons talks on Brexit, he has been called lazy as a toad and vain as Narcissus, and his colleagues government morons.

title: Is Everyone in Politics Writing a Tell-All? Yes
description: If you are still processing Barack Obamas presidency and the 2016 election, an abundance of upcoming political books will help you along. Some are expected and have already gotten much press  both Obamas have book deals, as do Joe and Jill Biden; Hillary Clinton has a book out this fall, and James Comeys was announced this week. Some are more surprising. In March, the White House florist, Laura Dowling, published a book featuring photos of the arrangements she created during her tenure, while Alyssa Mastromonaco, who served as President Obamas deputy chief of staff, wrote a memoir that is being adapted by Mindy Kaling. And there are even more to come  from a former stenographer and campaign associates, as well as reporters who were on the ground. Here is a list of everyone (so far) who will be memorializing the former administration and President Donald Trumps subsequent election.

title: 969 NYC Coffee
description: At a Japanese caf in Queens, find rice balls, imported corn croquettes and other treats.

title: A Jackson Heights Oasis for Japanese Snacks: 969 NYC Coffee
description: Steps from the hustle of Roosevelt Avenue in Jackson Heights, Queens, past signs in Spanish for low shipping rates, amulets and shamanic baths, Mitsumine Oda quietly makes onigiri (rice balls) shaped like hearts.

title: Crime in England and Wales Is Rising at Fastest Rate in a Decade
description: LONDON  A man was thrown onto a busy road and repeatedly stabbed by gang members after leaving a concert in South London. A teenage boy was attacked and killed by two machete-wielding assailants, and two moped riders carried out five acid attacks across East London within 90 minutes.

title: Part of Hudson Yards Tunnels Is Nearly Done. Now It Sits, Unused.
description: Its an active construction site, hard hat and harness required, but the two tubes under the rising towers of the sprawling Hudson Yards development on the Far West Side of Manhattan are relatively peaceful. The nine-foot thick concrete walls, floors and ceilings are all smoothed over, humming with the whir of ventilation ducts and the low buzz of battery-powered LED lighting.

title: Senate Leaders Press for Health Care Vote, but on Which Bill?
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republicans ended a demoralizing week on Thursday with their leaders determined to press ahead with a vote to begin debating health care next week, but with little progress on securing the votes and no agreement even on which bill to take up.

title: Jake Paul, a Reality Villain for the YouTube Generation
description: The reality-show villain has evolved. Ladies and gentlemen, meet the YouTube villain.

title: Trump Made Several Misleading Claims in Times Interview
description: WASHINGTON  In a wide-ranging interview with The New York Times on Wednesday, President Trump made a number of misleading and false claims, including statements on health insurance, the biography of his deputy attorney general and French history.

title: When the Copy Desk Was the Heart of the Newspaper
description: As the deadline nears for Times newsroom employees to apply for a buyout, it is already clear that the elimination of free-standing copy desks will be a wrenching change.

title: On Reddit, Intimate Glimpses of Addicts in Thrall to Opioids
description: Every day, thousands of people who are consumed by the nations opioid epidemic connect on the popular discussion website Reddit.

title: Kamala Harris and Rand Paul: To Shrink Jails, Lets Reform Bail
description: Kalief Browder, a 16-year-old New Yorker, was arrested on charges of stealing a backpack in 2010. To ensure he would show up for trial, and because of a previous offense, the judge set bail at $3,000. But his family could not afford to pay. So Mr. Browder was sent to jail on Rikers Island to await his day in court. He spent the next three years there before the charges were dismissed. Haunted by his experience, Mr. Browder hanged himself in 2015.

title: Laptop Ban on Planes Is Lifted, U.S. Officials Confirm
description: The laptop ban is over.

title: A Bill Funding Arts and Humanities Endowments Passes House Committee
description: Four months after President Trump proposed eliminating the cultural agencies altogether, a bill to continue to finance the National Endowment for the Arts and the National Endowment for the Humanities won approval this week from the House appropriations committee.

title: Why All Shareholder Voices, Even Passive Ones, Matter
description: The popularity of index funds and passive investing strategies continues to grow in America. Their collective assets have swelled to more than $6 trillion in recent years. This surge has reignited the long-running debate about whether active or passive investment approaches should reign supreme in todays financial world.

title: A Cheap Fix for Climate Change? Pay People Not to Chop Down Trees
description: The tropical forests in western Uganda, home to a dwindling population of endangered chimpanzees, are disappearing at some of the fastest rates on Earth as local people chop down trees for charcoal and to clear space for subsistence farming.

title: He Spent His Life in Theater. Heres What He Left Behind.
description: The boxes are stacked high in a closet, just down the hall from where James Houghtons office had been, filled with keepsakes from a life in the theater.

title: Parents Who Gifted a Daughter to Man Are Sentenced
description: It was a disturbing story, told in a Pennsylvania courtroom: a girl and her five sisters, living in virtual sex slavery for years, starting when one of the girls was just 7. The defendants were their parents, who had fallen under the influence of a child rapist who cast himself as a prophet and took care of their finances after they left the Amish faith.

title: Codependent No More ... Yet Wanting Back In
description: I was very close with a couple for 12 years. I considered them family. Sadly, the husband drank to excess daily. He then became verbally abusive to his wife and dismissed his familys concerns. So the wife asked me to intervene. I wrote him a letter about how his drinking was affecting his relationships. He acknowledged it but continued to drink. I withdrew; I couldnt tolerate the abuse of his wife. This was a few years ago. I still send them emails. The wife replies; the husband doesnt. But I miss their friendship greatly. Is there a way to resurrect it?

title: 29 Minutes From New York to Washington? Elon Musk Teases a New Hyperloop
description: With a tweet and very little else by way of detail, the entrepreneur Elon Musk on Thursday raised the prospect of speedy, hassle-free travel along the busy section of the Eastern Seaboard between New York and Washington, D.C.

title: Central Bankers Play Waiting Game on Inflation
description: Central banking increasingly looks like an act of faith.

title: President Trumps Bombshell Interview
description: To the Editor:

title: Burundi Robotics Team Vanishes After U.S. Competition
description: WASHINGTON  The police were searching on Thursday for six African teenagers who were reported missing from an international robotics competition in Washington. Two of them were said to have been seen crossing into Canada, law enforcement officials said.

title: Copyright Case Over Richard Prince Instagram Show to Go Forward
description: Richard Prince, who has pushed the legal limits of artistic appropriation for decades, will continue to fight for his art in court. This week, a federal judge in New York refused to throw out a photographers lawsuit against Mr. Prince over Mr. Princes use of an image in an exhibition. The case will continue, and could set a precedent for how the fair-use doctrine relates to Instagram, the photo-sharing app.

title: Chester Bennington, Linkin Park Singer, Is Dead at 41
description: Chester Bennington, the ferocious lead singer for the platinum-selling hard rock band Linkin Park, was found dead in his home near Los Angeles on Thursday. He was 41.

title: Where to Stream Christopher Nolans 9 Pre-Dunkirk Movies
description: The Hans Zimmer score for the new Christopher Nolan film, Dunkirk, suggests the ticktock of a stopwatch as a form of percussion  deliberate during the pregnant quiet as trapped British soldiers peer up at the sky, frantic during the lead-up to a bombing raid by German warplanes. The entire film has a pleasing metronomic composition, with three separate story lines that unfold over different timelines and overlap at meaningful junctures. There may be little connecting Dunkirk, a sweeping historical re-creation, to Following, Nolans low-budget feature debut, but his awareness of time  of its elasticity, of its effect on memory, of its potential for dramatic weaponization  is a critical through-line.

title: The Author of I Love Dick  on One Crazy Coincidence
description: In this series for T, Emily Spivack, the author of Worn Stories, interviews creative types about their most prized possessions.

title: In a Cruel Summer for the G.O.P., Things Are Starting to Feel Incoherent
description: WASHINGTON  For Republicans  who control every corner of this city  this should be a time of elation, running up the score on accomplishments.

title: Why Fight Solar Power?
description: To the Editor:

title: Offshore Drilling Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: Danny Meyers Empire Goes Roman With an Indoor Piazza
description: Danny Meyers infatuation with Rome goes back to his time there as a college student. Now the prolific restaurateur is about to open a small outpost of the Eternal City on the ground floor of a hotel in the NoMad neighborhood.

title: In Jewels, This Ballerina Rules the Stage Like a Glittering Temptress
The Men Who Never Have to Grow Up
description: It was early summer, and the wealthy politicians son was in trouble. Hed done something terrible, possibly criminal, something that would almost certainly derail his future and harm his family.

title: What the Decline of the Dollar Means
description: The value of the dollar has fallen steadily since the beginning of 2017, erasing a sharp rise immediately after President Trumps election.

title: Mets Say Asdrubal Cabrera May Have More Suitors as a Third Baseman
description: For sale: One major league infielder, 31 years old, nine years experience, decent bat, soft hands, would prefer to play shortstop but capable of playing second and third base as well. Inquire Sandy Alderson, Citi Field, Flushing, N.Y.

title: Turkeys Arrest of German Activist Heightens Nations Tensions
description: BERLIN  Germany told its citizens on Thursday to exercise caution when traveling to Turkey and warned that it might cut off export insurance guarantees and other forms of economic cooperation, the latest step in the deterioration of relations between the two powers.

title: O.J. Simpson, John McCain, Ram Nath Kovind: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Alan Moore Is Preparing a Six-Part Finale for Extraordinary Gentlemen
description: The adventures of the League of Extraordinary Gentlemen are coming to an end.

title: Where to Stream Christopher Nolans 9 Pre-Dunkirk Movies
description: Before Dunkirk, the director made nine films that, viewed in sequential order, demonstrate the continuity of his vision. All are available to stream.

title: Pope Francis External Focus
description: To the Editor:

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
description: Through Aug. 19. 80WSE Gallery, 80 Washington Square East, Manhattan; 212-998-5747, steinhardt.nyu.edu/80wse.

title: Wonderful Addition or Mess, Video Replay Heads to M.L.S.
description: PARK CITY, Utah  The referee on the soccer field had just awarded a penalty kick, but he would not learn whether it was justified unless a man sitting in a modular trailer beyond the end line told him so. That man, Kevin Terry Jr., pressed a button glowing purple to replay the incident, then scooted forward to assess the play on a 27-inch tablet.

title: Nighttime Traffic Noise in Manhattan
description: To the Editor:

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: No matter how much free time you have this weekend, we have TV recommendations for you. Come back every Friday for new suggestions from our TV critic on what to watch.

title: Bronx Science Coach Sentenced to 7 Years in Child Pornography Case
description: In a courtroom packed with family and friends, a former teacher and debate coach at one of New York Citys most selective high schools was sentenced in federal court on Thursday to seven years in prison for having received child pornography.

title: 6 Simple Mens Sneakers
description: The recent Dries Van Noten mens show featured rubber-soled plimsolls that conveyed a youthful spirit and paired well with creased trousers and muted blazers. For the months ahead, here are six simple renditions of this classic canvas shoe.

title: Review: In While I Was Waiting, a Man and a Country in Limbo
description: Political theater, with its tendency toward hectoring and grandiosity, is hard to credit these days. After all, both politics and theater have been with us for centuries, barely making an inch of difference in the tide of human brutality. While I Was Waiting, a subtly harrowing play by Mohammad Al Attar that opened on Wednesday in a Lincoln Center Festival production, gets around the problem by embracing failure as its central subject: the failure of government, yes, but also of resistance. As a character named Omar says, How can nothing have changed, after all that happened?

title: Help! My 3-Year-Old Is Obsessed With Trump
description: My 3-year-old daughter is obsessed with Donald Trump.

title: Everything You Need to Understand About Trump and Russia
description: Donald Trump apparently wanted to set the record straight on the Kremlin Kaper in the strange interview he gave this week to The New York Times. Thank goodness for that, because the story line was getting hard to follow.

title: Review: Valerian Is a Rave in Space (but Not Much Fun)
description: Much as I hesitate to predict the future in such crazy times, I feel I can say with certainty that 2017 will go down in film history as the Year of the Crazy Dane DeHaan Movie. Already so far we have seen Mr. DeHaan, a 31-year-old actor endowed with poise, intelligence and superb eyebrows, in Gore Verbinskis highly puzzling A Cure for Wellness. If you missed that one, it was more or less The Magic Mountain with incest and bloodsucking eels.

title: Benefits by the Shore
description: Fundraisers were held last week for the Parrish Art Museum, Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation, Dancers Responding to AIDS and Lambda Legal.

title: Review: In Amnesia, Finding Inner German Peace on a Spanish Isle
description: Inner peace and reconciliation  as well as historical memory and its burden  are at the heart of Barbet Schroeders drama Amnesia. The story is simple, the emotions complex. It takes a while for the true depth of all the complicated, confusing feelings to surface, partly because the movies most interesting character, the German-born Martha (Marthe Keller), has done a good job of barricading off part of her being. But dont weep too hard for her: Shes built that wall in enviable splendor on the Spanish island of Ibiza, where she lives alone in a white house overlooking the blue, blue Mediterranean.

title: Benefits by the Shore
description: The Parrish Art Museum in Water Mill, N.Y., held its summer gala on July 15. The Rush Philanthropic Arts Foundation raised more than $1.1 million at its July 15 benefit at Fairview Farm in Bridgehampton, N.Y. The Fire Island Dance Festival, on behalf of Dancers Responding to AIDS, took place on July 15 at the Pines Club. And Lambda Legal, an organization for lesbians, gays, bisexuals, transgender people and those living with H.I.V., gave a benefit on July 15 at a private home in Fire Island Pines.

title: Review: A Poor, Little Rich Maharajah in Black Prince
description: At the beginning of Kavi Razs The Black Prince we hear in a stentorian voice-over that the Lion of Punjab, a Sikh king, was fearsome, fearless and feared. Alas, the poor Black Prince, son of the Lion  in Mr. Razs movie hes muddled, moody and even a bit mousy.

title: A British Open Lesson: Golf Is a Sport of Personal Responsibility
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Jordan Spieth stood over a six-foot birdie putt on his last hole to tie the first-round record at the British Open at Royal Birkdale on Thursday. In 1983, Craig Stadler opened with a 64, and the next three times the tournament was held here, nobody started better.

title: Review: Kekszakallu Plunges Into the Unknown
description: The Argentine film Kekszakallu seems designed as a test of how little the director, Gastn Solnicki, can derive from the Hungarian composer Bela Bartoks only opera, Bluebeards Castle, while still citing it as his inspiration.

title: Review: The Girl Without Hands Tells a Dark Tale, Boldly
description: Sbastien Laudenbachs The Girl Without Hands is an animated adaptation of the Brothers Grimm fairy tale of the same title. Although this films style is soft and colorful, it does not rub out the emotional sharpness of a story dealing with betrayal, suicide and death.

title: Review: In The Untamed, Close Encounters. No, Even Closer.
description: Resolutely unsmiling and studiously austere, The Untamed behaves like a quiet horror movie with a lot on its mind. Its main characters, who live in the central Mexican city of Guanajuato, are young, gloomy, attractive men and women connected by friendship, family ties and sexual longing and divided by those same things. The movie, directed by Amat Escalante from a script he wrote with Gibrn Portela, might be a dour, observant study of modern relationships among the urban middle class were it not for the presence of a slimy, many-tentacled space creature living in a cabin in the countryside.

title: Review: Killing Ground Will Make You Rethink That Camping Trip
description: Killing Ground features a man and a woman who make head-slappingly dumb choices as they flee from a pair of killers who are just as inept. Yet in the end, the most regrettable decision may be that of audience members who fork over money to see the movie.

title: Review: In Landline, the Family That Strays Together
description: Nostalgia is not what it used to be. Landline, a fairly genial, diffident comedy about diffident, fairly generic people, plants its flag in 1995 and surveys a landscape of indie rock, Must See TV and the high-waisted bluejeans that have recently started coming back into fashion. Hillary Clinton is on television, sporting a hairband and a pink suit.

title: Review: Romeo Is Bleeding, and Shakespeare Is Relevant
description: This aint got nothing to do with my life, Dont Clark recalled thinking when, at 15, he picked up Romeo and Juliet. At 22, after years of seeing gang warfare and murder on the streets of his hometown, Richmond, Calif., he changed his mind. That is our story, he now says of the play. Its just told in Verona. In a different language, a different time period.

title: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: Our recommendations this week include fare for readers of all ages and stages, starting with Welcome: A Mo Willems Guide for New Arrivals, a witty life manual for savvy infants and their attendant grown-ups. Questions Asked taps the philosophical tendencies of 5-year-olds and up  all the way up  by venturing playfully into unanswerable territory: Can anyone do real magic tricks? Do miracles happen sometimes? A debut Y.A. novel by Andrew McCarthy delves into a 15-year-old girls discovery of a family secret. And two books on Jane Austen explore her work, her stuff, her suitors and her legacy.

title: Review: Netflix Is in the Woods With Ozark
description: Have you been missing Walter White? Are nine-year-old Breaking Bad episodes not satisfying your hunger for angry, middle-aged, white male antiheroes?

title: Review: The Midwife Is Unflappable, Until the Past Blows In
description: Catherine Deneuve has played a wide variety of roles over the course of a career now spanning seven decades. But despite her exemplary range, many American viewers maintain an image of her as an aloof, exquisite, possibly imperious, possibly enigmatic beauty. This is largely because she looks like, well, Catherine Deneuve. The woman cant help it. Even when portraying the needy, nearly shambolic Batrice in The Midwife, Ms. Deneuve is capable of vibrating with an elegance that implies both hauteur and froideur.

title: Officer Accused of Excessive Force in Arrest of James Blake Spurns Plea Deal
description: A New York police officer who tackled the retired tennis player James Blake outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel in a case of mistaken identity has decided not to take a deal that would have spared him a public disciplinary trial on charges of using excessive force during the 2015 encounter.

title: Review: The Pulitzer at 100 Celebrates Awards More Than Winners
description: Although the Pulitzer Prizes go to literature and drama, they still dont recognize cinema. But adding movies to the list might only raise questions. Who would judge? Should fiction and documentary receive separate awards?

title: Review: The Fencer Is an Inspiring Figure in a Formulaic Tale
description: Inspirational teachers arent limited to any one time or place. The Fencer, a Finnish-Estonian-German coproduction drawn from a true story, may be set in Estonia in the early 1950s, when the Soviet Union occupied the country, but it follows squarely in the footsteps of Dead Poets Society and Stand and Deliver.

title: Review: Out of Luck, and Seeking a Strongman in Mister Universo
description: The filmmaking team of Tizza Covi and Rainer Frimmel concoct fictional narratives around the real lives and professions of the nonactors with whom they work. This is an unusual formula but not an entirely novel one. While other examples of this method, or some variant of it, have yielded films that come off as condescending or creepily exploitative, Ms. Covi and Mr. Frimmels Mister Universo is a disarming and humane picture, an unexpected delight.

title: Review: In Disneys Descendants 2, the Kids Are on Their Own
description: The kids are largely on their own in Descendants 2, a sequel to the 2015 television movie about the children of Disney villains. That makes for a dumber film, but the target audience for this colorful tuneful fluff wont care and may even consider it an improvement.

title: Bowie Knives and a Tick Head: Marketing Gets Elaborate at Comic-Con
description: SAN DIEGO  A woman clad entirely in white greeted me with a robotic smile and a warning. This may be disorienting, she said. Are you O.K. with that? Inside a nearby display case were Old West weapons, including a sawed-off shotgun and a bowie knife. Please select one, she said brightly.

title: Review: A Bullied Boy Gets a Hunting Lesson in First Kill
description: First Kill, a decently executed but generic thriller, is most notable for advancing the dubious theory that the best way to help a child who is being bullied is to traumatize the heck out of him.

title: Whats New in NYC Theater
description: Our guide to plays and musicals coming to New York stages  and a few last-chance picks of shows that are about to close. Our reviews of open shows are at nytimes.com/reviews/theater.

title: Pop, Rock and Jazz in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to pop and rock shows and the best of live jazz.

title: Cecil the Lions Son Xanda Killed by a Trophy Hunter
description: Two years after Cecil the Lion was killed in a national park in Zimbabwe, sparking international outrage, his son Xanda was killed in a trophy hunt.

title: Inside the World of Brad Thor
description: The striped towels, deck chairs and palm fronds outside Rockefeller Center lent the Today Show set a distinctive summer vibe as Matt Lauer told viewers, The Fourth of July weekends almost here, that means beaches, barbecues and books. The thriller writer Brad Thor, a regular guest, brandished a copy of his own latest volume, Use of Force.

title: Classical Music in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Valerian
description: Luc Besson narrates a sequence from "Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets" featuring Dane DeHaan and Cara Delevingne.

title: In an East Harlem Park, Valentine or Voodoo?
description: On a leafy side street in East Harlem is a small park with a wrought-iron gate holding a heart-shaped design. To most, the heart is a charming architectural flourish, but to others, like Migene Gonzlez-Wippler, it is indisputable proof of occult activity.

title: City Councilman Convicted of Stealing Thousands in Public Funds
description: An embattled New York City councilman was found guilty on Thursday of stealing more than $30,000 in public funds that were meant for charity and campaign expenditures.

title: Comedy in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.

title: Luc Besson Narrates a Scene From Valerian
description: The science-fiction Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets, starring Dane DeHaan in the title role, has moments of blissful calm. This scene isnt one of them. Here, Valerian is on a mission to catch up with some alien characters quickly. The fastest way to get to them is to burst through a wall as well as many of the worlds in the metropolis of Alpha (the city of the title).

title: Dance in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to dance performances.

title: The Fading Trump Bump
description: On MSNBCs Morning Joe on Thursday, I presented charts explaining that while President Trump has been dispatching self-congratulatory tweets about his economic stewardship, he has little to brag about, apart from the stock market. The economy continues to grow and add jobs at roughly the same rate it did under President Barack Obama.

title: Glitch in Your Travel Plans? Share Your Story
description: The New York Times is collecting anecdotes from readers who have witnessed evidence of heightened tension at airports across the United States.

title: Film Series in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Senate, O.J. Simpson, Linkin Park: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Art and Museums in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

title: Deer Caught in the Headlights? Your Car May Soon See Them
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  One morning in early June, Jim LaPointe was driving on the outskirts of this Michigan city when a deer bounded across the road in front of his Ford Fusion.

title: Events for Children in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.

title: At British Open, Caddie Hands Rory McIlroy a Spark
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Youre Rory McIlroy, the caddie J. P. Fitzgerald told his player. What are you doing?

title: Did Firefighters Start or End 1863 Draft Riots  or Both?
description: Q. The film Gangs of New York suggests a group of volunteer firefighters started the draft riots of July 1863. Is that true?

title: Long-Suffering Texas Democrats Suffer On as Lawmakers Meet
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  On the opening day of a special legislative session here Tuesday, a small circle of women stood in the Texas heat near the south steps of the Capitol, making soft, sweet and rebellious music.

title: Kenneth Jay Lane, Jewelry Designer Who Made a Fortune Faking It, Dies at 85
description: Kenneth Jay Lane, the designer and bon vivant who built a global business from glittering acts of unabashed deception, producing fake and junk jewelry  or, as he liked to say, tongue in cheek, faque and junque  has died at his home in Manhattan. He was 85.

title: Coney Island, Ever Changing
description: I once started out to walk around the world, the poet Lawrence Ferlinghetti wrote, but ended up in Brooklyn. Where he ended up, specifically, was Coney Island, a particular swath of America where Jellybeans glowed in the semi-gloom and he learned to fall in love with unreality.

title: Our Jersey Boy
description: Theres a calm sea breeze billowing near the New Jersey bureau of The New York Times, just offshore enough for some surfable summer waves. Theres also a decent Wi-Fi signal, the occasional parade, a basil and herb farm and a new roller coaster, though the cream-on-brown interior could use a more modern, pleasant upholstery.

title: M.T.A. Chief Calls on New York City to Give More to Help Subway System
description: With New York Citys transportation system in a state of crisis, the head of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority said on Thursday that it was time for City Hall to contribute more money to repairing and maintaining the subway system that is the lifeblood of the city.

title: Trump Picks Richard Grenell, Former Diplomatic Aide, as Envoy to Germany
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has offered the post of United States ambassador to Germany to Richard Grenell, a former diplomatic aide to President George W. Bush and a Republican strategist who once worked for Senator John McCain, two people briefed on the conversation said on Thursday.

title: Confederate Poses Test Over Race for Game of Thrones Creators and HBO
description: It was supposed to be HBOs next big thing: a high-concept drama from the creators of Game of Thrones, set in an alternate America, where the Southern states had seceded from the Union and slavery continued into the present day.

title: Le CiNMa Club Presents Its Movie of the Week. What?
description: One certainty of watching movies on streaming services is uncertainty. Its difficult to know when some movies are going to show up on specific sites and, even more crucial, when theyre going to be dropped from a site. A subscriber may find an attractive prospect, put it on a watch list and then later see that its no longer available. Like in that old Dion song, you just looked around, and its gone.

title: John McCains Brain Cancer, and Mine
description: Millions of Americans will be wondering how Senator John McCain is coping with the news that he has an aggressive form of brain cancer known as glioblastoma. I certainly am: I found out that I had the same type of deadly tumor 18 months ago.

title: Picking Up the Tab
description: Dear Diary:

title: Surprised by Dodgers? Well, Its Not Just Overachievers
description: The Dodgers have won a stunning 30 of their last 34 games, including 11 in a row, going into Thursday nights game against the Braves. Their 66-29 record leads all teams and would translate to a 113-win season should they keep it up.

title: Microsoft Is Rewarded for Turning to the Cloud
description: SEATTLE  A few years ago, Microsoft appeared to be another tech has-been, having whiffed on its efforts to compete in mobile phones and internet search. Although it is too soon to say whether Microsoft can pull off a full-blown renaissance the way Apple has, the company is firmly back in favor.

title: Eerie Parallels Between John McCain and Edward Kennedy
description: WASHINGTON  The circumstances are eerily similar. In the middle of contentious health care deliberations, a larger-than-life figure in the Senate learns he has a very serious form of brain cancer. A leading voice goes quiet and the Senate suffers for it.

title: U.S. Reopens Harley Settlement, Cutting Funds for Pollution Reduction Plan
description: Last year the United States government fined Harley-Davidson $15 million for selling devices that shut down its motorcycles emissions controls  and said part of that money would go toward a project to reduce pollution from wood-fired stoves.

title: Woman Shot by Minneapolis Officer Didnt Have to Die, Police Chief Says
description: MINNEAPOLIS  The mayor and the police chief of this city said on Thursday that Justine Damond, an unarmed Australian woman killed last weekend by a Minneapolis police officer, should not have been shot. The blunt and public critiques were the strongest condemnations yet from officials here, but the mayor and the chief stopped short of calling the shooting legally unjustified.

title: Years After Sons Killing on Busy Street, Trial Brings Mother No Solace
description: For two months, the mother of Brandon L. Woodard, a California man openly killed on a busy street in Midtown, has sat in Part 42 of State Supreme Court in Manhattan, taking notes on an assortment of pads and a worn calendar.

title: Trump Aides, Seeking Leverage, Investigate Muellers Investigators
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps lawyers and aides are scouring the professional and political backgrounds of investigators hired by the special counsel Robert S. Mueller III, looking for conflicts of interest they could use to discredit the investigation  or even build a case to fire Mr. Mueller or get some members of his team recused, according to three people with knowledge of the research effort.

title: In the Bronx, Fighting for the Right to Play
description: Running water, squealing children, a Bronx street planted in the heart and heat of a July morning. All together, summers trumpets sounded bright and loud Thursday along 196th Street in the Bronx, despite official indifference or bumbling.

title: President Trumps Contempt for the Rule of Law
description: In less than an hour on Wednesday afternoon, President Trump found a way to impugn the integrity and threaten the livelihoods of nearly all of the countrys top law enforcement officials, including some he appointed, for one simple reason: They swore an oath to defend the Constitution, not him.

title: Saudi Official Who Was Thought to Be Under House Arrest Receives a Promotion
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Saudi Arabia announced on Thursday a big promotion for a veteran security officer who United States officials recently said was without a job and confined to his home.

title: Chester Bennington Brought Rock Ferocity to Linkin Parks Innovations
description: Beginning in 2000, Linkin Park brought the collision of hard rock and hip-hop to its commercial and aesthetic peak, with its lead singer, Chester Bennington, delivering intense, almost physically palpable emotion alongside the grounded rapping of Mike Shinoda.

title: Frequent Fodder for Crossword Clues
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Kids these days, am I right? I happen to be the general manager of two of them, not counting the subcontractors that they call their friends, and the one thing I know is that if I say something is black, they will say that it is white. Just to be contrary. Just to rebel, in their own way. And then they will laugh and teleport off somewhere by doing something to their phones that I dont understand.

title: Another Williams Takes His Turn Before the Camera, at SNY
description: On a recent afternoon in the sun-soaked downtown Manhattan office of SNY, the local sports cable channel, Doug Williams was easy to spot.

title: These Americans Hated the Health Law. Until the Idea of Repeal Sank In.
description: DOYLESTOWN, Pa.  Five years ago, the Affordable Care Act had yet to begin its expansion of health insurance to millions of Americans, but Jeff Brahin was already stewing about it.

title: Quotation of the Day: They Hated the Health Law. Until the Idea of Repeal Sank In.
description: If the condition doesnt kill you, the stress of having it does, in this country.

title: No No. 21 for Todd Frazier. Instead, Hell Settle for No. 29.
description: SEATTLE  The symmetry was too hard for Todd Frazier, the grown-up freckle-faced kid from Toms River, N.J., to ignore.

title: Corrections: July 21, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: ISIS Core Helps Fund Militants in Philippines, Report Says
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  The central command of the Islamic State in Syria has funneled tens of thousands of dollars to militants in the Philippines over the last year, most likely aiding their spectacular seizure of the southern Philippine city of Marawi, a report released Friday said.

title: Trump May Turn to Anthony Scaramucci for White House Communications Post
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump is expected to name Anthony Scaramucci, a major Republican donor and investor, as his new communications director, a senior administration official said on Thursday.

title: Thanks to Venmo, We Now All Know How Cheap Our Friends Are
description: Margaret Pennoyer, an elementary school teacher in Manhattan, had just returned from a bachelorette party in Napa Valley when she received an email that had been sent to all the guests. The two organizers had itemized each womans individual expenses, which they had covered, and requested reimbursement through Venmo, an app that transfers money between users who have linked their bank accounts to their phones. Ms. Pennoyer owed $31.98 to one woman and $20.62 to the other.

title: The 12-Hour Goodbye That Started Everything
description: The first time he slept over was an accident. He came to watch a movie, which for me became an exercise in remaining perfectly still while I focused on the proximity of his legs. After the credits rolled, we talked until dawn. Then he began listing his hesitations about us, even though we had never touched.

title: Traveling to America While Muslim
description: Sulaika Abokor, a Somali-born elementary-school teacher in London, dreams of a road trip from Seattle to California. The 34-year-old was planning a vacation to Seattle this summer to see a friend who was recently married. She fell in love with the green, outdoorsy city when she last visited in 2010. But, because of the Trump administrations travel ban prohibiting most visitors from six predominantly Muslim countries, she now says, Thats not going to happen.

title: Poland, Brexit, O.J. Simpson: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Friday: Ozark and Descendants 2
description: Still longing for the middle-age male angst of Breaking Bad? Check out Ozark, starring Jason Bateman as an angry money launderer. Dunkirk, a BBC docudrama on BritBox, looks back at the World War II escape by British soldiers. And Disney adds some new villain kids to the fairy-tale mix in Descendants 2.

title: Right and Left React to Trumps Interview, Health Care and More
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: For Right-Wing Italian Youth, a Mission to Disrupt Migration
description: MILAN  As dawn broke over a quiet suburb, Lorenzo Fiato lugged a silver suitcase packed with windbreakers and anti-seasickness gum out of the bedroom he had decorated with stickers (Enough Immigration) and shelves filled with medieval knight toy soldiers.

title: Mr. Macron Starts Making Waves
description: Emmanuel Macrons entry to the French presidential stage was about as exciting and theatrical as electoral politics gets. Rising from relative obscurity, he seized the lyse Palace and the National Assembly with huge majorities. He was the wunderkind, at 39 the youngest French head of state since Napolon, promising radical economic change while restoring the presidency to a Jupiterian level, in his words, after the garish bling bling of Nicolas Sarkozy and the tawdry normality of Franois Hollande.

title: Betsy DeVos Is Right: Sexual Assault Policy Is Broken
description: Leading Democrats in Congress, activists and many survivors of sexual assault are up in arms about possible plans by the Department of Education to overhaul federal policies on campus sexual assault instituted by the Obama administration. They say those changes will weaken protections for survivors, that they will embolden misogynist fringe groups and that they will turn back the clock to a time when rape was ignored.

title: The Last Best Empty Place in America
description: At dawn the woodpeckers start in, hammering heads against tree trunks, and you wonder if theres a better way for a bird to make a living. Oh, the avian migraines. Twilight lingers till nearly 11 p.m.; if theres a decent moon, you can fish in the silver light of Montanas longest days.

title: A Republican Health Care Fix
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Imagine a young father stepping into the street. He is alert and conscientious. Then, a government truck speeds around the corner. The man lunges out of the way, but its too late: The truck runs him over, causing serious injury. Absent government misconduct, the man would have been just fine.

title: Republicans Cant Pass Bills
description: There are many different flavors of freedom. For example, there is freedom as capacity and freedom as detachment.

title: Health Care in a Time of Sabotage
description: Is Trumpcare finally dead? Even now, its hard to be sure, especially given Republican moderates long track record of caving in to extremists at crucial moments. But it does look as if the frontal assault on the Affordable Care Act has failed.

title: Why Women Arent C.E.O.s, According to Women Who Almost Were
description: A year ago, dressed in suffragette white and addressing a cheering, weeping convention, Hillary Clinton stood for possibility. Now she is a reminder of the limits women continue to confront  in politics and beyond.

title: Minneapolis Police Shooting of Australian Woman: What Is Known So Far
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Officials in Minneapolis said on Thursday that Justine Damond, an unarmed Australian woman killed last weekend by one of the citys police officers, should not have been shot. The police were responding to a 911 call by Ms. Damond, who had reported an episode she said she feared was a sexual assault.

title: Luis Severino, Again Facing the Best, Holds His Own in Seattle
description: SEATTLE  Perhaps it is just a blip, a small sample size not to be given too much weight. But Luis Severino, who pitched himself into the Yankees rotation in spring training and onto the American League All-Star team by early July, looks as if he has taken another leap forward.

title: Donald Trumps History Lessons
description: WASHINGTON  In December 2015, Steve Bannon, now the presidents chief strategist, told Donald Trump, Youre a student of military history. Flattery will get you everywhere with Trump, but that was a stretch.

title: China Bars Justin Bieber From Performing Over Bad Behavior
description: BEIJING  Justin Biebers Purpose Tour has been called a world apology tour intended to show a more mature side of a pop singer whose antics have drawn embarrassing headlines over the years.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Judge John Hodgman on a Scrabble-Bully Boyfriend
description: Elise writes: My boyfriend, Colin, is a wonderful Scrabble player and often beats me. At the end, he hides the score from me, as he feels that is more sportsmanlike. But I want to know what the score was  win or lose. Is it better to dull the blow by pretending the score doesnt matter, or should he just tell me how the game played out?

title: How to Read Palms
description: When you look at someones hands, you can see their character in an instant, says Mark Seltman, who has been a palm reader for 40 years, mostly at corporate events and parties in Manhattan. Ask the person to hold up both hands, with his or her palms near your eyes. Focus mostly on the dominant hand. Note shapes, proportions and color. Each persons palmar creases are believed to be unique, like fingerprints.

title: New Sentences: From Protomartyrs A Private Understanding
description: This song lyric happens to be based on a true story. According to Peter Guralnicks Careless Love: The Unmaking of Elvis Presley, the singer did in fact see the face of Stalin in a cloud, in 1965, while driving a bus full of associates through Arizona  and he was in fact deeply unsettled. Then he watched as the cloud transformed into the smiling face of Christ, at which point he pulled over the bus and (according to one of those associates) ran out into the desert weeping, in a state of profound spiritual exaltation. This song isnt even the first to be written about the experience: There is also, at the very least, Al Stewarts Elvis at the Wheel, from 2008, which imagines Presley as something like Paul the Apostle on the way to Damascus, shaking in his footsteps/on the dusty desert road.

title: New in Memoir: Lessons in Falling in Love, and 2 Accounts of Its Horrors
description: Marriage takes work. We know, we know! But how do you tell the difference between the work required of any committed relationship and a life sentence of hard labor? A realist might say that if youre happy 51 percent of the time then youre ahead of the game, though anyone whos faced such a conundrum knows its hard to apply a metric to domestic despair  or bliss, for that matter. This summer, two memoirs about marriages that take abrupt and chaos-inducing turns may instill a new appreciation for the placidity (or monotony) of your own partnership. A third book, which attempts to uncover the secrets of lasting intimacy, leaves readers with more questions than answers, but thats pretty much the idea.

title: Obamacare Included Republican Ideas, but the G.O.P. Health Plan Has Left Democrats Out
description: How much input did the opposing party have in shaping the Affordable Care Act versus the Republican health care plan?

title: The 7.2.17 and the 7.9.17 Issues
description: RE: MARINES

title: Foster Care as Punishment: The New Reality of Jane Crow
description: Maisha Joefield thought she was getting by pretty well as a young single mother in Brooklyn, splurging on her daughter, Deja, even though money was tight. When Deja was a baby, she bought her Luvs instead of generic diapers when she could. When her daughter got a little older, Ms. Joefield outfitted the bedroom in their apartment with a princess bed for Deja, while she slept on a pullout couch.

title: The Chess Set on a Table Between Two Chairs
description: John Coltrane once said that he doesnt play jazz; he plays only John Coltrane. Similarly, Mary Jo Bang writes in her own Mary Jo Banguage. She is a beguiling poet who makes beguiling music with a beguiling mind, but what sort of poem is The Chess Set on a Table Between Two Chairs? It almost resists being a poem. Its strange, personal, poemish. And this may be evidence that an entire memoir can be condensed into a single paragraph. Selected by Terrance Hayes

title: Alexandra Fullers Novel of Lakota Culture May Stir the Appropriation Debate
description: QUIET UNTIL THE THAW By Alexandra Fuller 269 pp. The Penguin Press. $25.

title: At a Law Firm that Defended a Child Murderer, an Intern Recalls Her Own Childhood Abuse
description: THE FACT OF A BODY A Murder and a Memoir By Alexandria Marzano-Lesnevich 326 pp. Flatiron Books. $26.99.

title: A Boulder Restaurant Celebrating New-Coloradan Cuisine
description: Colorado was no place to live  at least not for the miners whod gone looking for gold in the Front Range section of the Southern Rockies. The mountains were too rough and the plains looked too much like a desert, The Daily News of Denver wrote in 1882. Men came with the view of making fortunes by mining, and of returning to the States to enjoy it.

title: Paperback Row
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: Grifters, Swindlers and Chumps Headline the Latest in Crime
description: Its Thanksgiving Day in Richard Langes latest novel, THE SMACK (Mulholland/Little, Brown, $26), and Rowan Petty is doing what he always does on a national holiday and every other day  swindling gullible people out of their hard-earned cash. I talk chumps out of their money, admits Petty, a grifter so down on his luck he has to work his current hustle from a crummy hotel on the Reno strip. When Dandy Don OKeefe, a fellow con artist, tips him off about a more lucrative scam in Los Angeles, Petty hits the road with a hooker who calls herself Tinafey and is too cute for words.

title: A Crime Writer Finds the Perfect Setting in Amish Country
description: BUCOLIC EVIL: Word has gotten out that if you write about the Amish, you can sell books. So says a young Amish woman quoted in Valerie Weaver-Zerchers 2013 study, Thrill of the Chaste, about the popularity of Amish-themed romance novels  and, to judge from the success of the crime writer Linda Castillo, whats true of romance is also true of murder. Castillos best-selling Kate Burkholder mysteries feature the police chief of a fictional Amish town, Painters Mill, Ohio; the ninth entry in the series, Down a Dark Road, enters the hardcover fiction list at No. 14.

title: Hearty Helpings From Three Culinary Histories
description: THE POTLIKKER PAPERS A Food History of the Modern South By John T. Edge 370 pp. Penguin Press, $28.

title: Behind the Cover: 7.23.17
description: Jake Silverstein, editor in chief: The story is about the Battle of Mosul, but we decided to zoom in on one person, rather than show the city itself. Hes a Moslawi man whose eyes were injured in a mortar attack. We wanted to emphasize that violence inflicted on human bodies, rather than on masonry buildings, is wars most brutal and lasting effect.

title: Extreme Commuting
description: In 1492, after an arduous voyage aboard Columbuss vessel the Santa Mara, Rodrigo de Triana, a lookout, bellowed, Tierra!

title: A Way to Extend Her W.N.B.A. Career? Opening an Ice Cream Parlor
description: ATLANTA  Some professional athletes (hello, Roger Federer) try to preserve their bodies by skipping a few competitions. Others, like many baseball and basketball players, take a seat on the bench a little more often late in the season if the games are inconsequential.

title: A Broader Sweep
description: A day in the field with immigration enforcers in California, a state hostile to President Trumps efforts to step up deportations.

title: Jessica Williams Charts Her Course: I Know What Id Be Incredible At
description: Can there be more than one Jessica Williams?

title: The Ethics of Adjusting Your Assets to Qualify for Medicaid
description: At any given moment, there is a large group of citizens who want nothing more than to make absolutely certain that they are impoverished enough to qualify for Medicaid sooner rather than later. Someday, you might be one of them.

title: Ties to Cuba Enhance and Entangle Jorge Mass Marlins Bid
description: MIAMI  Throughout his life, Jorge Mas Santos has had a passion for Cuba, family, business and sports.

title: A Drug Maker Spends Big in Washington to Make Itself Heard
description: Two federal investigations  one examining opioid sales, another about a multiple sclerosis drug whose price had soared to $34,000 a vial  were only part of the troubles Mallinckrodt faced as the year began.

title: Trevor Noah Says if Simpson Is a Model Prisoner, Maybe He Should Stay
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Donald Trump, AlphaBay, Linkin Park: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: When the (Empty) Apartment Next Door Is Owned by an Oligarch
description: In Vancouver, British Columbia, the price of a single-family home has soared so fast over the last few years that even many well-paid local workers have been pushed out of the city.

title: Mustache Intact, Salvador Dals Remains Are Exhumed in Paternity Suit
description: When the remains of the Surrealist painter Salvador Dal were exhumed in Spain on Thursday night, forensics experts made a startling discovery: The artists trademark mustache was still intact.

title: How My Son Picked Out My New Best Friend
description: Recently, my best friend Jeanette invited my family over to her house on a quiet evening in our little suburb north of New York City. The grown-ups ate guacamole and chips and sipped wine while the kids ate macaroni and cheese and caused chaos in the living room. It was all thanks to my sons intuitive friendship matchmaking skills.

title: Should We Be Buying Iodized Salt?
description: Q. How important is iodized salt to the American or European diet?

title: Alex, Well Take To Have and to Hold for $1,000
description: The category is: North Meets South.

title: Earthquake in Aegean Sea Kills 2 Tourists
description: ATHENS  A powerful earthquake in the Aegean Sea killed two tourists on the Greek island of Kos early Friday and injured dozens of other people, several seriously, the Greek police said.

title: New York Today: Mysterious Mailboxes
description: Good morning on this sunny Friday.

title: The Daily: Haunted by ISIS
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Australia Seeks to Extend Commercial Fishing in Protected Waters
description: Australia plans to allow fishing across 80 percent of its protected maritime sanctuaries, the government said on Friday in a proposal that would vastly extend commercial activity in the worlds largest marine-reserves network.

title: Morning Agenda: Trump Weighs Financier as Communications Director
description: Anthony Scaramucci has long been one of President Trumps biggest cheerleaders on Wall Street.

title: En Garde! A Summer of Swords in New York
description: Children from across New York learn fencing alongside Olympic champions at the Peter Westbrook Foundation, where building community is as much a part of practice as the fencing. Several of the foundations top students are competing at the FIE World Fencing Championships, which start this week.

title: Byrd Bath: Seven Provisions That Could Disappear From the Senate Health Bill
description: We still dont know what bill Republican senators will take up next week when they turn to health care. There are three versions of the legislation that could be considered, each with slightly different provisions.

title: How Arline Jacoby, Artist, Spends Her Sundays
description: Arline Jacoby is an artist, art teacher and founder of the Roosevelt Island Visual Art Association (RIVAA), a collective of about 35 artists who are working to establish an art center on the island. Ms. Jacoby lives alone, in a high-rise above Gallery RIVAA on Roosevelt Island, where she has been a resident for over 30 years. When asked her birth date, she demurred. I dont tell people because then they judge you, she said. And Im much more capable than my age.

title: Summer Reading Contest, Week 6 | What Interested You Most in The Times This Week? Why?
description: Update: Winners for this week have been announced.

title: U.N. Agency Reports Worst Drought in 16 Years in North Korea
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea is suffering its worst drought in 16 years, a United Nations agency reported on Friday, raising fears of worsening food shortages in the country, where children and other vulnerable groups have been malnourished for years.

title: Beyonc Statue at Madame Tussauds Is Adjusted After Criticism
description: Beyonc took a quick break from the public eye  but now, shes back.

title: U.S. to Bar Americans From Traveling to North Korea
description: ASPEN, Colo.  The Trump administration said on Friday that it would bar Americans from traveling to North Korea, a month after the death of Otto F. Warmbier, a 22-year-old college student from Ohio who was arrested while trying to leave the country and returned to his parents, more than a year later, in a coma.

title: As O.J. Simpson Wins Parole, a Quick, and Divided, Reaction
description: LOS ANGELES  A generation since O.J. Simpson captured the nations attention when he was tried for a double murder, the former football star stands as someone who unwittingly helped shape the modern news media and popular ideas about the police, race relations and Los Angeles, the city he once called home.

title: The Duchess of Cambridge and Family Refine the Art of Pantone Politics
description: The second European outreach tour by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, which took place this week in Poland and Germany, was notable for a number of reasons.

title: Lyfts John Zimmer on Empowering Others to Help Them Grow
description: This interview with John Zimmer, president of Lyft, a ride-hailing service, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: From Massages to Pawicures, These Resorts Have It All for Pets
description: Keith Clemson, a psychotherapist focused on couples therapy in Washington, worries about his dog when he goes away.

title: California Today: Angelenos and Others on O.J. Simpsons Parole
description: Good morning.

title: Overcoming an Embarrassing Slipup From Years Ago
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Siemens Stops Turbine Sales to Russia in Sanctions Dispute
description: FRANKFURT  A dispute between Berlin and Moscow escalated on Friday after Siemens, the German industrial giant, said it would stop delivering power plant equipment to Russia after gas turbines were moved to the disputed territory of Crimea against the companys wishes.

title: Subway Delays and the Power of Shame
description: Early last Monday, on the 19th day of the New York City subway systems designated state of emergency, on a morning in which ones prevailing hope was to arrive quickly at a polar-chilled office, a track fire erupted near the 145th Street station, on the A line. The system, now 113 years old, does not absorb these disruptions easily; service was halted on several other lines. Nine people were taken to the hospital for treatment of minor injuries. Many morning meetings, it was safe to assume, were sparsely attended.

title: The Heartbreak of a Co-op Rejection
description: Buying an apartment in a co-op is an exercise in financial exhibitionism. A board combs through your bank statements, tax returns and testimonials and then, if you pass muster, grants you access to its cloistered world.

title: Audi to Modify Up to 850,000 Diesel Vehicles as Carmakers Face Backlash
description: Facing a worsening public backlash over accusations they evaded rules on diesel emissions, German automakers have rushed headlong to upgrade their vehicles emissions systems.

title: Silence Equals Complicity in Workplace Sexism
description: Combating sexism in the workplace has become all the rage, and rightly so.

title: Kevin Bacon Knows Youre Gazing at Him
description: After nearly three decades of marriage, Kevin Bacon and Kyra Sedgwick dont believe in leaving their work on the studio lot. So when Ms. Sedgwick prepared for her directorial debut with Lifetimes Story of a Girl, airing on Sunday, July 23, she not only asked Mr. Bacon for his opinion about the project, but she also cast him in it.

title: As Self-Driving Cars Near, Washington Plays Catch-Up
description: Self-driving cars are zooming at breakneck speed toward Americas roadways, and Washington is finally reaching for its seatbelt.

title: After Election, More New Yorkers Tell Volunteer Groups, I Can Help
description: Jonathan Lipsmeyer, a part-time wine buyer, was so upset after Donald J. Trump won the election last year that he volunteered to teach English to Muslim Americans.

title: Helping Young People to Develop Their Own Voices
description: Lesl Honor is the director of youth enrichment at the Rauner Family and West Communities Y.M.C.A.s in Chicago.

title: A Warrant to Search Your Vagina
description: As debate raged around health care and Russia-gate last month, Attorney General Jeff Sessions quietly held a national summit of law enforcement representatives to discuss the future of policing.

title: The Underwoods Are Horribly Depressed
description: I rented a house in the Catskills this month only to find that my neighbors are Claire and Frank Underwood, and I must tell you, the way these House of Cards people drive is a menace.

title: Lyft to Develop Self-Driving Car Technology in New Silicon Valley Facility
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Controlling the future of the smartphone was the defining technology battle of the last decade. Now, technology companies are betting that the next 10 years and beyond will be spent battling for control of the self-driving automobile.

title: Deadly Violence Erupts in Standoff Over Mosque in Jerusalem
description: JERUSALEM  Six people were killed on Friday in an outbreak of violence that erupted over Israels placement of metal detectors at entrances to the sacred Aqsa Mosque compound in Jerusalem and spread to the West Bank.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Carbs, Cancer Screening and Rhabdo
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: England Beats India for Womens Cricket World Cup. The Sport Is the Big Winner.
description: LONDON  The womens cricket team from England beat India by nine runs on Sunday to win the World Cup at a place that not so long ago shunned female players. Lords, the London ground often referred to as the Home of Cricket, drew a full house for the title game  another breakthrough in a tournament full of them.

title: What to Cook This Weekend

title: If Trump Pardons, It Could Be a Crime

title: This Podcast Is a Love Story, for Your Ears Only
description: When did you last cry in front of another person? What is your most treasured memory? When did you realize that the future of musical theater might just take the form of a podcast?

title: Preparing for the Jump to a New Operating System
description: Q. I have been a dedicated PC user since the mid-1980s and have only used Windows-based computers, but I am now contemplating a switch to Apple and have concerns. Will my external backup drives be accessed smoothly once connected to a Mac? I dont use the cloud because I dont want my stuff out there and dont want any additional storage expenses. How do I transfer my desktop items, Google bookmarks, etc.? Will I still be able to use Chrome?

title: British Open Leaderboard: Jordan Spieth Pulls Ahead at Royal Birkdale
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Jordan Spieth, who shared the first-round lead at the 146th British Open with two others, was among the final 10 threesomes to tee off on Friday, allowing him ample time to watch the second-round telecast and plot his strategy.

title: Another Possible Indignity of Age: Arrest
description: It was the sort of incident that happens at facilities that care for people with dementia.

title: An Instant Way to Bolster Flavor
description: Inventive cooks are always looking to push flavor to the maximum.

title: Sean Spicer Resigns as White House Press Secretary
description: WASHINGTON  Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, resigned Friday after telling President Trump he vehemently disagreed with his appointment of Anthony Scaramucci, a New York financier, as his new communications director.

title: Subway Train Derails in Brooklyn, Disrupting Morning Commute
description: A subway train derailed in Brooklyn on Friday morning in the second subway derailment in the last month, officials said.

title: Live Auctions End at Christies South Ken. Will Online Sales Fill the Void?
description: LONDON  A crowd of about 200 people gathered in West London on Wednesday afternoon to witness the sale of a late 20th-century Georgian-style dining table, bringing to an end 42 years of auctions at Christies salesroom in South Kensington.

title: Review: Balanchine Jewels from Paris, Moscow and New York
description: Green! Red! White! On Thursday night after the Lincoln Center Festivals international production of George Balanchines Jewels, it was exhilarating to behold the dancers of Emeralds (Paris Opera Ballet), Rubies (New York City Ballet) and Diamonds (Bolshoi Ballet from Moscow) assemble in three bright stripes, on the stage of the David H. Koch Theater where, 50 years ago (it was then the New York State Theater), Jewels had its premiere.

title: Where to Celebrate 30 Years of Dirty Dancing
description: It has been 30 years since Dirty Dancing, the love story about the resort dance instructor Johnny Castle, played by Patrick Swayze, and a guest, Frances Houseman (Jennifer Grey), known as Baby, opened in theaters.

title: Detroit House Music Takes a Swaggering Step Out of the Darkness
description: Frank Ocean, Solange and A Tribe Called Quest have top billing at the Panorama Festival on Randalls Island in New York next weekend. Squint a little, however, and the finer print farther down the poster reveals another vital expression of contemporary African-American popular music: a showcase of some of todays finest and funkiest Detroit house producers and D.J.s.

title: G.E. Results Show Next Chiefs Challenges at Revamped Company
description: John Flannery will not formally assume the job of chief executive of General Electric until August. But he made a cameo appearance in an earnings conference call on Friday, and said he was conducting a rigorous review of each of the companys businesses and would present his plans in November.

title: Bank of America Chooses Dublin as Post-Brexit European Hub
description: LONDON  Bank of America said on Friday that it had chosen Dublin as its future European Union hub, the latest major financial services firm to outline its plans to deal with Britains departure from the 28-nation bloc.

title: Mr. Heidecker and Mr. Wareheim on Film School
description: This is them talking about bonding at film school at Temple and how their love of pranks and abrasive humor was formative in establishing Tim And Eric. Tim begins talking about making a joke our of film class and then Eric describes the pranks they pull at parties and bars that anticipate the show.

title: The Playlist: Linkin Park Pays Tribute to Chester Bennington
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter here.

title: Streaming Is Taking Over Pop, but Its Far From Flawless
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

description: Boxings international federation, already under pressure from its troubled sports ventures, may face further financial distress because two major investors have asked to be repaid about $30 million.

title: 10 Things to Do in NYC Now
description: Two years ago the Oregon songwriter and performer Colin Meloy heard, and fell in love with, the music of the English folk artist Olivia Chaney. He invited Ms. Chaney to collaborate with his band, the Decemberists; the two acts ultimately merged to form Offa Rex, a new group whose excellent debut album, The Queen of Hearts, arrived last week. At this Wednesday night concert, expect to hear the British folk covers from the album, as well as reinterpreted songs from Ms. Chaneys and the Decemberists catalogs. SIMON VOZICK-LEVINSON

description: To the Editor:

title: A Constitutional Convention for New York?

title: What We Finally Got Around to Learning at the Procrastination Research Conference
description: CHICAGO  The shuttle driver got lost on the way to the 10th Procrastination Research Conference, threatening to derail the schedule. Still by 9:20 a.m. last Thursday, the 60 or so attendees had already completed check-in at DePaul University, welcome remarks and the first of dozens of presentations.

title: Private Equitys Big Bets on Financial Tech
description: Private equity firms are rushing to bet on financial technology.

title: Trumps Leader for FEMA Wins Praise, but Proposed Budget Cuts Dont
description: WASHINGTON  When forecasters from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration announced the start of hurricane season in June, more than a few state and local officials were worried by predictions of as many as five major hurricanes.

title: Nearing Another Tour de France Title, Chris Froome Has to Hurry
description: Chris Froome of Britain is probably going to win his third consecutive Tour de France, his fourth over all, and he appears to be doing it comfortably.

title: The Female Warlord Who Had C.I.A. Connections and Opium Routes
description: MUSE, Myanmar  She was born to royalty in British colonial Burma, but rejected that life to become a cross-dressing warlord whose C.I.A.-supplied army established opium trade routes across the Golden Triangle. By the time of her death, last week at 90, she had led hundreds of men, endured prison and torture, generated gossip for her relationship with a film actress and, finally, helped forge a truce between ethnic rebels and the government.

title: Teenagers Recorded a Drowning Man and Laughed
description: The video was shocking in Florida, where shocking videos seem like a genre. A group of teenagers laughed and watched as a man struggled in the water of a pond. The man drowned, and his body was not found for days.

title: A Better Way to Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Some Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now
description: The fashion brand Vetements has never been known to follow the status quo. Beginning today, the brand unveils a window installation at Saks Fifth Avenues New York flagship that is anything but a typical department store display: A mountain of old clothing  a combination of donations from Saks employees and out-of-stock merchandise  fills the windows and serves as a kind of direct message on consumerism. The pile will grow every night until August 10, when the items will be donated to RewearABLE, a green clothing initiative that benefits adults with developmental disabilities. Saks Fifth Avenue, 611 Fifth Ave.  ISABEL WILKINSON

title: A Tribute to Thoreau
description: To the Editor:

description: The 2011 indictment of Ali Charaf Damache, who was brought to the United States to face prosecution federal court in Philadelphia. He is charged with providing material support to terrorists.

title: Terror Suspect Brought to U.S. for Trial, Breaking From Trump Rhetoric
description: PHILADELPHIA  The Trump administration has brought a man suspected of belonging to Al Qaeda to the United States to face trial in federal court, backing off its hard-line position that terrorism suspects should be sent to the naval prison in Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, rather than to civilian courtrooms.

title: How I Learned to Hate Golf
description: The physical act of breaking a golf club is very easy  you simply raise the club in your dominant hand, shout something obscene and whip the traitorous implement as hard as possible into the earth. If your technique is sound, the shaft will snap in half, and you will feel a deep satisfaction that lasts approximately three seconds.

title: A Surge in Sales to Foreign Buyers
description: The United States home market saw a surge of foreign buyers in the last year, according to a new survey by the National Association of Realtors.

description: Are Americans becoming less religious? It depends on what you mean by religious.

title: Andy Blankenbuehler, Hamilton Choreographer, at Home in Harlem
description: Sofia Blankenbuehler, while out sick from school one day, heard a snippet of music coming from her fathers studio on the top floor of the familys brownstone in Harlem. A few seconds later, there was that same tune again. And again (and again) for the next eight hours or so.

title: What I Love | Andy Blankenbuehler
description: The choreographer and his family find a place where there is room to roam, and room enough for a room where it happens.

title: Three Things I Should Have Said About Retirement Planning
description: A friend of mine had been a pediatrician for a few years before he had his first child.

title: Hard Questions for a Company at the Center of the Opioid Crisis
description: The immense pay packages bestowed on corporate chieftains are often said to reflect feats of management that enrich company shareholders. An executives masterly performance justifies the compensation, in other words.
