description: Wanda Fultz and her husband have been married for a long time. It would be a shame if Game of Thrones caused it all to unravel.

title: Turkeys Erdogan Refuses to Back Down in Feud With Germany
description: ISTANBUL  President Recep Tayyip Erdogan of Turkey raised the stakes in a long-running diplomatic spat with Germany on Friday, dismissing the threat of an informal German economic embargo and rejecting calls to release several German citizens held in Turkish jails.

title: When a Comic Book Hillbilly and Milton Collide
description: Gary Panter is a painter first. But hes still probably best known for the wild and woolly comics he started scrawling back in the late 1970s and early 80s for the likes of the Los Angeles punk zine Slash, and Franoise Mouly and Art Spiegelmans Raw magazine. The Comics Journal has even called him the greatest living cartoonist.

title: Shopping for Low Stools
description: Youll often see low stools in an entrance hall, where theyre used as a spot to perch while putting on shoes. But theyre useful in pretty much every room of a home, said Dan Fink, a New York-based interior designer.

title: Texas Bathroom Bill Has Emotions, and Stakes, Running High
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  Amid conflicting pressures from gay rights groups, social conservatives, corporations and the states Republican leadership, the Texas Senate on Friday waded back into the volatile issue of restricting bathroom use by transgender people in government buildings and schools.

title: At British Open, Caddies Have Their Golfers Bags, and Backs
description: SOUTHPORT, England  At the 12th hole at Royal Birkdale, a 183-yard par 3 with a green long and narrow like a Band-Aid, Matt Kuchar pulled a mid-iron from his bag. As he stood over the ball during the second round of the British Open on Friday, the crosswinds morphed into crossbones.

title: Vegan Ice Cream Enters a Golden Age
description: Two summers ago, a friend and I met for coffee and ice cream. She got a scoop of vegan mint chip  and a whole-milk cappuccino.

title: Well Miss You, Sean Spicer
description: Today, after 183 days, 58 news conferences, one perfect Saturday Night Live skewering, and countless packs of stress gum, Sean Spicer, the White House press secretary, has resigned. But first, he slammed the door in an ABC News reporters face.

title: The Shepherd of High-Achieving Swimmers
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Ella Eastin felt as if she was having a breakthrough swim in the 400-meter individual medley final at the USA Swimming nationals last month. She knew for sure that she was when she took a breath during the final 100 meters of freestyle and caught a glimpse of her college coach, Greg Meehan.

title: Facebook Live: Peter Baker Discusses An Exclusive Interview With Trump
description: President Trump met with three New York Times reporters for an exclusive interview in the Oval Office. Peter Baker provides an inside look at key takeaways from the meeting that may not have made it to print.

title: Can Trump Pardon Himself? Explaining Presidential Clemency Powers
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has consulted his legal advisers about the possibility of pre-emptively pardoning his associates  and possibly even himself  to undermine the Justice Departments Russia investigation, The Washington Post reported Thursday night. But on Friday, John Dowd, Mr. Trumps new personal lawyer, denied to BuzzFeed that any such discussions had taken place.

title: Review: Story of a Girl, on Overcoming Viral Infamy
description: Kyra Sedgwick, an Emmy winner as an actress for The Closer, proves to have a sensitive touch as a first-time director as well, with Story of a Girl, a Lifetime movie on Sunday whose cast includes her husband, Kevin Bacon. Lifetime churns out a lot of movies, and many of them exhibit an assembly-line superficiality, but this tale of a teenagers long struggle to overcome a slut-shaming incident is delicately told and acted.

title: In Europe, Opera Takes On Our Time
description: Beneath the artifice, the virtuosic singing and the foreign languages, operas stories are deeply familiar: tales of love, loss and duty that anyone could identify with. But lately, theres another way that opera has been recognizable to many in its audiences: its dissatisfaction with the state of the world.

title: Iraqs Hardball Tactics to Root Out ISIS
description: Some of the methods Iraqi authorities are using to weed out ISIS supporters among Sunni civilians in newly liberated Mosul have heightened concerns over human rights abuses.

description: The United States is so sharply divided that political consensus appears to fray almost daily. Yet two truths about politics can be demonstrated with hard numbers.

title: Chilling Fervor: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments on YouTube

This week, were offering a glimpse into the research weve done on YouTube for articles.

title: The Rhythms That Make Elephant Seals Run or Fight

title: Russian Lawyer Who Met Donald Trump Jr. Once Represented Spy Agency

title: Trumps Communications Orbit

With the arrival of Anthony Scaramucci, Sean Spicers abrupt departure and the quick promotion of Sarah Huckabee Sanders, the Trump message machine looks a bit different now. Heres a rundown of the people in the presidents messaging orbit.

description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

description: David Chang takes you on a mind-bending visual tasting through one of his signature dishes. A world of travel and dining services awaits with American Express Platinum.

description: By now, were used to what are known as historically informed performances of early music, which seek to revive the instruments and styles that audiences in, say, the Baroque era would have known.

description: Like interest in traditional books, library systems in much of Canada have not only survived the rise of electronic media but have thrived. Over the last decade or so, there has been something of a central library revival in much of the country.

title: Bag With Moon Dust in It Fetches $1.8 Million From a Mystery Buyer
description: A small white bag that has been to the moon and back  both literally and metaphorically  was purchased by an anonymous buyer for $1,812,500 (including a premium of $312,500) at auction at Sothebys on Thursday.

description: In choosing Anthony Scaramucci as White House communications director, President Trump has appointed a financial showman who rivals Mr. Trumps own outsize knack for self-promotion.

title: Ann Lai's Lawsuit Against Binary Capital
description: Ms. Lai, a former employee of Binary, contends that after she complained to her bosses about sexism and inappropriate behavior in the workplace, the company used the non-disparagement provision in her employment contract to threaten her and prevent her from talking about why she had quit her job.

title: Abuses Hide in the Silence of Nondisparagement Agreements
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Last October, AngelList, a company that helps tech start-ups raise money and hire employees, held an office retreat. In the Hollywood Hills, far from Silicon Valley, the firms mostly male staff mingled poolside with bikini-clad women who had been invited to the event.

title: The senator didnt make the Harvard basketball team...
description: ...but it freed him up to join political groups on campus.

title: What to Cook, Watch, Listen To and More This Weekend
description: Its wedding season. And between the social media hashtags that often mark the occasion (usually a pun on the couples names) and searching through gift registries, weddings are meant to be fun celebrations.

title: Minneapolis Police Chief Forced Out After Fatal Shooting of Australian Woman
description: The Minneapolis police chief, Janee Harteau, resigned on Friday at the mayors request, less than a week after one of the citys officers fatally shot an unarmed Australian woman who had called 911 for help.

title: Wall Street Journal Editorial Writer Is Found Dead
description: Joseph Rago, a 34-year-old Pulitzer Prize-winning editorial writer for The Wall Street Journal, was found dead at his home on Thursday evening. Police officers discovered Mr. Ragos body at his apartment in Manhattan at around 8 p.m. after a request to check on him, a spokeswoman for the New York Police Department said.

title: The senators bar mitzvah followed a major event in history
description: ...that added pressure to his reading of the Torah portion.

title: Wells Fargo Accidentally Releases Trove of Data on Wealthy Clients
description: When a lawyer for Gary Sinderbrand, a former Wells Fargo employee, subpoenaed the bank as part of a defamation lawsuit against a bank employee, he and Mr. Sinderbrand expected to receive a selection of emails and documents related to the case.

title: Ivanka Trump Received at Least $12.6 Million Since 2016, Disclosure Shows
description: Ivanka Trump or her trust received at least $12.6 million since early 2016 from her various business ventures and has an arrangement to guarantee her at least $1.5 million a year even as she serves in a top White House position, according to her first ethics disclosure made public late Friday.

title: Ford and Mazda Hope to Be Removed From Latest Airbag Recall
description: Ford Motor and Mazda plan to ask federal safety regulators to exclude their vehicles from the latest expansion of the widespread recall of airbag inflaters made by Takata, a Japanese supplier that sought bankruptcy protection in June.

title: Haitian Immigrants With Temporary Status Await Trumps Next Move
description: Jean Jubens Jeanty, a Haitian Uber driver who lives in Brooklyn, has his future mapped out. After completing a high school diploma program at Brooklyn College next month, he plans to start college next year. He would then seek further schooling to become a nurse or pediatrician. But the clock is ticking on his plans.

title: Quotation of the Day: Dals Mustache Stands the Passage of Time
description: The mustache kept its classic 10-past-10 position.

title: Hezbollah and Syrian Army Attack Islamists on Lebanon Border
description: CAIRO  The Lebanese militant group Hezbollah and the Syrian Army launched a major operation on Friday that aimed to dislodge a pocket of Islamist fighters from their stronghold on the border between Lebanon and Syria.

title: Polish Parliament Approves Law Curtailing Courts Independence
description: WARSAW  Brushing aside warnings from the European Union and ignoring tens of thousands of protesters in the streets, Polands Parliament gave final approval to a landmark measure on Saturday that would restructure the Supreme Court, putting it under effective control of the governing party.

title: Sessions Presses Immigration Agenda in Philadelphia, a Sanctuary City
description: PHILADELPHIA  A day after vowing to stay in his job despite a reproof from the president, Attorney General Jeff Sessions pressed his immigration agenda on Friday in Philadelphia, a so-called sanctuary city that limits its cooperation with federal immigration authorities.

title: How the Modern World Made Cowards of Us All
description: BACK in the late 1980s, Dana Carvey of Saturday Night Live used to do a funny impression of President George H. W. Bush, in which the character would justify his own supposed timidity by muttering wouldnt be prudent to himself about every small risk. The impression neatly captured the contemporary notion of prudence: faintheartedness, caution and a general bias against action.

title: Kentucky Must Pay $224,000 After Dispute Over Same-Sex Marriage Licenses
description: A federal judge on Friday ordered Kentucky to pay more than $224,000 in legal fees and costs because one of its county clerks had refused to issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples.

title: Stakes for Exxon in Sanctions Case Go Far Beyond a $2 Million Fine
description: WASHINGTON  The $2 million fine that the Treasury Department levied on Exxon Mobil this week for violating sanctions against Russia is just a sliver of the oil companys $7.8 billion in profit last year. But Exxon has decided nonetheless to wage a legal battle  one that could make President Trumps cabinet meetings decidedly awkward.

title: Kim Clijsters Reflects on Career Ahead of Hall of Fame Induction
description: NEWPORT, R.I.  When Kim Clijsters looks back on her tennis career, there is no shortage of highlights: three United States Open championships, a 2011 Australian Open title and the world No. 1 ranking. But one match above all still produces goose bumps.

title: Trumps Virginia Golf Outings Leave Paddlers High, Dry and Angry
description: WASHINGTON  Every Sunday afternoon during the summer, just an hour from the White House, a group of wounded veterans take to the waters of the Potomac River in kayaks for exercise, therapy and camaraderie before cutting into a free barbecue organized by the community.

title: Dont Tinker With Nafta. Fix It.
description: President Trump has opened a renegotiation of the North American Free Trade Agreement with the aim of reducing the United States trade deficit and creating better-paying jobs. We, as the presidents of the two unions representing 245,000 workers in the North American auto assembly and parts supply industry, support the concept of meaningful Nafta renegotiation.

title: Fight Over New York Subways Is as Much Political as It Is Financial
description: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Joseph J. Lhota, made a scathing attack on Friday on what he portrayed as Mayor Bill de Blasios hands-off attitude toward the crisis engulfing New York Citys subway system even as he called on the city to help fund a sweeping emergency transit plan that will be announced soon.

title: Trumps Foreign Policy: The Conservatives Report Card
description: If youre a liberal judging Donald Trumps foreign-policy record at the six-month mark, its not hard to guess the grade youd give him. An F is too generous for your taste. An F-minus? How about a negative F?

title: For Westchester, 11th Time Is Charm in Fight Over Fair Housing
description: After years of legal wrangling between Westchester County and the federal government over a court-ordered 2009 settlement to meet fair housing requirements, federal officials appear to have stopped fighting.

title: Theyll Shoot Horses, Wont They?
description: SONOMA, Calif.  Should the federal government encourage the slaughter of a living symbol of the American West?

title: C. Weston Houck, Judge Who Ended Citadels Male-Only Policy, Dies at 84
description: Judge C. Weston Houck, whose transformative ruling in 1994 shattered the 152-year-old male-only admissions policy at The Citadel, South Carolinas public military college, died Wednesday in Florence, S.C. He was 84.

title: The Latest Voice at the Lectern: An Effusive New Yorker
description: WASHINGTON  As the newly minted White House press secretary, Sarah Huckabee Sanders spent most of her first briefing on Friday standing off to the side. Anthony Scaramucci, the just-named communications director, was dominating the lectern that Ms. Sanders had inherited only hours earlier, professing his love  20 times  for President Trump and his administration.

title: Trump Fills Top Job at Government Ethics Office With a Temporary Appointment
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump picked a new leader for the Office of Government Ethics on Friday, naming the agencys general counsel, David J. Apol, as the acting director.

title: Senate Parliamentarian Challenges Key Provisions of Health Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate Republican bill to dismantle the Affordable Care Act encountered huge new problems on Friday night after the Senate parliamentarian challenged key provisions that are needed to win conservative votes and to make the health bill workable.

title: What It Was Like to Be Drafted
description: I was drafted into the Army on July 11, 1967, three weeks after my 22nd birthday. Seemingly within minutes after Id graduated from George Washington University that May, my draft board in Hillside, N.J., changed my status from II-S (student) to I-A (cannon fodder).

title: Clancy Sigal, Novelist Whose Life Was a Tale in Itself, Dies at 90
description: The first time Clancy Sigal went to jail he was 5. His mother, a Socialist union organizer, had been arrested in Chattanooga, Tenn., for violating social and legal norms when she convened a meeting of black and white female textile workers. Hauled away to the jailhouse, she took Clancy with her.

title: Pouring Ones Heart Out
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Is it weird that my heart skips a beat when I see Zhouqin Burnikels byline? Its a good kind of skip; Im always happy to see her puzzles, because I know Im going to have a good time solving them.

title: What Did Trump and Putin Tell Each Other?
description: The White House keeps insisting that an unannounced discussion between President Trump and President Vladimir Putin of Russia during the recent Group of 20 meeting in Germany is nothing peculiar. In fact, history shows that it is rare for American presidents to meet other leaders, especially adversaries, one-on-one, with little evident preparation and no other American representative present. Mr. Trumps unique affinity for Mr. Putin is, of course, an additional reason to be concerned.

title: Ben Gamel Takes Familiar Path to Success: Away From New York
description: SEATTLE  It might be hard for Yankees fans to recognize Ben Gamel these days  and not because of his beard and shoulder-length red hair. He is also not performing like the player who came up to the big leagues for two cameos last season and did little to show he could handle major league pitching.

title: In Yoenis Cespedess Dream, Mets Are Conspicuously Absent
description: The Mets have about a half-dozen players who may very well be ex-Mets by Aug. 1, and one player who is virtually guaranteed to be a Met through 2020.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Hacksaw Ridge and Gone: The Forgotten Women of Ohio
description: Hacksaw Ridge, Mel Gibsons Oscar-nominated tale of wartime resistance, comes to HBO. And Joe Berlinger investigates an unsolved case of vanishing Ohio women.

title: Aaron Judges Power Bursts Back Into View With a Towering Blast
description: SEATTLE  When Andrew Moores curveball arrived  slow, letter-high and delicious  Aaron Judge did not consider what the last week had been like for him.

title: When Young Chinese Ask, Whats Your Sign? They Dont Mean Dragon or Rat
description: BEIJING  China, the birthplace of the Chinese zodiac and some of the worlds oldest and most sophisticated fortunetelling techniques, has a new obsession: Western astrology.

title: A Maltese Hotel with Baroque Design and Mediterranean Flair
description: From 180 euros (about $200)

title: A Spirit of Bipartisanship That Is Sorely Lacking Today
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: Silicon Valley Giants Confront New Walls in China
description: SHANGHAI  Facebook is the worlds largest social network, with more than two billion users. LinkedIn was sold to Microsoft for $26 billion last year. And Apple is Apple, the most valuable company in the world.

title: Battling Wildfires in British Columbia
description: More than 40,000 people have been displaced by wildfires in the western Canadian province of British Columbia, where a state of emergency has been declared.

title: One Family, Many Revolutions: From Black Panthers, to Silicon Valley, to Trump
description: CAMARILLO, Calif.  For generations, the Horowitz family has cheered on the revolution.

title: New Homeless Shelters Are Coming to New York City: Which Neighborhoods Are Likely to Get Them?
description: The city is planning to open 90 new shelters, but where the city decides to put them is likely to be contentious.

title: The Battle for Venezuela, Through a Lens, Helmet and Gas Mask
description: CARACAS, Venezuela  Motley throngs of masked antigovernment protesters hurl rocks, fireworks and Molotov cocktails. The police and soldiers retaliate with tear gas, water cannon blasts, rubber bullets and buckshot.

title: The Faces of New York Citys Pride Parade
description: A few years ago Ryan Pfluger spent the summer shooting portraits of people in parks throughout New York City. I wanted to do something for Pride that still felt like it was my work, said the photographer, who brings, in his words, a queer mind-set to his images.

title: Dear Sugars: Oprah Winfrey on How to Say No
description: Last week, our hosts Steve Almond and Cheryl Strayed responded to listeners who struggle with saying no, and sought the advice of someone who has struggled with that in her own life: Oprah Winfrey. (They also took on that topic in their new advice column for Thursday Styles, The Sweet Spot.)

title: Is This the Woman Who Will Save Uber?
description: A little over a year before Bozoma Saint John became the first chief brand officer at Uber, the transportation companys best hope to rehabilitate its tarnished image, she hailed a ride from the Four Seasons hotel in Austin, Tex., to a nearby business dinner. What pulled up was a wreck.

title: Pittsburgh Gets a Tech Makeover
description: PITTSBURGH  In 2015, Monocle magazine, a favorite read of the global hipsterati, published an enthusiastic report on Lawrenceville, the former blue-collar neighborhood here filled with cafes, hyped restaurants and brick rowhouses being renovated by flippers.

title: Philippine Congress Extends Martial Law in Besieged Region
description: MANILA  The Philippine Congress voted on Saturday to extend martial law in the southern part of the country, giving the military five more months to crush a rebellion there by Islamic State-inspired militants.

title: One by One, Marry-Your-Rapist Laws Are Falling in the Middle East
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Gruesome billboards of a woman in a bloodied and torn bridal gown appeared around Beirut recently, captioned in Arabic: A white dress doesnt cover up rape. This spring, a womens rights group, Abaad, hung similarly defiled gowns along the citys famous seaside promenade.

title: From Political Star to a Sacrificial Object in China
description: BEIJING  All the political stars seemed aligned for Sun Zhengcai to be promoted to a top national post in China at the Communist Partys congress this fall.

title: Turkeys Alevis, a Muslim Minority, Fear a Policy of Denying Their Existence
description: OSMANCIK, Turkey  In the hills of northern Anatolia, next to a shrine to a medieval Muslim mystic, there stands a modest building that illustrates the fears and frustrations of Turkeys Alevi minority.

title: Trump Says He Has Complete Power to Pardon
description: NORFOLK, Va  President Trump on Saturday asserted the complete power to pardon relatives, aides and possibly even himself in response to investigations into Russias meddling in last years election, as he came to the defense of Attorney General Jeff Sessions just days after expressing regret about appointing him.

title: Farhad and Mikes Week in Tech: Meal Kits, Lyft and Despacito
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: How Activism Can Lead to Love
description: Ann Katherine Durkin and Jeffrey Bert DeGroot were married July 22 at the Olympic Sculpture Park in Seattle. Laura R. Durkin, the brides sister, became a Universal Life minister to officiate.

title: When the Perfect Mate Is Standing Right in Front of You
description: Van Ann Dang Bui, a daughter of Thuy Dang Bui and the Rev. Hien The Bui of Sugar Land, Tex., was married on July 22 to Mario Ren Ruiz, a son of Rosa Maria Ruiz of the Bronx and the late Robert Luis Ruiz. The brides father, a Southern Baptist minister, officiated at the Connecticut River Museum in Essex, Conn., with the Rev. Martin Azurdia, an Evangelical priest and an uncle of the groom, taking part.

title: Aging and Rent Stabilization
description: Q. My mothers husband has had a rent-stabilized apartment in Midtown Manhattan since the 1970s. My mother  married him and moved into the apartment in the 1980s. He is now 85 and suffers from dementia. Since she cannot provide the daily care that he needs, my mother has decided to place him in a  nursing facility. The landlord told my mother that she is not on the lease, and since the lease renewal her husband signed is for only two years, if he should die during that time, my mother would not have a home. I do not think this can possibly be true. Theyve been married for nearly 30 years. What can she do?

title: In Short Shorts, Wooing a Pretend Nurse
description: Upasana Unni and Benjamin Rhys Davies were married July 17 in New York. Shunya Togashi, a staff member of the New York City clerks office, officiated at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau.

title: Dancing Into Each Others Hearts
description: Sarah Emely Ochs and Isaac Moses Regelson were married July 22 at the Mount Nebo Church in Blackstone, Va. John Hunter Jr., who received a solemnization certificate from the State of Virginia, and was the brides elementary school teacher and the grooms high school teacher, led the ceremony.

title: Newly Disclosed Clinton-era Memo Says Presidents Can Be Indicted
description: Can presidents be indicted while they remain in office? Conventional wisdom says no, but a newfound Office of Independent Counsel legal memo says yes.

title: Can the President Be Indicted? A Long-Hidden Legal Memo Says Yes
description: WASHINGTON  A newfound memo from Kenneth W. Starrs independent counsel investigation into President Bill Clinton sheds fresh light on a constitutional puzzle that is taking on mounting significance amid the Trump-Russia inquiry: Can a sitting president be indicted?

title: Manhattans District Attorney vs. Aeschylus
description: In a criminal courtroom in downtown Manhattan on Wednesday evening, a group of prosecutors were screaming for revenge.

title: Branden Grace Makes History at the British Open, Shooting a 62
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Branden Grace capitalized on perfect morning conditions Saturday at the British Open to record the lowest score ever in a mens major championship: a 62 in the third round at Royal Birkdale.

title: Noah Syndergaard, Injured After Bulking Up, Rethinks His Training
description: Noah Syndergaard is devising a new training strategy. The previous one emphasized packing more muscle onto the solid 6-foot-6 frame that had helped him earn the nickname Thor, and throttling up pitches that had already made him the hardest-throwing starter in the major leagues.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  All I have to say about this one is this: Some are dancers, and some would rather watch from the sidelines:

title: Ivan Rodriguez Hit His Target: First-Ballot Hall of Famer
description: Ivan Rodriguez played more games as a catcher than anyone else in major league history. He won 13 Gold Glove awards and intimidated runners with the most powerful throwing arm of his generation.

title: Turkey Sees Foes at Work in Gold Mines, Cafes and Smurf Village
description: LONDON  Akin Ipek, one of Turkeys richest men, was staying in the Park Tower Hotel in London when the police raided his television network in Istanbul. The raid was national news, so Mr. Ipek opened his laptop and watched an unnerving spectacle: an attack on his multibillion-dollar empire, in real time.

title: In Minneapolis, Unusual Police Killing Raises an Old Outcry: Why?
description: MINNEAPOLIS  There was something bad going on in the alleyway behind the house, she told her fianc on the phone, someone who sounded as if she was in distress, maybe a rape. It was past 11 p.m., and most people on Washburn Avenue were furled in their beds.

title: Some Pundit Meta On Our Twin Crises
description: Right now, there are two huge crises in American politics, but one is clearly bigger than the other. Yet looking at my recent columns, and to a large extent my blogging and tweeting, Ive been focusing mainly on the lesser crisis. A few thoughts about why.

title: Time at the Wheel of No. 22 Is Just a Fraction of Joey Loganos Week
description: Late on most Monday mornings during the Nascar season, the stock car driver Joey Logano will make a 20-minute drive from his home to the Penske Racing shop in Mooresville, N.C. He will meet with Todd Gordon, his crew chief.

title: Trumps Attack on Russia Inquiry Is From Familiar Playbook: The Clintons
description: WASHINGTON  More than eight months after his election, President Trump still attacks Hillary Clinton, disparaging her campaign and accusing her of illegality. In his latest Twitter barrage on Saturday, he suggested again that the Justice Department should investigate Crooked Hillary Clinton.

title: Why We Published the Name of a Covert C.I.A. Official
description: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.

title: Taliban Say Top Leaders Son Carried Out a Suicide Attack
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Early Thursday morning, Taliban fighters in southern Helmand Province launched a daring attack: They packed explosives into three stolen Humvees originally supplied to Afghan forces by the United States and drove them into Afghan security outposts. After the Humvees exploded, other suicide attackers followed.

title: Bethanie Mattek-Sands Is Upbeat After Gruesome Injury at Wimbledon
description: Bethanie Mattek-Sands still cannot bring herself to watch video replay of the moment that led to the scream heard round the world.

title: German Carmakers Face Potential New Scandal Over Antitrust Issues
description: FRANKFURT  Germanys high-end carmakers face a potentially destructive new scandal after European antitrust authorities said on Saturday that they were looking into allegations that Volkswagen, Daimler and BMW colluded illegally to hold down the prices of crucial technology, including emissions equipment.

title: For Mets Fans, Sundays at Citi Field Are No Fun to Watch
description: Theres a romantic comedy from 1963, Sunday in New York, with a bubbly, Sinatra-style theme song thats played over the sound system before the Mets take the field for their Sunday home games. These days, these lyrics really catch fans ears:

title: Poles Hope to Sway President From Curtailing Courts Independence
description: WARSAW  When she heard that Polands right-wing government was pushing through new laws to give it more control over the countrys courts, Lucyna Relewicz decided the Constitution was in jeopardy and she needed to close her office and take to the streets.

title: Jared Kushners Got Too Many Secrets to Keep Ours
description: For all that we dont know about President Trumps dealings with Russia, one thing should now be clear: Jared Kushner should not be working in the White House, and he should not have a security clearance.

title: Charlie Gard and the Experts
description: In the case of Charlie Gard, the dying British infant whose parents are being denied the right to attempt a long-shot treatment despite having a willing doctor and the money to pay for it, there is a hard question and an easy one.

title: The Mooch and the Mogul
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump has finally found a courtier who can give him the buttery, boundless respect he craves.

title: Jared Kushner, the Prince of Having It Both Ways
description: On Monday, Jared Kushner is set to appear before the Senate Intelligence Committee, but not so that we can listen. Not so that we can watch. Its a closed-door affair, meaning that unlike Jeff Sessions, Kushner gets to dance in the dark.

title: Donald Trumps Plan to Save Western Civilization
description: How did Donald Trump come to speak for Western civilization?

title: President Trump and His Way-Back Machine
description: If President Trump were a factory, it would be a wheezing, noisy operation churning out tired old ideas. His meaningless pledges to revive the rusted-out factories scattered like tombstones that he mourned at his inauguration ignore the promise American manufacturing holds in the real world.

title: The Bogus Voter-Fraud Commission
description: The truth cant be repeated often enough: The Presidential Advisory Commission on Election Integrity, which held its first meeting last week, is a sham and a scam.

title: The Wall With Mexico, and Xanadu
description: Every time President Trump revamps his campaign promise to build that tall, powerful, beautiful wall along the Mexican border he sounds increasingly like a developer ruminating over the blueprints for mythic Xanadu.

title: What Is America to Me?
description: NASHVILLE  In 2015, just as refugees were pouring out of Syria and pictures of terrified children filled every newscast and front page in the world, a small notice appeared in my church bulletin: Are you looking for a way to help our citys newest refugees? It was a call for volunteers to assist in an English-language classroom at a local public school. I was once a high school literature teacher, so I saved it, planning to follow through whenever life slowed down a little. More than a year later, I was still dithering. The day after Donald Trump was elected, I finally volunteered.

title: For Ethiopias Underemployed Youth, Life Can Center on a Leaf
description: BAHIR DAR, Ethiopia  Her life revolves around a psychotropic leaf.

title: Dont Let Detroits Revival Rest on an Injustice
description: FIFTY years ago on Sunday the Detroit uprising began. Five days of violence left more than 1,400 buildings burned, more than 7,000 people arrested and 43 people dead  33 African-Americans and 10 whites. TV sets transported images of cars and buildings engulfed in orange flames and black smoke into American living rooms. After the uprising, whites and middle-class African-Americans fled the city, leaving poor and working-class African-American families to fend for themselves.

title: Without Visas, Carnival Workers Are Trapped at Home in Mexico
description: TLAPACOYAN, Mexico  Francisco Trujillo heads north each summer to do a job that few Americans want: a four-month stint operating carnival rides, mopping up vomit and sleeping in a cramped trailer with other workers.

title: Congress Reaches Deal on Russia Sanctions, Setting Up Tough Choice for Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional leaders have reached an agreement on sweeping sanctions legislation to punish Russia for its election meddling and aggression toward its neighbors, they said Saturday, defying the White Houses argument that President Trump needs flexibility to adjust the sanctions to fit his diplomatic initiatives with Moscow.

title: Shakespeares Torture Test
description: Durham, N.C.  In September, the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Washington will hear Salim vs. Mitchell, a case brought by the American Civil Liberties Union on behalf of three former C.I.A. detainees. The lawsuit names as defendants the two psychologists who devised the enhanced interrogation techniques that became the basis for the C.I.A. torture program described in shocking detail in the Senate Intelligence Committees 2014 report.

title: The Glory of a Summer Sleep
description: Summer is the silent season, when vacations offer virtually the only chance for legions of beleaguered workers to escape their responsibilities. A wanton slumber on a hot afternoon offers the luxurious expanse of wasted time. The world can keep turning without us for a while.

title: Lets Get Excited About Maintenance!
description: Its been a bad summer for maintenance, especially in New York. Last month Gov. Andrew Cuomo declared a state of emergency for the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, underscoring a problem that New York subway riders understand all too well: The M.T.A. relies heavily on emergency repairs because it does not conduct sufficient preventive upkeep. Likewise, in the wake of two recent derailments that caused major disruptions, Pennsylvania Station this month closed aging tracks for repairs and reduced the number of trains serving the station  another example of the costs of neglecting maintenance.

title: Why Are the Baby Boomers in Such a Bad Mood?
description: Starting sometime in the mid-1950s, baby boomers became the center of American cultural attention. Toni Home Permanents, cap guns, Hostess cupcakes, American Bandstand, lovingly packed lunches, the Beatles, The Man From U.N.C.L.E., Motown, Madras shorts, the SATs, undoing Nixon, the civil rights movement, ending the Vietnam War  all came into existence just at the time we, age-appropriately, could ingest, wear or wallop them.

title: My Grandfather, My Bona Fide Best Friend
description: Until his untimely death in 1986, my grandfather was my best friend. On weekend mornings hed let my parents sleep in while he brought me downstairs to watch cartoons. We made regular trips to the San Jose, Calif., flea market where hed buy me cheap toys and impress me with his masterful bargaining, which made them even cheaper. Wed watch Clint Eastwood movies, with him in his La-Z-Boy and me on his lap.

title: House Hunting with No Credit, No Job History
description: A Vietnamese refugee unexpectedly offers help to a Syrian seeking a home in America.

title: Gay Marriage Backers Celebrate in Germany: We Dont Need to Hide
description: BERLIN  Esther Thiane, a student in Berlin, does not know yet if she wants to marry a man or a woman  but now she can decide without worrying about the legality of whatever she chooses.

title: A Deadline Call on Posthumous Privacy
description: Five years have passed since the death of Sally Ride, the first American woman to fly in space. Her New York Times obituary  specifically, the way we addressed her sexuality  provoked an intense debate that still echoes from time to time.

title: German Teenager Suspected of Trying to Join ISIS Is Found in Iraq
description: FRANKFURT, Germany  A German teenager missing for more than a year, who was believed to have converted to Islam and run away to join the Islamic State, has been found in Iraq, a state prosecutor said on Saturday.

title: Traveling in the Wake of Immigration Arrests
description: After hundreds of undocumented immigrants were arrested in February, it became clear that the new president had begun making good on a campaign promise to crack down on illegal immigration. Having written about immigration before, we knew other, subtler changes were most likely already happening  from how immigration officers make their arrests and who they take in to the lives of those left behind. To understand those changes, we had to see enforcement on the ground.

title: Fatherhood, and Illness, Retools the Priorities of Rockies Starter Chad Bettis
description: HARTFORD  Life does not always give choices. Chad Bettis did not choose to receive a diagnosis of testicular cancer  not on his first wedding anniversary, not with his first child on the way in the spring, not after his best season as a starting pitcher for the Colorado Rockies. That is just what happened.

title: Back on the Charts
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Most solvers expect to see a daily crossword theme in the longer Across answers. On Sundays, the increased size of the grid means theme entries can also occupy some of the Down answers, but sometimes the theme material is not where you expect to find it.

title: U.S. Navy Opens New Era With Commissioning of Gerald R. Ford
description: NORFOLK, Va.  With flag-hoisting, gun-firing, horn-blowing fanfare, the United States Navy opened a new era on Saturday as it commissioned the first of a generation of more powerful, technologically advanced aircraft carriers that will transform the fleet in decades to come.

title: Scharlette Holdman, a Force for the Defense on Death Row, Dies at 70
description: In the tight-knit world of defense lawyers who focus on the death penalty, Scharlette Holdman, who died on July 12 at 70, was a revered figure, a nonlawyer who taught her peers how to persuade jurors and prosecutors to spare the lives of men and women convicted of heinous crimes.

title: John Heard, the Frazzled Father in Home Alone, Dies at 71
description: John Heard, an actor who played pained characters in dramas but was probably best known for his role as the father who mistakenly left his youngest son behind on a family trip to Paris in the comedy Home Alone, died on Friday in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 71.

title: At Comic-Con, Ben Affleck Says He Will Continue to Play Batman
description: SAN DIEGO  Warner Bros. unveiled sizzling footage on Saturday from upcoming movies like Ready Player One, Justice League and Blade Runner 2049 at Comic-Con International here. The studio also confirmed that its superhero lineup in the decade ahead will include Wonder Woman 2, Bat Girl and Green Lantern Corps.

title: Candidates for Virginia Governor Employ Trump as a Barometer
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va.  Lt. Gov. Ralph S. Northam of Virginia on Saturday used the first debate of the states race for governor to assail President Trump as a liar and a dangerous man, wagering that the growing backlash against the president will overwhelm Ed Gillespie, the Republican nominee, in a state drifting to the political left.

title: Quotation of the Day: The Battle for Venezuela, Through a Lens and Gas Mask
description: We are living with a hunger that we have never had before. Things are already really ugly here, and we wont take it anymore.

title: U.S.C. Moves to Fire Former Medical School Dean Over Drug Allegations
description: The University of Southern California said on Friday it was moving to fire the former dean of its medical school, Dr. Carmen Puliafito, after revelations that he had engaged in drug use during his tenure.

title: Branden Grace Secures a Record, but Jordan Spieth Owns the Day
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Saturday morning at the British Open belonged to Branden Grace, a South African who became the first man to shoot a 62 in a major championship. Graces eight-under-par score at Royal Birkdale was a sublime individual performance, but no more breathtaking than the work of the final twosome, Jordan Spieth and Matt Kuchar, who shot a combined nine under.

title: New C.D.C. Chief Saw Coca-Cola as Ally in Obesity Fight
description: Update: Dr. Brenda Fitzgerald resigned on Jan. 31, 2018, following questions about her investments in tobacco and other stock.

title: Aaron Judge Has the Power to Teach a Pitcher
description: SEATTLE  When Andrew Moore was pitching in college, he began to keep a journal in which he would make notations after each game  cues he could begin to use as a personal reference library. It might be something he wanted to improve on in his next game, the location of a particular pitch to a particular hitter, or his mentality that led to a success or failure.

title: Wilmer Floress Homer Buoys the Mets, if Only for a Moment
description: A hot July night with trade rumors swirling at Citi Field and Wilmer Flores playing the hero.

title: Corrections: July 23, 2017
description: ARTS & LEISURE

title: U.S. Soccer Team Beats Costa Rica to Make Gold Cup Final
description: Clint Dempsey fed Jozy Altidore for the go-ahead goal, then scored on a free kick to match Landon Donovans American record with his 57th international goal and lead the United States into the Concacaf Gold Cup championship game with a 2-0 victory over Costa Rica in Arlington, Tex.

title: Brooke Miller, Terrance Rogers
description: Brooke Ashley Miller and Terrance Dwight-Jamal Rogers were married July 22 in Claymont, Del. The Rev. Aaron R. Moore, the pastor of Manna Christian Fellowship Church, officiated at the Waterfall, an event space.

title: Jessica Callahan, Evan Dadosky
description: Jessica Lee Callahan, a daughter of Meg S. Callahan and Timothy H. Callahan of Chicago, was married July 22 to Evan Mark Dadosky, a son of Angela M. Dadosky and Lawrence R. Dadosky of Cincinnati. Jeff Nathan, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at the Field Museum in Chicago.

title: Jeremy Bearer-Friend, Thomas Gillespie
description: Jeremy Paul Eli Bearer-Friend and Thomas Murray Gillespie are to be married July 23 in Ashland, Ky. Bridget Gillespie Kolb, a sister of Mr. Gillespie who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, is to officiate at the Ashland Transportation Center, a bus and train station and event space.

title: Lainie Nissim, John Branigan IV
description: Lainie Sarah Nissim, a daughter of Susan Scharf Nissim and Jules J. Nissim of West Orange, N.J., was married July 22 to John Branigan IV, a son of Elaine Branigan and John J. Branigan of Voorhees, N.J. Paul H. Scharf, the maternal uncle of the bride who was ordained by American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated at the Park Savoy Estate in Florham Park, N.J. He led the ceremony with Mark P. Wagner, a friend of the grooms family.

title: Julia Febiger, Andrew Wanliss-Orlebar
description: Julia Richmond Febiger and Andrew Edward Wanliss-Orlebar were married July 22 at Wolfes Neck Farm in Freeport, Me. The Rev. Thomas Degremont, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated, with the Rev. D. Thomas Hughson, a Roman Catholic priest, taking part in the ceremony.

title: Stacie Robinson, Nathaniel Bletter
description: Stacie Joy Robinson and Nathaniel Bletter were married July 22 at Nine Fine Mynahs farm in Waialua, Hawaii. Elizabeth Elliot, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Christina Kaiser, Emad Salem
description: Christina Elizabeth Kaiser and Emad Mohamed Salem were married July 17 in New York. Joey Tai, a staff member of the New York City Clerks office, officiated at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau.

title: Lacy Kiernan, Graham Carroll
description: Sarah DeLacy Kiernan and David Graham Carroll were married July 22 in Newport, R.I. The Rev. Mark Connell, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated at Hammersmith Farm, which is owned by the brides family.

title: Samantha Swietlikowski, Ben Strauss
description: Samantha Swietlikowski and Benjamin Strauss were married July 22 at Suzanne Fine Regional Cuisine, a restaurant in Lodi, N.Y. Andrea Gerber, an aunt of the groom who became a Universal Life minister for the event, officiated.

title: Elizabeth Ahlborn, Yavor Nechev
description: Elizabeth Owen Ahlborn and Yavor Lubomirov Nechev were married July 22 at the Church of the Covenant in Boston. The Rev. Enid Watson, a Presbyterian minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Emily Wright, Benjamin Hillengas
description: Emily Caroline Wright and Benjamin George Hillengas were married July 22 at the Bronx Zoo, outside the Beaux-Arts Zoo Center. Larissa Martell, a Universal Brotherhood minister, led the ceremony.

title: Kristina Saffran, Ryan Hammond
description: Kristina Stewart Saffran and Ryan Kerry Hammond were married on July 22. Richard W. Ritchie, an uncle of the groom who was ordained by the Universal Life Church for this event, officiated at the Temecula Creek Inn in Temecula, Calif.

title: Jessica Magidson, Adam Ain
description: Jessica Frankel Magidson and Adam Sober Ain were married July 22 in Shelburne, Vt. Rabbi Jennifer Gubitz officiated at the All Souls Interfaith Gathering, a spiritual center.

title: Caroline Fowler, Nathaniel Silver
description: Caroline Overton Fowler and Nathaniel Edwin Silver were married July 20 in Florence, Italy. Alessio Rossi, a representative of the city of Florence, officiated at the Palazzo Vecchio, the city hall.

title: Maj Anya DeBear, Morgan Mirvis
description: Maj Anya N. DeBear and Morgan Oliver Mirvis were married July 22 in a self-uniting ceremony at the Mercer Museum in Doylestown, Pa.

title: Pia Shah, Hieu Ho
description: Pia Shah and Hieu Van Ho were married July 22 at their home in Los Angeles. Ryan Dougherty, a friend of the couples and an Open Doors minister, officiated.

title: Michelle Jasmine, Robert Stanley
description: Michelle Annette Jasmine and Robert Fenton Stanley were married July 22 in New York. Kristen Kullberg, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated at Midtown Loft & Terrace.

title: Lisa Ingrassia, Christopher Slevin
description: Lisa Angela Ingrassia and Christopher Ryan Slevin were married July 22 at Flying Horseshoe Ranch in Cle Elum, Wash. Lauren Capelle, the grooms sister, became a Universal Life minister to officiate.

title: Jacob Samuels, Sloan Danenhower
description: Jacob Russell Samuels and Sloan Wilson Danenhower are to be married July 23. Rabbi Pamela Jay Gottfried is to officiate at the Old Lyme Beach Club in Old Lyme, Conn.

title: Gray MacDonald, Tate Huffard
description: Catherine Gray MacDonald and Tate Randolph Huffard were married July 22 at St. Martins by-the-Lake Episcopal Church in Minnetonka Beach, Minn. The Rev. Dr. Timothy Hart-Andersen, a Presbyterian minister, led the ceremony.

title: Emily Nosova, Brandon Imber
description: Dr. Emily Vladimirovna Nosova and Dr. Brandon Stuart Imber were married July 21 at the Rotunda at the Palace of Fine Arts in San Francisco. Rabbi Jerry Levy officiated.

title: Christine Fallabel, Kevin Dunlevy-Wilson
description: Christine Noel Fallabel and Kevin Jay Dunlevy-Wilson were married July 21 in Golden, Colo. Jennifer Nealon-Garone, a nondenominational minister, officiated at the Boettcher Mansion.

title: Eliza Nordeman, Blake Davis
description: Eliza Pratt Nordeman and Blake Tamblyn Davis were married July 22 at St. Andrews Dune Church in Southampton, N.Y. The Rev. Peter M. Larsen, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Margit Endhammer, Walter Sommergruber
description: Margit Endhammer and Walter Wolfgang Sommergruber were married July 18 on the Brooklyn Bridge. David M. Gallo, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Ryan Donovan, Erik Gensler
description: Ryan Michael Donovan and Erik Zachary Gensler were married July 22 at the William Vale Hotel in Brooklyn. Ben Clawson, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Hillery Williams, Michael Stack
description: Hillery Wenning Williams and Michael John Stack were married July 22. The Rev. Charles W. B. Fels, an Episcopal priest, officiated at Pippin Hill Farm and Vineyards in North Garden, Va.

title: Talia Brooks, Edward Faustin
description: Dr. Talia Millicent Brooks and Edward Daniel Faustin were married July 22 at Woodbury Country Club in Woodbury, N.Y. The Rev. Jordan L. Rice, a cousin of the bride and a nondenominational Christian minister, officiated. The Rev. Guillaume Ford, an African Methodist Episcopal minister and grandfather of the groom, offered a blessing.

title: Deborah Galindo, Zakary Ostertag
description: Deborah Leann Galindo and Zakary Robert Ostertag are to be married July 23 at Mount Hood Bed and Breakfast in Parkdale, Ore. Barry B. Galindo, father of the bride and a Church of Christ minister, is to officiate with an opening prayer to be led by Jeff Barneson, the president of the Harvard University Chaplains.

title: Katie Mulroy, Cyril Galitzine
description: Katie Lennox Mulroy and Cyril Dsir Georges Galitzine were married July 21 in Boston. The Rev. Michael McGarry performed the ceremony at the chapel of the Paulist Center, of which he is the director, with the Rev. Dennis Billy assisting. Both are Roman Catholic priests.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: Story of a Girl and Phelps vs. Shark: Great Gold vs. Great White
description: Kyra Sedgwick makes her directorial debut opposite her husband, Kevin Bacon, and their daughter, Sosie. And Michael Phelps races (sort of) a great white during Discoverys Shark Week.

title: What You Should Know About Credit Scores
description: When I applied for my first credit card after college, I felt ready to take a big step in my life. Most of the people I knew used credit cards to pay for things  expensive, liberating things like laptops and airplane tickets. And as a freshly minted college graduate, I was excited to be able to buy those things with a credit card.

title: Trumps Great National Infrastructure Program? Stalled
description: WASHINGTON  As a candidate, President Trump billed himself as a new breed of think-big Republican, pitching a $1 trillion campaign pledge to reconstruct the nations roadways, waterworks and bridges  along with a promise to revive the lost art of the bipartisan deal.

title: Roster Moves, Old and New, Haunt Yankees in Loss to Seattle
description: SEATTLE  When Ben Gamel, his shoulder-length red hair flying in the breeze, came racing around third and sliding across the plate to give the Seattle Mariners a 6-5, 10-inning victory over the Yankees on Saturday night, it was a fitting end to an evening of exasperation for the Yankees.

title: Artist at Work: Carving Woodblock Prints in Brazil
description: Step inside the workshop of the Brazilian artist Jos Francisco Borges and follow the process of making intricate woodblock prints.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $1,500,000
description: 215 Harbor Road, Cold Spring Harbor

title: Journey Fatal for 9 Migrants Found in Truck in a San Antonio Parking Lot
description: SAN ANTONIO  The authorities here discovered eight bodies in a tractor-trailer in a Walmart parking lot early Sunday morning in what they said was a human trafficking crime that underscored the perils facing migrants trying to enter the United States by any means available.

title: Spicer, Power to Pardon, McCain: Your Weekend Briefing
New Tactic in War on Opioids: Charging Dealers in Overdose Deaths
description: The accused drug dealer known as EZ pulled up to his suppliers spot on Staten Island, turned to the customer beside him and, according to prosecutors, boasted that they were about to score the most potent heroin on the market. So strong that a bag recently used by his friends father had killed the man.

title: BBC Women Demand Action to Close Pay Gap With Men
description: LONDON  When the government forced the BBC to publish the salary ranges of its highest-paid entertainers and journalists, executives feared a backlash from the British public, most of whom pay 147 pounds a year for the privilege of watching its television broadcasts.

title: Womens Open Letter to the BBC
description: Forty-two women signed an open letter to their employer demanding immediate action to close the gender pay gap.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: White House Signals Acceptance of Russia Sanctions Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The White House indicated on Sunday that President Trump would accept new legislation curtailing his authority to lift sanctions on Russia on his own, a striking turnaround after a broad revolt by lawmakers of both parties who distrusted his friendly approach to Moscow and sought to tie his hands.

title: Newspeak on the Stage, but Real Glassware at a Theaters Bar
description: Mostly, the takeaways at the Hudson Theater have to do with the plays. In the current stage adaptation of 1984, the all-but-total surveillance gives way to torture. It is numbing enough to make you want a drink.

title: The Big Sick, South Asian Identity and Me
description: I never told my Bengali parents about my first kiss. I was 14 and we were in the basement of my house in Howell, N.J. Her name was Sharon and she had braces. It didnt go well. Sorry, Sharon.

title: How Trump Got It Wrong in Saying The Times Foiled Killing of ISIS Leader
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump wrongly tweeted on  Saturday that The New York Times had foiled an attempt by the United States military to kill Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State.

title: More Than 90 at Chance the Rapper Concert Hospitalized
description: More than 90 people at a Connecticut concert featuring Chance the Rapper were hospitalized on Friday, according to a report in The Hartford Courant.

title: Global News Quiz: Saudi Plot, Polish Law, Israel Violence, Legal Pot
description: Did you stay on top of the most important stories last week? Test your knowledge of international events with our quick quiz, recapping major news headlines and featured articles from across the globe. To take the quiz, click on an answer, and the correct response will be revealed after you choose.

title: Spieth Goes From Hunted to Hunter, and Back Again, in Winning British Open
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Jordan Spieths ball was nestled in the knotty grass on a knoll, more than 120 yards right of the fairway he had aimed to reach. His hands flew to his head in mortification as he watched the shots wayward path. His first thought was that he would be lucky to escape with a double-bogey 6 on the hole, No. 13.

title: BMW Denies Colluding With Carmakers on Emissions Equipment
description: FRANKFURT  BMW, responding on Sunday to claims it formed a cartel with Daimler and Volkswagen to hold down the prices of crucial technology, denied that the German carmakers had agreed among themselves to install emissions equipment that was inadequate to do the job.

title: A Comic Strip Mirrors the Ravages of Climate Change
description: The newspaper comic strip Arctic Circle, by the environmentally minded cartoonist Alex Hallatt, is about talking penguins and their fellow creatures living in the north. Starting Monday, under a caption that says An Inconvenient Truth, the menagerie will find their world shrinking and their conversations will be about global warming.

title: Canadas Treaty Payments: Meager Reminder of a Painful History
description: WINNIPEG, Manitoba  On a brilliant afternoon in Winnipeg, scores of indigenous people lined up under a large white tent to collect whats known as the annual treaty payment  money stipulated in treaties, signed by past generations with the Canadian government in exchange for territory.

title: Your Best Tips for Beating Procrastination
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. Editor Tim Herrera emails readers once a week with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: Companies Rush to Develop Utterly Transformative Gene Therapies
description: The approval of gene therapy for leukemia, expected in the next few months, will open the door to a radically new class of cancer treatments.

title: Another Look at Princess Diana, With a Notable Difference
description: LONDON  Since the world awoke, on Aug. 31, 1997, to the news that Princess Diana had died at 36, after a paparazzi-fueled car crash in Paris, there have been hundreds of films, documentaries, biographies and tell-all memoirs about the shy young woman who became a global celebrity after marrying the heir to the British throne.

title: Mosque Crisis and Jordan Attack Raise Fears of Escalating Violence in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli security cabinet convened for urgent discussions late Sunday, amid fears that a standoff over Israels placement of metal detectors at entrances to the sacred Aqsa Mosque compound could result in a long wave of violence.

title: Dunkirk Exceeds Box Office Expectations as Valerian Bombs
description: LOS ANGELES  Dunkirk and Girls Trip won big at the weekend box office by breaking unwritten Hollywood rules about release dates and cast diversity. But another flouter of film industry norms, the surreal, independently financed space adventure Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets, was dead on arrival.

title: Sean Spicer, British Open, Israel: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: U.S. Army Sergeant Is Charged With Trying to Aid Islamic State
description: WASHINGTON  An Army sergeant stationed in Hawaii was charged with trying to provide equipment, training and classified military information to the Islamic State, after undercover F.B.I. agents documented his offers of support to the militant group in a series of meetings in June and July, according to an indictment.

title: Eyesore or Blessing? New Safety Feature at Citi Field Divides Fans
description: To some, it is an eyesore, a reason not to come to the ballpark and additional evidence of a Nanny State run amok.

title: Angela Merkels Humanity, Captured in an Elizabeth Peyton Oil
description: BERLIN  The last time Vogue profiled a prominent European female leader, Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain, she agreed to be captured by Annie Leibovitz  in a rainbow array of coats and her trademark leopard-print kitten heels.

title: When Will Kabila Go? Congolese Leader Long Overstays His Welcome
description: KINSHASA, the Democratic Republic of Congo  In Congo, they are calling it le glissement.

title: At Chicago Sun-Times, New Owners Vow Return to Papers Working-Class Roots
description: CHICAGO  At a Christmas party in December, Edwin Eisendrath, a former Chicago alderman, bumped into Jorge Ramirez, a labor leader. As guests nibbled on decadent desserts, the two men contemplated an audacious plan.

title: Tim and Eric Figure Out How to Do the Wrong Thing, Perfectly
description: At the end of their live show currently touring the country, Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim  better known as Tim and Eric  leave the stage after introducing their final act, a third performer who comes off as a parody of a 1980s observational comic, his jokes drowned out by loud music.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Affluence Without Abundance
description: The mantra of the 21st century might be that the world is interconnected everywhere, but the anthropologist James Suzman knows better. For more than two decades, Suzman has researched and gotten to know various groups of Bushmen throughout southern Africa. In Affluence Without Abundance, he writes of what hes learned about these hunter-gatherers and their way of life, how they have clashed with (and avoided) modernity, and what their society has taught him about how the rest of the world lives. Along with its anthropological insights, the book offers personal portraits of several Bushmen. Below, Suzman discusses why he chose to bring together his years of experience in this book, our societys obsession with work, his respect for documentary photographers and more.

title: Review: People of Earth Returns for Affectingly Close Encounters
description: The first question any sci-fi story about alien contact raises is: What do they want from us? On TBSs People of Earth, the answer is nebulous  information, possibly domination. But also, not unlike E.T., they love our junk food. Be proud, humans: We have amazing junk food.

title: For Warner Bros., a Cinematic Universe Built of Lego Bricks
description: Lego and Warner Bros. Entertainment seem to be perfect partners: One is a multinational toy company in search of expansion, and the other is a global entertainment giant looking for more content.

title: Review: Steve Jobs of Apple, Tech Visionary, Has Glitches as an Opera
description: SANTA FE, N.M.  The products he created are some of the most innovative and important of our time. But if Steve Jobs the man is interesting, its because he was such a jerk. Hes frustrating fodder for that eternal question: How could someone with such elegant, sensitive visions be so unremittingly willful, tyrannical, unfeeling, ungiving?

title: Review: U.S. Youth Orchestra Inspires a Chinese Counterpart
description: Imitation can be the sincerest form of flattery, as was demonstrated by two exciting concerts on consecutive nights at Carnegie Hall this weekend.

title: When Health Law Isnt Enough, the Desperate Line Up at Tents
description: WISE, Va.  Anthony Marino, 54, reached into his car trunk to show a pair of needle-nosed pliers like the ones he used to yank out a rotting tooth.

title: Taliban Seize Two More Afghan Districts in Sustained Fighting
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  In the latest sign of intensifying Taliban violence across Afghanistan, insurgents overran two districts in the north and the west of the country on Sunday, in one case shooting patients at a hospital and torching government facilities, Afghan officials said.

title: De Blasio, Riding Subway, Demands Cuomo Fix the System
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio delivered a lashing message to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Sunday from a camera-packed subway car in Brooklyn: You fix this. And dont ask the city for any more money.

title: In China, Herd of Gray Rhinos Threatens Economy
description: SHANGHAI  Let the West worry about so-called black swans, rare and unexpected events that can upset financial markets. China is more concerned about gray rhinos  large and visible problems in the economy that are ignored until they start moving fast.

title: With Wings and a Magic Wand
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Peter Gordon is back and he offers us a very smooth puzzle with a lighthearted theme to start our solving week.

title: With More Ships in the Arctic, Fears of Disaster Rise
description: When the Crystal Serenity, a 1,000-passenger luxury liner, sails in August on a monthlong Arctic cruise through the Northwest Passage, it will have a far more utilitarian escort: a British supply ship.

title: W.N.B.A.s Seattle Storm Embrace a Role in Social Activism
description: SEATTLE  When the three women who make up Force 10 Hoops, the ownership group of the Seattle Storm, first purchased the team a decade ago, they did not see it as only a sports venture.

title: If GoDaddy Can Turn the Corner on Sexism, Who Cant?
description: A few years after Blake Irving became chief executive of the internet company GoDaddy, he spoke at a conference where the jeers started almost immediately.

title: Women in the Theater
description: To the Editor:

title: Noise Is a Health Hazard
description: To the Editor:

title: The Plight of Unions, and How to Revive Them
description: To the Editor:

title: Who Should Pay for Public Works?
description: To the Editor:

title: Small Businesses Split Over Republican Health Plans
description: Small-business owners have been some of the most vocal opponents of the Affordable Care Act. One trade group fought the overhaul all the way to the Supreme Court.

title: I Love Your Skirt
description: Dear Diary:

title: Swimmer Matt Greverss Revival Lets Him Continue a Career
description: At the 2016 United States Olympic trials, Matt Grevers clocked 52.76 seconds in the 100-meter backstroke and was devastated. A year later, Grevers clocked 52.71 at the United States world championships trials and was overjoyed.

title: Bronx Hotline Helps People Make the Right Call After an Arrest
description: For the more than 250,000 people who are arrested each year in New York City, phone calls to lawyers and loved ones can mean the difference between freedom and jail.

title: For Trump and Putin, Sanctions Are a Setback Both Sought to Avoid
description: WASHINGTON  Throughout 2016, both Donald J. Trump and President Vladimir V. Putin complained that American-led sanctions against Russia were the biggest irritant in the plummeting relations between the two superpowers. And the current investigations, which have cast a shadow over Mr. Trumps first six months in office, have focused on whether a series of contacts between Mr. Trumps inner circle and Russians were partly about constructing deals to get those penalties lifted.

title: Mets Fall to Athletics and Face Likelihood of Roster Changes Before Trade Deadline
description: The Mets bags were packed and ready to go after Sundays 3-2 loss to the Oakland Athletics at Citi Field. But it was difficult to shake the feeling that for some of the players in the Mets clubhouse the flight to San Diego to start a 10-game West Coast trip was going to be a one-way journey. No one could say for sure which of the players who departed Sunday night would be on the return flight.

title: Quotation of the Day: When Health Law Falls Short, the Desperate Line Up at Tents
description: Were sicker here than in Central America. In Central America, theyre eating beans and rice and walking everywhere. Theyre not drinking Mountain Dew and eating candy.

title: John Kundla, Winning Coach of Fledgling Lakers, Dies at 101
description: Before the Los Angeles Lakers became an N.B.A. glamour team, their forebears dominated pro basketball far from the flash of Hollywood.

title: OPEC Will Discuss Production, and a Batch of Earnings Are Due
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Squirrel Attacks in Prospect Park Lead to Worry of Rabies
description: New York City health officials are urging anyone who visited Prospect Park in Brooklyn recently and was bitten by an unusually aggressive, possibly rabid, squirrel to seek emergency medical care.

title: David Mamet Doesnt Want to Hear From You. Do Other Playwrights?
description: Got something to say about a play? Not in the theater, please.

title: For Farmers Without Land, a Long Island Lawn Will Do
description: BAY SHORE, N.Y.  Jim Adams met his wife on a trip to Uganda a decade ago. Rosette Basiima Adams, 35, grew up in Kasese, a town, she said, where everything we ate, we grew.

title: Frazier Finds a New Swing, and It Pays Off Quickly in Yankees Win
description: SEATTLE  Once the thrill of hitting a home run in his first game in the major leagues had worn off  and it did take a little time  Clint Frazier found himself in a funk. He did not so much stand in the batters box as squirm. He knew he was jumping at the ball, but he did not know how to stop.

title: Policy Change on Housing Rescue
description: Documents recently unsealed in a lawsuit against the federal government by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac shareholders shed light on a crucial 2012 policy change by the Treasury Department.

title: U.S. Foresaw Better Return in Seizing Fannie and Freddie Profits
description: In August 2012, the federal government abruptly changed the terms of the bailout provided to Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, the mortgage finance giants that had been devastated by the financial crisis. Instead of continuing to receive payments on the taxpayer assistance, Treasury officials decided to begin seizing all the profits both companies generated every quarter.

title: Leader Who Rebuilt Time Warner Empire Prepares an Exit
description: Jeffrey L. Bewkes championed acclaimed series like The Sopranos and Sex and the City at HBO, salvaged Time Warner from its disastrous merger with AOL and publicly battled his rival media mogul Rupert Murdoch three years ago to fend off a hostile takeover.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of July 24
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Anthony Scaramucci, New Communications Chief, Woos Trump on TV
description: Anthony Scaramucci was almost finished with one of his three Sunday television talk show appearances when he started speaking directly to one particular viewer at home.

title: No Corrections: July 24, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Game of Thrones Season 7, Episode 2 Recap: Stormborn
description: One thing we knew going into Season 7 of Game of Thrones was that as the expansive story began to contract toward its conclusion, characters who had been long separated or were strangers to one another would begin to come together.

title: Summer Vacation Packing: The Beauty Edition
description: The summer travel season, now in full swing, is the opportune time to give new beauty products a whirl. After all, a travel-size product is hardly a commitment. Weve rounded up a cache of gems suitable for a beach vacation, a destination wedding and an adventure trip. Best of all, theyre already tested: They come highly recommended by an assortment of entrepreneurs and celebrities.

title: Scott Pruitt Spent Much of Early Months at E.P.A. Traveling Home, Report Says
description: Scott Pruitt, the head of the Environmental Protection Agency, traveled to his home state, Oklahoma, 10 times over three months this year, largely at taxpayer expense, according to a report released Monday.

title: Turkey, BBC, Israel: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Kershaw Bound for D.L. With Back Problem
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers left-hander Clayton Kershaw is headed to the disabled list after his latest back injury.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Diana, Our Mother and Somewhere Between
description: Twenty years after the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, her sons pay tribute to her memory. And Paula Patton stars as a news producer stuck in a murderous loop in an adaptation of a South Korean thriller.

title: Living to Modernize Afghanistan, and Meeting a Grim End
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  From a dusty village in central Afghanistan, where life depends on the almond harvest, Najiba Hussaini made it far.

title: President Bachelet of Chile Is the Last Woman Standing in the Americas
description: SANTIAGO, Chile  No one relished the milestone more than President Michelle Bachelet of Chile.

title: The Mayor and the Restaurateur: How de Blasio Sought Help for an Early Donor
description: Less than six months after Bill de Blasio became mayor of New York City, a campaign donor buttonholed him at an event in Manhattan. The donor, Harendra Singh, one of the earliest contributors to his mayoral campaign, ran a restaurant on city property and was having problems with the lease. Could the mayor help him?

title: Exposing Life Behind the Berlin Wall
description: Harf Zimmermann recorded the day-to-day of his East German neighborhood during the 80s.

title: Chuck Schumer: A Better Deal for American Workers
description: Americans are clamoring for bold changes to our politics and our economy. They feel, rightfully, that both systems are rigged against them, and they made that clear in last years election. American families deserve a better deal so that this country works for everyone again, not just the elites and special interests. Today, Democrats will start presenting that better deal to the American people.

title: My Gay Agenda
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass.  My wife and I spent the morning riding our bicycles to the beach. It was a beautiful day. Seals dived in the surf, a couple played Kadima with their grandchildren, and Deirdre and I lay in the sun.

title: California Shows How States Can Lead on Climate Change
description: California, which has long been a pioneer in fighting climate change, renewed its commitment to reducing greenhouse gas emissions last week by extending, to 2030, its cap-and-trade program, which effectively puts a price on emissions. Its a bold, bipartisan commitment that invites similarly ambitious policies from other states, and it sends a strong signal to the world that millions of Americans regard with utmost seriousness a threat the Trump administration refuses to acknowledge, let alone reckon with.

title: Health Care Is Still in Danger
description: Will Senate Republicans try to destroy health care under cover of a constitutional crisis? Thats a serious question, based in part on what happened in the House earlier this year.

title: Mr. Trumps Russian Base Beyond the Kremlin
description: No American should have a keener sense of the dark intrigues that underpin Kremlin politics than Mikhail Rubinsteyn, who arrived from Russia almost four decades ago as Brighton Beach was morphing into Brooklyns bastion for refugees from the Moscow regime.

title: The Bushmen Who Had the Whole Work-Life Thing Figured Out
description: Every year automation and computerization squeeze out new segments of the labor force. In response, trade unions and workers anxiously wring their hands while savvy politicians demonize the sinister forces of globalization and make promises about job retention that they almost certainly wont be able to keep.

title: Make It So: Star Trek and Its Debt to Revolutionary Socialism
description: H. G. Wellss foundational work of political science fiction, The Time Machine, predicted a future in which a small utopia of sprightly elites is kept running by a subclass that lives below the ground and is reduced to bestial violence. This prediction, carried to a horrifically logical extent, represented the intense wealth disparity of the Victorian England in which Wells wrote the novel. Judging from the major political narratives of the fictions of our era, films like The Hunger Games, Elysium and Snowpiercer, the certainty of a future rendered increasingly barbarous by class division remains essentially the same.

title: The Kook, the Mooch and the Loot
description: On Friday, a president with no political experience brought on a communications director with no communications experience.

title: Exposing Life Behind the Berlin Wall
description: The first time Harf Zimmermann visited East Berlins Hufelandstrasse neighborhood, he sensed it was unlike any other neighborhood hed known in East Germany. Linden trees lined the streets, as did many privately-owned shops, an unusual sight in a socialist state.

title: Sensing Weakness, Ubers Asian Rivals Make $2.5 Billion Play
description: HONG KONG  In East Asia, Ubers biggest rivals smell blood.

title: No Jab, No Play: How Australia Is Handling the Vaccination Debate
description: This much is clear: Australias strict vaccination laws are working  and theyre set to become even stricter. The state of South Australia has introduced legislation that would ban the enrollment of unvaccinated children in preschool and child care centers.

title: Polands President Vetoes 2 Proposed Laws Limiting Courts Independence
description: WARSAW  Andrzej Duda was a relatively obscure member of the right-wing Law and Justice party when the leader of the party and the most powerful man in the country plucked him from the chorus line to become its candidate for president in 2015. For most of the partys first 20 months in power, he was a reliable proponent of the governing partys nationalist initiatives.

title: A Rest Stop for Half a Billion Birds
description: During their migration between Europe and Africa, hundreds of millions of birds stop in Israel to rest and refuel. Hop aboard a government-sponsored tractor spreading birdseed and corn to keep the birds away from local crop fields.

title: A Lot Like Prayer: Remembering Denis Johnson
description: I was working as an editor at Esquire in 1990 when I sent the novelist and poet Denis Johnson a photograph Id clipped from The New York Times of a Liberian fighter in the countrys civil war, posing at the edge of a field, resplendently horrific in a wedding gown, cradling an automatic rifle, a womans wig perched jauntily atop his head. Donning such finery was said to have protected its wearers from bullets while wreaking terror in their enemies. The picture summoned for me the syncretic, post-apocalyptic imagery of Deniss second novel, Fiskadoro, in which the long-dead Bob Marley is an actual god for the hard-bitten people of the Florida Keys.

title: Why Planes Get Hot  and How to Stay Cool When They Do
