description: When outside temperatures soar, how exactly do airlines keep their passengers cool on board? The topic of airplane cabin temperature has garnered headlines this summer with a handful of instances in which passengers have complained about sweltering cabin heat.

title: An Odyssey Through Self-Harm and Out the Other Side
description: LIGHTS ON, RATS OUT A Memoir By Cree LeFavour 312 pp. Grove Press. $25.

title: Junes Book Club Pick: Less, by Andrew Sean Greer
description: LESS By Andrew Sean Greer 263 pp. A Lee Boudreaux Book/Little, Brown & Company. $26.

title: U.S. Inflation Remains Low, and Thats a Problem
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has a problem: not enough inflation.

title: New Ways to Help Speed Up Your Travel Planning
description: Travel is supposed to be about the journey. The goal isnt to get there first. Yet a variety of new services are aiming to speed things along, be it automatically checking you in for your flight, accompanying you through security, reserving a car or hotel with voice commands, or whisking you to the French countryside on new high-speed trains. Heres a look at half a dozen of the latest innovations.

title: You Create That Chemistry: How Actors Fall in Instant Love
description: The course of true love hardly ever runs smooth? Agreed. But few romances are as extravagantly potholed as Shakespeares A Midsummer Nights Dream. Yes, the play ends with an extravagant wedding, but the path down the aisle is cratered with a death threat, an elopement, pixie interference and the greatest catfight in world literature. Also, botanical date-rape drugs.

title: Which Metrics on Hospital Quality Should Patients Pay Attention To?
description: The relatively recent movements toward transparency and quality in health care have collided to produce dozens of publicly available hospital quality metrics. You might consider studying them in advance of your next hospital visit. But how do you know if the metrics actually mean anything?

title: The Daily: Spicer Out, Sanctions Approved, Pardons for All?
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Jared Kushner, Poland, Game of Thrones: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Pyramid Investigation Has Investors Protesting Near Heart of Beijing
description: BEIJING  Many hundreds of Chinese investors who paid into what the police have called a pyramid investment scheme took to the streets of Beijing on Monday, not to denounce the business in which some had placed their life savings, but to oppose the government investigation that threatened their earnings.

title: Morning Agenda: Time Warners Chief Prepares for His Departure
description: Over 38 years, Jeffrey L. Bewkes rose from being a junior staff member at HBO whose desk was a stack of boxes to being the chief executive of Time Warner.

title: New York Today: Blocking Out the Citys Noise
description: Good morning on this drizzly Monday.

title: Instead of Dumbing Down Shakespeare, Smarten Up the Kids
description: I marked Fathers Day this June by attending a special showing of High Noon at Film Forum in the West Village, glorious on the big screen, with comments afterward by Maria Cooper Janis, the daughter of its star, Gary Cooper, and Glenn Frankel, who wrote a book, High Noon: The Hollywood Blacklist and the Making of an American Classic.

title: The Subtle Signs of a Thyroid Disorder
description: Problems with estrogen and testosterone, the bodys main sex hormones, tend to attract widespread public interest. But we might all be better off paying more attention to a far more common endocrine disorder: abnormal levels of thyroid hormone. Thyroid disorders can affect a wide range of bodily functions and cause an array of confusing and often misdiagnosed symptoms.

title: I Did Not Collude, Kushner Says After Meeting Senate Investigators
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps son-in-law, Jared Kushner, described himself to Senate investigators on Monday as a political and foreign policy neophyte who met with Russians as part of a hectic and unconventional presidential campaign, not as part of a plot to steer the election.

title: Read Jared Kushners Prepared Remarks
description: Jared Kushners representatives released on Monday morning prepared remarks for Senate investigators. In the statement, Mr. Kushner flatly denied participating in  or having any knowledge about  collusion with Russia.

title: The Outcomes of the Many Republican Health Plans Are Not So Different
description: Comparing how the plans would affect key measures like the number of uninsured and the deficit.

title: Sentence in Aboriginal Teens Death Is Too Lenient, Protesters in Australia Say
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Shouting shame, protesters on Monday held demonstrations across Australia to express their anger over what they said was a lenient sentence in the death of a 14-year-old Aboriginal boy.

title: U.N. Says Australia Reneged on Pledge to Accept Some Refugees
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees has accused the Australian government of reneging on a clear understanding that some refugees detained offshore who have close family ties in Australia could be resettled in the country.

title: What Is Appropriate Work Dress? Readers Respond
description: The National Assembly of France decided last week, like earlier decisions in the House of Commons in Britain and the House of Representatives in the United States, that it was time to rethink an unspoken dress code, and officially announced that members would be free to choose whether to wear a suit and tie while in the chamber.

title: California Today: Turmoil at U.S.C.
description: Good morning.

title: Irans Top Diplomat Discusses Economic Impact of Nuclear Deal
description: Iran's foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, spoke to The New York Times as he wrapped up a trip to the United States at a time when the nuclear deal  and the economic benefits that it brings to his country  is in limbo.

title: Former Political Star in China Is Under Party Investigation
description: BEIJING  The Chinese Communist Party said on Monday that Sun Zhengcai, a high-flying politician who had been seen as a potential future premier, was under investigation over suspected grave violations of discipline, ending his career and raising the stakes of a national leadership shake-up that is just months away.

title: Florida to Pay Legal Fees in Case That Kept Doctors From Discussing Guns
description: Florida has agreed to pay $1.1 million in legal fees to lawyers who sued the state over a 2011 law that barred doctors from talking to patients about gun ownership, according to a gun control organization involved in the case.

title: Border Games: Russias Creeping Occupation
description: The borders between Georgia and the disputed territory of South Ossetia are blurry. Georgians say the Russian military is using signs, fences and guard stations to take pieces of Georgian land, yard by yard.

title: Thanks, Comey, Says Team Trump
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: K.K.R. to Buy WebMD and Take Majority Stake in Natures Bounty
description: LONDON  The private equity giant Kohlberg Kravis Roberts has struck two deals focused on health and wellness, agreeing to buy WebMD and taking a majority stake in the Natures Bounty Company.

title: Why I Bring My Gun to School
description: It was my first year as a public policy graduate student at the University of Texas, Dallas, and I was taking all my classes at night so I could work during the day. Every evening, after class got out around 10, I had to walk through the sprawling parking lots to get to my car. I dreaded that time of day. I would pray that no one was lurking in dimly lit areas or behind cars, and Id try not to think about the campus police alerts Id seen about sexual assaults in the area.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 11: Theres No Backup for This
description: Our regular recapper, Noel Murray, is off this week.

title: Parents of Charlie Gard, Ill British Infant, Abandon Effort to Prolong His Life
description: LONDON  The parents of Charlie Gard, the chronically ill British infant whose plight drew attention from Pope Francis and President Trump, on Monday gave up their wrenching legal effort to artificially prolong his life, bowing to the consensus of medical experts who said there was no realistic chance of saving him.

title: Richard Dawkins Event Canceled Over Past Comments About Islam
description: A public radio station in Berkeley, Calif., said it canceled a live discussion and book signing with the evolutionary biologist and noted atheist Richard Dawkins because of his past comments criticizing Islam.

title: Michael Phelps Raced a Shark, Kind Of. Not Really.
description: For nearly 30 years, Shark Week has been a reliable way for the Discovery Channel to create buzz for itself once a year. The publics appetite for shark-based programming seems inexhaustible. And this year, the channel outdid itself.

title: A Dangerous Idea: Eliminating the Chemical Safety Board
description: RICHMOND, Calif.  The United States Chemical Safety Board is a federal watchdog with more bark than bite. It has five board members, a tiny staff of less than 50 and a budget of some $11 million a year. Its mission is to investigate fires and explosions in oil refineries and chemical plants.

title: In Taking Aim at His Attorney General, Trump Tests Sessionss Views
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump took a second highly public swipe at Attorney General Jeff Sessions on Monday, an apparent attempt to influence Justice Department investigations that challenged Mr. Sessionss longstanding view that the agencys work should be free from political sway.

title: A Bleak Picture for Women Trying to Rise at Law Firms
description: Even as more women add a law degree to their rsums, carving out a successful career at a law firm remains an uphill endeavor.

title: Greece Looks to Turn a Corner After Years of Economic Pain
description: Greece, long Europes economic problem child, is trying to prove that it has made progress in its recovery efforts by announcing plans to sell debt for the first time in years.

title: He Called the School Board Racist. Now, Hes Joined It.
description: DECATUR, Ill.  Back when he was a member of a notorious street gang, Courtney Carson was as loyal as they come. When he heard that a confidant had flipped from the Black Stones to the rival Gangster Disciples, he rounded up some friends and confronted the defector at a high school football game.

title: New York Times Asks Fox for Apology After Inaccurate Segment
description: The New York Times has asked that the television show Fox & Friends apologize for what a Times spokeswoman described as a malicious and inaccurate segment that aired last week accusing the paper of publishing a story in 2015 that had hindered the United States militarys attempt to kill Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of ISIS.

title: The New Presidential Interview
description: WASHINGTON  As we walked out the door of the West Wing, the one sometimes guarded by a uniformed Marine and used by the president to greet visiting heads of state, editors back in the office texted the obvious question: Did we have any news?

title: Me vetaron en Venezuela por reportar su realidad
description: Nicholas Casey, nuestro corresponsal en Caracas, cubri la debacle econmica y el caos poltico de Venezuela, hasta que el gobierno de Nicols Maduro decidi impedirle volver a entrar al pas.

title: I Was Banned From Venezuela
description: Nicholas Casey, our correspondent in Caracas, covered the economic and political crisis in Venezuela for eight months until the government banned him from returning to the country.

title: Sacred Lakes Threatened by Chinas Growing Capital
description: LAKE BAIYANGDIAN, China  A few hours by car south of Beijing is a delicate string of lakes and ponds famous over the centuries for its fishing, its hunting, its cooling summer breezes.

title: The Company Behind Many Surprise Emergency Room Bills
description: Early last year, executives at a small hospital an hour north of Spokane, Wash., started using a company called EmCare to staff and run their emergency room. The hospital had been struggling to find doctors to work in its E.R., and turning to EmCare was something hundreds of other hospitals across the country had done.

title: Cook Those Blues Away
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: In San Antonio Smuggling Case, a Fatal Journey in a Packed and Sweltering Truck
description: SAN ANTONIO  When the smugglers first closed the door of the trucks trailer, it was pitch black inside.

title: The Drug Maker Sanofis New Dengue Vaccine
description: To the Editor:

title: Using Your Phone to Scan Pictures of Prints
description: Q. Do photo-scanning apps for phones really do much more besides take a picture of the picture you want to scan?

title: Arconic, Which Sold Panels at Center of London Fire, Reports Higher Profit
description: Arconic, the American company that gained notoriety for selling combustible material used at the site of Britains deadliest fire in more than a century, reported better-than-expected profit on Monday.

title: Stranger Things Season 2: Watch the Full Trailer
description: Rotting pumpkins, Ghostbusters costumes and Michael Jacksons Thriller can only mean one thing: Halloween has come to Hawkins, Ind.

title: Three TV Shows to Stream This Week (and a Podcast)
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Three TV Shows to Stream This Week (and a Podcast)
description: Are you in the mood for lemurs, a Britcom or a new F.B.I. agent? If so, Margaret Lyons has some recommendations for you.

title: Jordan Spieth and Rory McIlroy, the Giants of the Modern Game
description: SOUTHPORT, England  Jordan Spieth is the kid in class who obtains the course syllabus over the summer so he can read all the textbooks before the start of the school year and who never turns down an extra-credit assignment.

title: Finding a Common Language Through Olive Oil
description: These oils have Palestinian and Israeli roots. Palestinian women cultivate and harvest olives from groves north of Galilee for use in the nonprofit company Sindyanna of Galilees olive oils, which are made by Israeli women. At Kalustyans in New York, Dona Abramson, a manager, has the cold-pressed, fair-trade, extra-virgin olive oils on a shelf between Israeli and Palestinian oils. The store carries three of them. The pungent, peppery Coratina and the lightly herbaceous Barnea are the most distinctive: $15.99 for 17 ounces; an organic variety is $12.99 for 8.45 ounces, $18.99 for 17 ounces, Kalustyans, 123 Lexington Avenue (29th Street), 212-685-3451.

title: Daily Report: A Venture Capitalist and His Famous Father
description: If you work in the tech industry, its a good bet you know who Ben Horowitz is: Venture capitalist. Entrepreneur. Netscape veteran. Serious fan of hip-hop music.

title: Steak Knives, Favored by Chefs, Now Available for Your Table
description: I am one of those people in restaurants who turns over the dinner plate or the base of stemware to find out the maker. At the new Union Square Cafe, the straightforward, comfortable steak knives stamped 9.47 caught my eye. The model was by Perceval knives, made in Thiers, France, a town west of Lyon thats been known for cutlery since the 14th century. The blade is simple, not serrated, and based on the design of the companys pocketknife. I have seen these beauties at Pasquale Jones and at Le Coucou, whose chef, Daniel Rose, also uses them in his Paris restaurants. They are now available for retail in nine handle colors, five wood grains and carbon fiber in the United States: Perceval steak knives, $95 each for colored handle, $175 to $990 each for wood handle, TableArt, 323-653-8278, tableartonline.com.

title: Ready-Made Panini Picnic Steps From Central Park
description: A freshly made, well-stuffed sandwich with a side dish, a drink and a dessert pastry can be had on the Upper East Side, just steps from Central Park. Altesi sells an assortment of made-to-order panini on ciabatta at its 64th Street and SoHo locations. Fillings include breaded chicken cutlet with arugula; vegetable frittata; caprese with tomato, mozzarella and pesto; and prosciutto and cheese: A2Go panini, $20, available noon to 4 p.m., Altesi Madison, 26 East 64th Street, 212-759-8900, and Altesi Downtown, 200 Spring Street (Sullivan Street), 212-431-1212, altesinyc.com.

title: Q. and A.: Grey Worm and Missandeis Tender Moment on Game of Thrones
description: It was a mixed week for eunuchs on Game of Thrones. Dany expressed doubt about Varyss loyalty and Theon abandoned his sister in the midst of battle. Grey Worm, however ... he did all right. Most couples on this series are doomed, or at least face insurmountable odds. For Grey Worm (Jacob Anderson) and Missandei (Nathalie Emmanuel), those challenges include the emotional conditioning he underwent in order to become one of the Unsullied. Oh, also the fact that he was castrated long ago.

title: Even Tiny Changes in Earths Orbit Would Yield Global Catastrophe
description: Q. Lets say Earths orbit moved closer to the sun. How small a change would be disastrous?

title: Youre No Coward if Youre Keeping Some Money Out of Stocks
description: If youre a bit scared about investing your money right now, youre not alone. Ive received many emails and comments recently from people who have money to invest. They even know how it should be invested. But they just cant get themselves to put the money into the stock market.

title: For the Chile Aficionado, a Good Book
description: In this colorful, encyclopedic book on peppers, the chef Maricel E. Presilla, an expert on Latin American cooking, explains the New World origins of the pepper genus in Bolivia, how chiles eventually traveled around the world, what accounts for their heat and how they are used. True to its title, the book dwells on the New World, with very brief detours to Asia, Eastern Europe, Spain and elsewhere. Sections on dried chiles, growing and preparing peppers, and recipes for condiments and chile-centric dishes are included: Peppers of the Americas: The Remarkable Capsicums That Forever Changed Flavor by Maricel E. Presilla (Lorena Jones Books, $35).

title: Israel Agrees to Remove Metal Detectors at Entrances to Aqsa Mosque Compound
description: JERUSALEM  After days of violent protests, bloodshed and a diplomatic crisis with Jordan over the placement of metal detectors at the entrances to the Aqsa Mosque Compound in Jerusalems Old City, the Israeli government said early Tuesday it would remove them.

title: Hat. Rabbit. Spy Cam? Claims of Skulduggery at a Hot Magic Show
description: The magician Derek DelGaudio has been credited with trying to reinvigorate magic, using an approach that emphasizes deeply personal storytelling and conceptual-art riddles as much as baffling illusions, dazzling card handling and apparent mind reading.

title: At Oil Producers Meeting, Tough Talk Fails to Convince Markets
description: When major oil producers met in St. Petersburg, Russia, on Monday, the talk was tough. Officials hoped to show they were following through on plans to cut production and, in turn, bolster prices. The oil minister of Saudi Arabia, the worlds biggest exporter, even cut short his summer vacation to attend.

title: Population Growth
description: To the Editor:

title: Tackling Gender Stereotypes
description: To the Editor:

title: Immigrant Drivers Licenses
description: To the Editor:

title: Memories of Penn Station
description: To the Editor:

title: Libor and London Whale Cases Show Hurdles With Foreign Defendants
description: White-collar crime investigations involving large institutions start with an avalanche of records, but they require a cooperating witness to provide a road map to what happened and what the participants were thinking.

title: Benczkowksi Discloses He Represented Alfa Bank
description: In a letter obtained by The New York Times, President Trump's nominee to run the Justice Department criminal division, Brian A. Benczkowski, disclosed to Congress that he previously represented Alfa Bank, one of Russias largest financial institutions.

title: Pardons and a Trump-Putin Private Chat
description: To the Editor:

title: Senate Braces for Health Showdown With McCain on Hand but a Plan Unclear
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Republican leaders, keeping alive their push to dismantle the Affordable Care Act, are barreling toward a showdown vote on Tuesday to begin debating a repeal of the health law. And Senator John McCain announced Monday night that he will be on hand to cast his vote, despite a diagnosis of brain cancer.

title: Justice Dept. Nominee Says He Once Represented Russian Bank
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps nominee to lead the Justice Departments criminal division, Brian A. Benczkowski, has disclosed to Congress that he previously represented Alfa Bank, one of Russias largest financial institutions, whose owners have ties to President Vladimir V. Putin.

title: Turkey Opens Trial of 17 Journalists on Terrorism Charges
description: ISTANBUL  Seventeen journalists and executives of the last prominent independent newspaper in Turkey, Cumhuriyet, went on trial in Istanbul on Monday, accused of aiding terrorist organizations under a government crackdown against opponents since a failed coup last year.

title: Second Attempt at a Roll-Up for WebMD Makes More Sense
description: WebMDs roll-up strategy finally got a second opinion.

title: How the Health Bill Could Cost Senators in the Next Election
description: Republicans could eliminate coverage for millions of their own constituents, creating a cohort of uninsured voters in the next election.

title: The Ballerina Who Can Stop Time (and Restart It, Too)
description: Most of us, most of our days, are subject to time. We follow calendars and clocks like slaves. The finest dancers, however, seem to govern time, to find and possess it without haste and even, for moments, to suspend it altogether. The musics pulse runs on apace; but they pack every measure with important-seeming activity, now and then playing with the beat, here a hairbreadth behind and there a bit ahead of the music, sometimes pausing miraculously amid the pressing momentum of the dance.

title: Disney Splits With the YouTube Star Jake Paul
description: Disney is parting ways with Jake Paul, a YouTube star who appeared on the Disney Channel series Bizaardvark, days after he was the subject of a television news report about neighbors who were upset with his antics.

title: When a Service Animal Has to Go, Airports Options May Be Wanting
description: Michael May, who recently became the chief executive of the Lighthouse for the Blind in Seattle, has his own system for rating airports, and under that system, OHare International Airport in Chicago gets a thumbs down and Washington Dulles International Airport a thumbs up.

title: Its High Time for Ticks, Which Are Spreading Diseases Farther
description: SOUTHAMPTON, N.Y.  This town is under siege from tiny invaders.

title: Books From the Frick to Offer Authors Views on Major Works
description: The novelist Hilary Mantel, the filmmaker James Ivory and the artist and author Edmund de Waal are among the first participants in Frick Diptychs, a new series of small books to be published by the museum that pair masterworks from the Frick Collection with critical and literary essays.

title: In Some Countries, Women Get Days Off for Period Pain
description: Recently Akanksha Seda got in her car at 10:30 a.m., as usual, and rode 45 minutes to her companys office in Mumbai, India. A few hours later, she got her period and, she recalled, the eighteen-wheeler truckload of cramps.

title: World Music Institute Expands for Next Concert Season
description: The World Music Institute will bring acclaimed musicians from across the globe to New York for more than 40 performances next season. This nonprofit organizations new programming includes mini-festivals dedicated to music from Mali and India, and from contemporary Jewish culture.

title: Jay-Zs 4:44 Repeats at No. 1 as Hip-Hop Dominates the Top 5
description: The new Jay-Z album, 4:44, an intimate, sometimes borderline-uncomfortable self-examination from this 47-year-old rapper (who also happens to be Beyoncs husband), is sustaining peoples attention. And hip-hop in general is doing the same, occupying all five spots on the Billboard Top 5 this week, largely thanks to streaming.

title: Man Assaults Workers With Chain Saw at Swiss Insurance Firm
description: BERLIN  The Swiss police were searching Monday for a man accused of attacking people with a chain saw at a health insurance office in the city of Schaffhausen, near the German border.

title: Suicide Bombing Targeting Pakistani Police Kills at Least 26
description: LAHORE, Pakistan  At least 26 people were killed and 58 others were injured Monday afternoon in a suicide explosion that targeted the police in eastern Pakistan, officials said.

title: With New Vacuums, M.T.A. Workers Make Grimy Subway Tracks Shine
description: Overcrowding on the subway, derailments on commuter railroads, not to mention urgent repairs at Pennsylvania Station, are all contributing to an unpleasant summer for many travelers in and around New York City.

title: Microsoft Paints Days May Be Numbered
description: When Microsoft previewed Windows to InfoWorld magazine in 1983, two years before the now-ubiquitous operating system was first sold, the company showcased just one application: a pared-down painting program.

title: Jared Kushner, Rodrigo Duterte, Russia: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: This Is Not the Mooch I Know
description: Its been a rough start for my friend Anthony Scaramucci as President Trumps surprise  and surprising  choice as the new White House communications director. Thats too bad, because I would like nothing better than for him to succeed wildly in his new job. Lord knows Mr. Trump can use the help.

title: Lets Talk About Suicide
description: Chester Bennington, the lead singer of the band Linkin Park, was found dead on Thursday in his home near Los Angeles. The coroners office has confirmed that the 41-year-old died of suicide. Thats something I  and so many millions of other Americans suffering from mental illness  have considered.

title: Young Digital Artists, Anxious About ... Technology
description: Digital art at Sothebys? The auction house is better known for selling canvases by Andy Warhol and Jean-Michel Basquiat for $100 million-plus than for showing what many collectors still regard as ephemera.

title: Brunos World
description: The crime writer Martin Walker shares the Prigord that inspired his popular French detective series.

title: The Delicious World of Bruno, Chief of Police
description: LE BUGUE, France  As the police chief of the sleepy fictional town of St.-Denis in the Prigord region of southwestern France, Bruno Courrges has battled murderers and arsonists, truffle fraud and archaeological vandalism, drug pushers and terrorists.

title: Woman Pleads Guilty in Fiancs Kayak Death on Hudson River
description: A woman accused of killing her fianc by tampering with his kayak and then leaving him to drown in the cold and choppy waters of the Hudson River pleaded guilty on Monday to a reduced charge of criminally negligent homicide.

title: Englands Mental Health Experiment: No-Cost Talk Therapy
description: LONDON  England is in the midst of a unique national experiment, the worlds most ambitious effort to treat depression, anxiety and other common mental illnesses.

title: A Cool Confection With a Caffeinated Kick
description: Affogato means drowned in Italian. It also refers to the coffee confection made by drenching a scoop or two of gelato with a shot or two of espresso. Now at the gelato bar at Eataly NYC Flatiron, there is a menu of seven affogati, some fairly simple and others more elaborate, including the Antico, made with pistachio, hazelnut and sweet milk gelati, espresso and whipped cream. The Moderno swaps out the coffee for chocolate sauce: Affogati, $5.50 to $10.80, Eataly NYC Flatiron, 200 Fifth Avenue (23rd Street), 212-229-2560 eataly.com.

title: For Oneontas Aging Downtown, a $10 Million Face-Lift
description: ONEONTA, N.Y.  Amid a handful of whimsical businesses like Green Toad Bookstore and the Yellow Deli, this citys downtown still emits a listless feel, with signage that, in some cases, is so old that it seems intentionally retro.

title: Kansai Yamamotos Vibrant Designs
description: In 1971, the designers creations were featured in the British magazine Harpers & Queen.

title: Fashions Ultimate Fantasist Makes a Comeback
description: Kansai Yamamoto isnt a name that readily trips off the tongue when speaking about Japanese fashion design. Yohji is the Yamamoto that leaps to mind, a designer who upended Western ideas of dress alongside Rei Kawakubos Comme des Garons in Paris in the early 1980s.

title: A Gay Jewish Kangaroo Takes on Wagner at Bayreuth
description: BERLIN  In 2013, as opera companies worldwide celebrated Richard Wagners 200th birthday, Barrie Kosky, who had recently arrived as artistic director of the Komische Oper in Berlin, declared an informal ban in his new house on works by that composer, toward whom he has long felt ambivalent.

title: Hamlet and the Surveillance State of Denmark
description: LONDON  A chronic theatergoer may be excused for believing that all roads lead to Hamlet. I spent my first evening here this month in the company of that Danish prince, who is being embodied with such compelling, thin-skinned agitation by Andrew Scott that I felt I could see his heart palpitating, and breaking apart, within his chest.

title: An Allen Toussaint Tribute by New Orleanss Modern-Day All-Stars
description: In 1960s Detroit, a group of songwriters and producers built a Motown sound that was funky and cosmopolitan, but also warm of spirit and broadly appealing. Around the same time, one man was accomplishing something similar in New Orleans, largely on his own.

title: Review: Lessons in Temperament, a Memoir of Mental Illness
description: James Smith was in his first year of college when his older brother Josh asked him, on Facebook, if he had obsessive-compulsive disorder. Mr. Smith ignored the question.

title: G.O.P. Support for Trump Is Starting to Crack
description: Again and again over the past year, Mitch McConnell and Paul Ryan have had to decide what kind of behavior they are willing to tolerate from Donald Trump. Again and again, McConnell and Ryan have bowed down to Trump.

title: Knicks Expected to Add Gerald Madkins as Assistant G.M.
description: When the Knicks hired Scott Perry as general manager this month, everyone from the owner James L. Dolan on down promised a culture change in the organization. President Steve Mills pledged that Perry would have the leeway to bring other people into the front office to work alongside him.

title: Snopes, in Heated Legal Battle, Asks Readers for Money to Survive
description: Snopes, the fact-checking website that once focused on debunking flimsy internet rumors but has expanded into a 16-person operation that calls out political leaders for dishonesty, is locked in a legal battle that it says has drained the money it needs to survive.

title: U.S. Navy Plane Takes Evasive Action to Avoid Chinese Fighter Jet
description: WASHINGTON  A United States Navy spy plane had to take evasive action to avoid crashing into a Chinese fighter jet that suddenly pulled up in front of the American plane in contested skies above the East China Sea on Sunday, the Pentagon said.

title: Portrait of a Nigerian Marriage in a Heartbreaking Debut Novel
description: The two narrators of Ayobami Adebayos stunning debut novel  a Nigerian woman named Yejide and her husband, Akin  remember the stories they heard when they were children, and they hope to pass on these stories to their own sons and daughters. They are folk tales featuring talking animals and magic potions, but while they often come with an old-fashioned moral (He who has children owns the world), Yejide devises her own versions, adding new bits and pieces as she goes along, turning them into allegories that speak to her own life and that of her country.

title: Jared Kushner, Republican Party, San Antonio: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Congressional Democrats Promise a Better Deal for American Workers
description: WASHINGTON  The Democratic Party wants to pick a fight with corporate America to win back Congress.

title: Jared Kushners Four Meetings With Russians
description: In a statement to congressional investigators, Jared Kushner described four meetings he had with Russians during the Trump campaign and transition. He said there was no collusion.

title: Daniel Craig Is Coming Back as James Bond in 2019
description: Sound the trumpets: Daniel Craig will play James Bond in at least one more film, which will be released in November 2019.

title: Democrats Try to Find Economic Message After Railing Against Trump
description: BERRYVILLE, Va.  For more than a year, Democrats have raged against now-President Trump, projecting their opposition as the partys central message. In so doing, they have maintained their minority status in Congress, sustained the most stunning loss in modern presidential history and left voters with little sense of what they represent.

title: Amateur Boxing Federation Votes Against Its President
description: The beleaguered federation that governs international boxing may be headed for a major shake-up.

title: Poland Turns Away From Democracy, Thanks to the U.S.
description: WARSAW  Polish democracy won a partial, momentary reprieve on Monday when President Andrzej Duda vetoed two controversial bills that would have given the ruling Law and Justice party direct power over Polands courts. Partial, because President Duda did sign a bill giving the Justice Ministry control over local courts. And momentary, because Mr. Duda has said he would introduce his own versions of the legislation soon.

title: Applying for Food Stamps in New York? Theres an App for That
description: About 1.7 million people in New York City receive food stamps. To qualify, they must produce dozens of documents to prove their eligibility, including birth certificates, pay stubs, leases and childrens school records.

title: Derrick Rose and Cavaliers Are Said to Agree to One-Year Deal
description: The long and winding basketball odyssey of Derrick Rose took its latest turn on Monday when he agreed to a one-year deal with the Cleveland Cavaliers, according to a person with direct knowledge of the agreement. The deal is worth $2.1 million, according to the person, who requested anonymity because it had not yet been announced.

title: New in Town, and Overheating
description: Dear Diary:

title: Hard Work in South Korea Pays Off for Jonquel Jones and W.N.B.As Sun
description: Connecticut Sun Coach Curt Miller was apprehensive when forward Jonquel Jones, then a rookie, told him last year that she would be playing in South Korea during the W.N.B.A. off-season.

title: Chinas HNA Discloses Shift of Ownership Stake to Foundation
description: The acquisitive Chinese conglomerate HNA Group moved to allay concerns about its ownership structure on Monday by releasing a statement showing that its biggest shareholder had recently shifted from a mysterious businessman to a foundation it set up in New York.

title: De Blasio Escalates Showdown With Cuomo Over Subway
description: As the Metropolitan Transportation Authority prepares to release its emergency plan for the subway, Mayor Bill de Blasios administration escalated its battle against Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Monday by issuing its own list of priorities, including focusing on the basic needs of the transit system rather than on more cosmetic changes.

title: Court Officers Cant Hold People Solely Under ICE Detainers, Massachusetts Justices Rule
description: BOSTON  The highest state court in Massachusetts ruled on Monday that court officers do not have the authority, under state law, to hold people in custody based solely on the requests from federal immigration authorities known as civil detainers.

title: Martin Shkreli Says He Will Not Take the Stand in His Defense
description: Martin Shkreli said in court Monday that he would not testify in his own defense in his fraud trial, a turnabout from as recently as last week, when his lawyers told a judge that he had insisted on testifying.

title: Purchase of Tropical Uniforms for Afghanistan Draws Mattiss Rebuke
description: WASHINGTON  Defense Secretary Jim Mattis has sharply criticized Pentagon officials for spending up to $28 million over budget to help the Afghan National Army buy camouflage uniforms because of the sartorial tastes of a single Afghan official.

title: Scientists Report a Rare Case of H.I.V. Remission
description: For the third time in recent years, a child born with H.I.V. has been found free of the virus for a long period after a high dose of treatment early in life.

title: Dodgers Lose Kershaw for Several Weeks With a Back Injury
description: The Los Angeles Dodgers were dealt a blow on Sunday as Clayton Kershaw sustained a back injury that will keep him out for an estimated four to six weeks, according to multiple reports. The silver lining for Los Angeles was that if any team could withstand the loss of a pitcher as talented as Kershaw, it is the Dodgers.

title: The Democrats Agenda, and the Art of the Possible
description: Remember that little booklet Paul Ryan used to wave around with the Republicans insipidly branded economic agenda, A Better Way? Now Democrats have an agenda called A Better Deal.

title: For Alphabet, a Record Fine Is Both a Footnote and a Warning
description: Not many companies can turn a $2.7 billion fine into a financial footnote.

title: Why I Visited North Korea
description: North Korea is the most reclusive country in the world, run by a repressive government accused of systemic human rights abuses. But a small number of tourists have gone despite the risks.

title: Economy Needs Workers, but Drug Tests Take a Toll
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  Just a few miles from where President Trump will address his blue-collar base here Tuesday night, exactly the kind of middle-class factory jobs he has vowed to bring back from overseas are going begging.

title: Video Shows U.S. Soldiers Surrendering Before Fatal Shooting in Jordan
description: Newly released video of the killing of three American Special Forces soldiers in November at the gate of a military base in Jordan shows that the episode, which was initially explained as a split-second mistake by a Jordanian guard firing on Americans who failed to stop, was actually a six-minute gun battle where Americans crouched behind barriers and repeatedly waved their hands in surrender as the gunman closed in and killed them.

title: Bo Pilgrim, Founder of Pilgrims Pride Poultry Products, Dies at 89
description: Bo Pilgrim, a small-town Texan who transformed a tiny feed and seed store into one of the biggest chicken producers in the United States and put himself in its logo  in the form of a silhouetted profile under a black, buckled Pilgrims hat  died on Friday at his home in Pittsburg, Tex. He was 89.

title: In Kyrie Irvings Revelation, a Moment of Reflection
description: Something about Kyrie Irvings trade-me bombshell, which landed last Friday and shattered the N.B.A.s midsummer quietude, seemed eerily familiar. But maybe more from the viewpoint of LeBron James, who apparently had no inkling until recently that Irvings ultimatum was coming.

title: Red, White and Blood: U.S. Soccer Uses Testing to Gain an Edge
description: PHILADELPHIA  Striker Jordan Morris opened an app on his smartphone the other day. With a few flicks of his thumb, panels related to his heart, kidney and liver functions, along with a reading of his electrolytes and vital signs, appeared on the display. Assessments were coded in the greens and oranges and reds of a traffic light.

title: 1967s Other Summer of Love

title: Poland Pulls Back From the Brink, for Now
description: It took one of Jaroslaw Kaczynskis accomplices in the ruling party he controls to put the brakes to his ruthless assault on Polands democracy. To general surprise, President Andrzej Duda, a former Law and Justice party backbencher loyal to Mr. Kaczynski, vetoed two bills that would have ended the judiciarys independence and crippled the rule of law. That is heartening, but not the end of the problem.

title: A Terrorism Trial in the Federal Courts
description: Republicans raged over what they called the White Houses weak and dangerous decision last week to prosecute in federal court a man suspected of belonging to Al Qaeda, rather than shipping him off to the military prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba.

title: How Cool Works in America Today

description: Many fiction writers have tried, to varying degrees of success, to reimagine slavery or create alternate histories where the Civil War never happened or never ended, or the Confederacy won.

title: The Body Escort
description: In late October 1968, I came home from Vietnam. With six months to go before the end of my four-year enlistment, I was assigned to the Marine Corps Supply Depot, Philadelphia. In late December I sat at a desk addressing envelopes when my sergeant walked over to tell me to report to the first sergeants office.

title: The Tasmanian Hep C Buyers Club
description: CHENNAI, India  In 2014, when Greg Jefferyss urine started smelling like dead meat, he knew there was something seriously wrong.

title: 1967s Other Summer of Love
description: Nathan Farb arrived on the Lower East Side of New York in the mid 1960s searching for adventure and his Jewish roots. He lamented being too late for the Beats and too early for the hippies, but the year after he discovered photography in 1966 he stumbled upon the East Villages Summer of Love, a scene propelled by rock music, drugs, sexual abandon and anti-Vietnam War sentiment.

title: Anti-Chinese Posters at Melbourne Universities Are Tied to White Supremacists
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Students at two Melbourne-area universities returned on Monday for the first day of a new semester to find racist, anti-Chinese posters plastered on building signs and walls.

title: Should Superstar Athletes Make More Money and Run Their Leagues?
description: As the sports world fell into the early days of its annual summer coma, a series of portentous moments were taking place. At a glance, and taken individually, they looked a lot like the peripheral or back-office goings-on that typically fill the quieter months until football season starts. But by the time Lonzo Ball, the Lakers rookie point guard, whose passing ability is exceeded by only his fathers self-promotional thirst, lit up the N.B.A.s summer league in Las Vegas in early July, a pattern was emerging. Beyond all the insiderish commentary about N.B.A. free agency and where Gordon Hayward, a borderline All Star, might end up, there was a steady stream of news that seemed to call into question the structure of labor and compensation in American professional sports.

title: Flee at Once: Chinas Besieged Human Rights Lawyers
description: Liang Xiaojun had just finished breakfast when he received the first instant message: His friends were disappearing from their homes and offices. By itself, this news was unremarkable. As a human rights lawyer in China, Liang had come to accept that periodic spasms of repression were an unavoidable risk of his profession. He also had grown intimately familiar with the rituals of pressure and coercion by which China kept its dissidents in line  the meetings over tea with government minders, the frequent check-ins from the judicial bureau, the police harassment. But on the morning of July 10, 2015, Liang knew that something far graver was underway.

title: Is Being Unapologetic the New Patriotic  or a Form of Resistance?
description: Were living in sorry times, people. And by sorry, I mean not sorry. Right now, the far-right website Breitbart News is selling T-shirts emblazoned with the words Unapologetically American. The shirts label is printed with the Breitbart logo, Made in USA and #WAR. This is a shirt that wants to be starting something. Jamming unapologetically in front of American like that, with all those aggro fixins, implies that anybody wearing a different shirt doesnt love America.

Two weeks later, at exactly 5 p.m., at more than 200 stores, Urban Outfitters released merchandise decorated with Lady Gagas face and the title of her album Joanne to barely controlled consumer delight.

And the anniversary has reminded me of the stroke of ludicrous-speed luck I had as an actor when Mel cast me as the hapless Han Solo stand-in, Lone Starr.

description: The producer Will Packer is best known for his work in movies, including the Ride Along films and The Wedding Ringer. Now he wants to take aim at consumers using just about every other form of contemporary media.

description: Even with the European Commission levying a record $2.7 billion fine against Google last month, the internet search companys parent entity  Alphabet  looked hardly the worse for wear financially.

title: Traces of Controversial Herbicide Are Found in Ben & Jerrys Ice Cream
description: A growing number of foods commonly found in kitchens across America have tested positive for glyphosate, the herbicide that is the main ingredient in the popular consumer pesticide Roundup, which is widely used in agriculture. But few brands on that list are as startling as the latest: Ben & Jerrys, the Vermont ice cream company known for its family-friendly image and environmental advocacy.

title: New York City Ballet Unveils Designers for Its Fall Fashion Gala
description: New York City Ballet on Tuesday announced the fashion designers who would collaborate with four choreographers for this years fall fashion gala, an annual event overseen by Sarah Jessica Parker.

title: Born Poor, Die Poor
description: The last time you may have read about Abel Moyo, he was a gangly 17-year-old orphan, and thehead of a household of five, living in rural Zimbabwe. Back then,in 2010,Abel walked 9 miles to high school, which teachers let him attend even though he could not afford the school fees. When he came home, he cooked mush for the younger kids (ranging in age from 8 to 11), dispensing comfort and discipline as the surrogate father, and did his homework by firelight. The family was effectively two families that came to live together after their parents had died of AIDS and other causes  a not uncommon story in Zimbabwe.

title: Canada Debates Whether Gift of Leibovitz Photos Is Also a Tax Dodge

title: At Atla, Mexican for Every Moment of the Day

title: Sen Sakana Brings Nikkei Cuisine to Midtown
description: SEN SAKANA After many delays, this ambitious restaurant will give New York a taste of Nikkei cuisine. The food, a mash-up of Peruvian and Japanese using ingredients and techniques from both cultures, traces its origins to the influx of Japanese people who settled in Peru starting in the late 19th century. Nigiri sushi pairing the Japanese fish madai with nori and Peruvian aj Amarillo chile is one example of the cuisine. Tiradito, a raw fish preparation like sashimi, but with a spicy sauce, is another. The chef Mina Newman has Peruvian roots, and shes teamed up with Taku Nagai, a Japanese chef. I always wanted to do a Peruvian restaurant, Ms. Newman said, adding that she knew she needed the help of a Japanese chef. The owner, Allan Wartski, had a Japanese place in the theater district. He also owns the Edison Ballroom on West 47th Street and Christos Steak House in Astoria, Queens. Sen Sakana, decorated with lots of slatted pale wood, has 190 seats divided between a ground-floor dining room and a mezzanine level that also has a sushi bar. (Opens Wednesday): 28 West 44th Street, 212-221-9560, sensakana.com.

title: Inventive Chips for the Sophisticated Snacker

Iberian ham is nicely meaty, sparkling wine is alluring and a trifle sweet, black truffle is slightly funky, and caviar definitely has a fishy flavor: Torres potato chips, $9 to $79 for three to six bags (1.41 ounces and up) online, $2.95 to $6.95 for single bags at Chelsea Market Baskets, 459 West 15th Street (Ninth Avenue), 888-727-7887, chelseamarketbasket.com.
