title: The Art and Artistry of Double Dutch
description: The main ingredients? A pair of swirling ropes, two turners to maneuver them and at least one jumper to feel out the rhythm, slip seamlessly in between the ropes and bounce in perfect time. Double Dutch may sound like childs play, but its more than just skipping rope. This game that came to life in the streets of New York City  practiced mainly by girls  is an integral piece of African-American culture.

title: Lawsuit Challenges Secrecy of White House Advisers on Infrastructure
description: A nonprofit group filed suit against President Trump on Tuesday, claiming that he illegally convened an advisory council to develop a plan to overhaul the nations infrastructure without the required public disclosures.

title: A McCain-Biden Team to Fight Cancer?
description: To the Editor:

title: Richard Twice
description: Richard Atkins was at the beginning of a promising musical career  until a single disastrous performance changed the course of his life.

title: Richard Twice: A Musical Life Interrupted
description: This film recounts the rise, fall and ultimate second coming of the talented psychedelic folk musician Richard Atkins. In 1968, Atkins was building toward success he was certain would approach that of the Byrds or Simon & Garfunkel. Hed won a contract with Mercury Records, and recorded with the Wrecking Crew, a group of Los Angeles session musicians famous for their work with the Beach Boys.

title: Of Wine, Mystery and Local Life
description: Im a sucker for any novel full of atmosphere, history and a fully realized sense of place  great terroir, as a wine writer might be expected to put it. All the better if the characters love food and wine and if meals can be savored vicariously right off the page.

title: Senate Votes Down Broad Obamacare Repeal
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate voted narrowly on Tuesday to begin debate on a bill to repeal major provisions of the Affordable Care Act, but hours later, Republican leaders suffered a setback when their most comprehensive plan to replace President Barack Obamas health law fell far short of the votes it needed.

title: China and Russia Hold First Joint Naval Drill in the Baltic Sea
description: MOSCOW  Chinese and Russian warships practiced together in the Baltic Sea on Tuesday, in the first joint naval exercise the two countries have held in the area, which has been a focus of heightened tensions between Russia and the West.

title: Hawaii Wants to Be Prepared for a Nuclear Attack by North Korea
description: The latest summer advice for Hawaii goes beyond using adequate sun block and properly riding out a tropical storm.

title: HUD Ignored Procedures in Selling Distressed Mortgages, Report Says
description: A federal housing agency that sold 108,000 distressed mortgages to private equity firms and hedge funds did so without following the proper rules for setting up the program, a government audit has found.

title: Shared Work Spaces Spread, Mixing Styles and Services
description: When his youngest child left for college, Lee Rosen decided that he and his co-workers could operate his family law firm from their homes around Raleigh, N.C., saving $35,000 a month in rent. Lawyers started writing briefs from their kitchen tables and the local library. Where they worked didnt matter  except for one thing.

title: Who Likes Conor McGregors Chances? Bettors, Mostly
description: Experts and pundits are in rare unanimity over the Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Conor McGregor superfight. McGregor, they say, has absolutely no chance.

title: SoftBank Said to Consider an Investment in Uber
description: SAN FRANCISCO  SoftBank, the Japanese technology and media giant, is weighing an investment in Uber at a time when the ride-hailing companys leadership is in flux, according to three people with knowledge of the talks.

title: As Interior Secretary Swaggers Through Parks, His Staff Rolls Back Regulations
description: WASHINGTON  Ryan Zinke, a former member of the Navy SEALs and lifelong Montana outdoorsman who now heads the Interior Department, loves to compare himself to Theodore Roosevelt, the father of American conservation.

title: Woman Who Drove on Tracks at Fault in Fatal Metro-North Crash, Investigators Find
description: The driver of a sport utility vehicle that was hit by a Metro-North Railroad train caused the accident that killed her and five train passengers when she drove onto the tracks in Westchester County two years ago, the National Transportation Safety Board said on Tuesday.

title: Californias Travel Ban
description: To the Editor:

title: $800 Million Subway Rescue Plan Adds Cars and Subtracts Seats
description: Seat-free subway cars on crowded routes. Extra cars added to trains on the C line. Medical workers deployed at stations to quickly remove sick passengers. More countdown clocks. These were some of the pieces of the Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys long-anticipated, roughly $800 million emergency rescue plan for New York Citys troubled subway system, which was announced on Tuesday.

title: Building Collapses in India, Killing at Least 12 People
description: MUMBAI, India  The news in Mumbai, an economic driver of India, was horrifying but sadly familiar. A five-story apartment building collapsed Tuesday morning, burying many residents under tons of concrete and debris.

title: Skinny Obamacare Repeal Would Clash With Republicans Health Care Promises
description: If the current options for overhauling the health care system cant get a majority of Senate votes, the majority leader, Mitch McConnell, has a new backup plan, according to senators and lobbyists: a simple bill that eliminates three of Obamacares least popular provisions.

title: McCain Returns to Cast Vote to Help the President Who Derided Him
description: WASHINGTON  Senator John McCain is less the lion of the Senate than its wildcat, veering through the decades from war hero to Republican presidential nominee to irascible foil for an unlikely president.

title: Who Really Runs New York Citys Subway?
description: Millions of New Yorkers rely on the subway every day, but many have no idea who runs the vast system.

title: In Sign of Progress for Greece, Investors Eagerly Snap Up New Bonds
description: Moving to show it has overcome the worst of its financial troubles, Greece issued bonds on global financial markets on Tuesday for the first time in years, in an offering that institutional investors eagerly snapped up.

title: The Hot New Thing in Guatemala, Land of Coffee? Its Coffee
description: GUATEMALA CITY  In the narrative spun around specialty coffee, there are two kinds of places: those where people cultivate the beans and those where people consume the end result.

title: Jeff Sessions, North Korea, Iran: Your Morning Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Amid Transit Crisis, Cuomo Plans a Rare Visit to Washington
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will make a rare trip to Washington on Wednesday, meeting with Democratic members of the New York congressional delegation and the transportation secretary, Elaine Chao, as New York City suffers through an ongoing transit crisis.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: U.S. Soldier Who Survived Shootout in Jordan Tells His Story
description: Training missions at the military base in Jordan had become so routine that the American Special Forces soldiers there wore baseball caps instead of helmets. Most of them had been in a war zone, and Jordan felt far from one.

title: Ballet Festival: Skill (Check), Class (Yep), Vision (More, Please)
description: The Ballet Festival at the Joyce Theater this July is a classy affair. The first two (of five) programs  by Emery LeCrone Dance and Claudia Schreier & Company  abounded in live music, played and sung well. The lighting, by Brandon Stirling Baker, was artful without drawing attention to itself. And the dancers! There are so many moonlighting members of New York City Ballet and American Ballet Theater that its practically summer camp for Lincoln Center dance royalty.

title: 5 Travel Reads for Shark Week
description: Dont let Michael Phelps ruin your Shark Week. Read about some of the best shark travel adventures around the world and learn how to share the water with them safely.

title: Theres No Mistaking Trump for a Boy Scout
description: In the middle of his wandering speech before the Boy Scouts of America on Monday night, President Trump asked with a smirk if Barack Obama had ever visited them at a jamboree.

title: Sex for Women After 50 Is Important After All, European Court Rules
description: It turns out that sex after 50 has value after all.

title: How to Get More Women to Be C.E.O.s
description: There are no easy fixes to the overt and subtle barriers I outlined in my recent article about why more women dont become chief executives. But women who have made it all the way to the top offered some observations and suggestions.

title: No, Comic Books Are Not a Security Threat, T.S.A. Says
description: You are riding a euphoric high as you enter San Diego International Airport, having just returned from the most awesome weekend at Comic-Con International. Not only did you successfully score a seat in Hall H to get a glimpse of that haunting Westworld trailer, you also loaded up comic books  dozens of them. And you have packed them ever so carefully in your checked bag, ensuring they will remain in pristine condition during your flight home.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Atomic Blonde
description: The director David Leitch narrates a sequence featuring Charlize Theron.

title: As Emissions Scandal Widens, Diesels Future Looks Shaky in Europe
description: WOLFSBURG, Germany  The latest victims of noxious diesel fumes may be the fuel technology itself.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $20 MILLION

title: Starboard Value Hedge Fund Wants to Force ComScore to Hold an Annual Meeting
description: Starboard Value, an activist hedge fund known for taking on companies like Yahoo and Macys, has unveiled its next target: comScore, the big media measurement company.

title: David Leitch Narrates a Scene From Atomic Blonde
description: Kitchen appliances and cookware become makeshift weapons in this scene from Atomic Blonde, featuring Charlize Theron as a spy with serious fighting chops.

title: Review: Sienna Miller Coaxes New Life From an Old Cat
description: LONDON  Sun-starved souls seeking refuge from the untimely midsummer coolness that has enveloped this city neednt book a flight to Ibiza. They only have to hurry to the Apollo Theater, where a big old bonfire is blazing under the title of Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, which opened here on Monday night.

title: Russian Women Speak Up About the Front Lines and the Home Front
description: THE UNWOMANLY FACE OF WARAn Oral History of Women in World War IIBy Svetlana Alexievich. Translated by Richard Pevear and Larissa Volokhonsky.331 pages. Random House. $30.

title: Conflicting Statements Led to Uncertainty in Kayak Death Case
description: She told investigators that she had removed a plug from her fiancs kayak and when he fell into the chilly waters of the Hudson River after it capsized, she said she pulled away his paddle as he struggled in the water. At the end of a lengthy interrogation, she said, I wanted him dead and now hes gone and Im fine with it.

title: Philosopher Who Praised Risk Died Trying to Save Children From Drowning
description: PARIS  A French philosopher and psychoanalyst, known for her work that praised living a life that embraced risk, died last week as a result of following her own bold philosophy.

title: The Great Health Care Coverup
description: Like many people, I have a sick sense of anger over what just happened in the Senate, which just voted to proceed on a health care bill without any information on what will be in the bill. Theres still hope that in the next few hours, moderates who just caved in will balk at the horrible things theyre being asked to vote for. And I do mean hours: there will be no time for reflection or serious debate.

title: In the Hudson Valley, Shakespeare as Man, Myth and Drinking Buddy
description: GARRISON, N.Y.  Before Shakespeare was a billion-dollar industry, he was a workaday playwright. And before he was a playwright, he was a guy with a high school education, a flintlock wedding, three young kids and the ravening ambition to vault himself out of a sheep-related career in a small market town and into the dicey, disreputable world of Elizabethan theater.

title: Review: Rumble Gives Due to Unheralded Native American Pop Musicians
description: Its been a terrific few years for music documentaries, and that winning streak continues with Rumble: The Indians Who Rocked the World.

title: Review: Escapes Recounts a Hollywood Storytellers Inventive Life
description: The writer Hampton Fancher, one of the seers behind the 1982 masterpiece Blade Runner, has led the kind of fantastically eventful life that seems the stuff of fiction. Born in East Los Angeles in 1938 to a white American father and Mexican-American mother, he announced to them at 11 that he was leaving school  and did. He ran wild, studied ballet and, after seeing a biopic about the silent-screen legend Rudolph Valentino, renamed himself Mario Montejo. By 15, Mario was en route to Spain to study flamenco. On the ship home, Marlon Brando invited him to dinner. A bashful Mario declined.

title: Review: She Hosts Women Who Kill, and May Be in Love With One
description: The humor is dry and the acting deadpan in Women Who Kill, a comedy that plays it droll and is all the funnier for it.

title: Cleared of Shoplifting, Cowboys Receiver Lucky Whitehead Wont Be Reinstated
description: In his two seasons with the Dallas Cowboys, Lucky Whitehead was known nearly as much for odd incidents off the field as he was for his play on it.

title: Charlize Therons Sick Work Ethic
description: LOS ANGELES  Going into a lunchtime meeting with Charlize Theron a few weeks ago, I wasnt sure whether to feel amped or a little afraid.

title: Your Roomba May Be Mapping Your Home, Collecting Data That Could Be Shared
description: Your Roomba may be vacuuming up more than you think.

title: House Approves Sweeping Sanctions Package Against Russia
description: WASHINGTON  The House on Tuesday approved a sweeping package of sanctions against Russia, clearing a key hurdle in Congresss effort  long opposed by the Trump administration  to punish Moscow for its aggression toward its neighbors and its interference in last years American presidential election.

title: Senate, John McCain, Jeff Sessions: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Swedish Government Scrambles to Contain Damage From Data Breach
description: STOCKHOLM  Swedens government is scrambling to contain the political fallout from a huge breach of confidential data, including the possible disclosure of the identities of undercover operatives, under the watch of a government contractor.

title: Metal Detectors Vanish, but Tensions in East Jerusalem Remain
description: JERUSALEM  The Muslim authorities in Jerusalem instructed worshipers to remain outside the Aqsa Mosque compound on Tuesday, even after Israel removed the metal detectors from entrances to the holy site that had prompted days of violent clashes and bloodshed.

title: Dr. Shigeaki Hinohara, Longevity Expert, Dies at (or Lives to) 105
description: Dr. Shigeaki Hinohara, who cautioned against gluttony and early retirement and vigorously championed annual medical checkups, climbing stairs regularly and just having fun  advice that helped make Japan the world leader in longevity  died on July 18 in Tokyo. Dutifully practicing the credo of physician heal thyself, he lived to 105.

title: Some Bitcoin Backers Are Defecting to Create a Rival Currency
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For the last two years, rival factions have been vying for control of the Bitcoin virtual currency and its global network of computers and supporters.

title: Jacob deGrom Is Alone Among Mets Starters: Uninjured and Unbeatable
description: SAN DIEGO  As the Mets season has crumbled, Jacob deGrom has stood apart.

title: Volkswagen Executive to Plead Guilty in Diesel Emissions Case
description: A Volkswagen executive accused of helping to cover up the automakers diesel emissions fraud has agreed to plead guilty in federal court next week, a development that could bolster the Justice Departments efforts to prosecute individuals involved in the scandal.

title: Trump Finds Reason for the U.S. to Remain in Afghanistan: Minerals
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump, searching for a reason to keep the United States in Afghanistan after 16 years of war, has latched on to a prospect that tantalized previous administrations: Afghanistans vast mineral wealth, which his advisers and Afghan officials have told him could be profitably extracted by Western companies.

title: The Biker? Hes a PGA Tournament Director
description: OAKVILLE, Ontario  Brent McLaughlin is a tattooed, leather-clad, Harley Davidson-driving, guitar-picking former roadie.

title: Keith Baird, Linguist Who Fought the Use of Negro, Dies at 94
description: Keith Baird, a linguist from Barbados who rose to prominence in the 1960s arguing persuasively against the use of the word Negro and in favor of the term Afro-American, died on July 13 in Atlanta. He was 94.

title: Who Remembers Moondog?
description: Dear Diary:

title: The Senates Health Care Travesty
description: Ignoring overwhelming public opposition to legislation that would destroy the Affordable Care Act, Senate Republicans voted on Tuesday to begin repealing that law without having any workable plan to replace it.

title: Marina Ratner, migr Mathematician Who Found Midlife Acclaim, Dies at 78
description: Marina Ratner, an influential mathematician and Russian-Jewish migr who defied the notion that the best and the brightest in her field do their finest work when they are young, died on July 7 at her home in El Cerrito, Calif. She was 78.

title: A Hot Microphone Catches Senate Gossip, but No Duel Transpires
description: WASHINGTON  In a year where on-ramps for ducks and the specifics of the presidents theoretical plans for a see-through wall along the United States border are in dispute, the list of only-in-2017 questions one could ask a lawmaker grows by the day.

title: Decades Later, Memphis to Compensate Black Sanitation Strikers of 1968
description: This article was updated with a postscript in April 2018 to reflect a new interview with Elmore Nickleberry. Mr. Nickleberry spoke ahead of the 50th anniversary of the assassination of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

title: Ex-Fox News Executive Accused of Sexual Assault Sues the Company
description: A former Fox News executive sued 21st Century Fox on Tuesday, accusing the company of making him a scapegoat in an effort to battle negative publicity about sexual misconduct.

title: Celgene to Pay $280 Million to Settle Fraud Suit Over Cancer Drugs
description: The pharmaceutical company Celgene has agreed to pay $280 million to settle claims that it marketed the cancer drugs Thalomid and Revlimid for unapproved uses, the company said on Tuesday.

title: Intelligence Agencies Say North Korean Missile Could Reach U.S. in a Year
description: WASHINGTON  American intelligence agencies have shortened their estimate  to one year  of how long it is likely to take North Korea to put the finishing touches on a missile that can reach the continental United States, according to several administration officials briefed on the new assessment.

title: Yankees Jacoby Ellsbury Languishes as a Highly Paid Bench Player
description: Jacoby Ellsbury has not started a game for the Yankees since July 20. The only action he has seen since then has been as a pinch-runner in the ninth inning of two games, and even with Aaron Hicks on the disabled list with an oblique strain, Ellsbury was not in the starting lineup on Tuesday for the Yankees first home game since before the All-Star Game break.

title: Seesawing Fate of Legendary Reflects the Film Industrys Volatility
description: LOS ANGELES  Two summers ago, Legendary Entertainment was the belle of the Hollywood ball.

title: Fixing Blame Wont Fix the Subways
description: A song with some popularity in certain circles is about working together. Its from Sesame Street, which as everyone knows is for little children. Gov. Andrew Cuomo and Mayor Bill de Blasio might want to give it a listen. They could learn a thing or two, starting with the songs title, Cooperation Makes It Happen.

title: Yankees New Look Isnt Lost on Their Fresh Faces
description: The last time David Robertson wore Yankees pinstripes before Tuesday, all of his defensive teammates were older than 30. The starting pitcher was 39. The right fielder and the shortstop were 40. It was the Yankees second of four consecutive seasons (and counting) without taking part in a playoff series.

title: Videos of Syrian Life Pulled from Internet in Protest Effort
description: Abounaddara, the Syrian video art collective that earned international acclaim for its documentation of Syrian life, has removed the vast majority of its videos from the internet, in response to what it said was their improper use by a Milan art museum.

title: The Three Plans to Repeal Obamacare That Failed in the Senate This Week
description: Three Republican proposals were considered.

title: At a Moment of Success, U.S.C. Is Rocked by Scandal
description: LOS ANGELES  When the University of Southern California lured a world-class ophthalmologist to run its medical school 10 years ago, it was part of a long, concerted effort to transform U.S.C.s image from a school primarily for the children of this citys wealthy, mostly white, elite with a penchant for partying and football into a major academic research institution.

title: Berkshire Museums Planned Sale of Art Draws Opposition
description: Two prominent museum organizations said on Tuesday they are deeply opposed to plans by the Berkshire Museum in Massachusetts to sell 40 works and use the proceeds for its endowment and to improve its building.

title: How Each Senator Voted on Obamacare Repeal Proposals
description: The Senate failed to pass three amendments to repeal the health care law.

title: S.E.C. Issues Warning on Initial Coin Offerings
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission took its first steps to rein in start-ups that have raised money by selling their own virtual currencies, a growing trend known as initial coin offerings.

title: Trump and Congressional Republicans: Its Complicated
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans have long known they struck a risky bargain aligning themselves with an impulsive president who holds little regard for Washingtons political conventions. But Tuesdays fast-moving events underscored the potential costs and benefits in a striking new way.

title: Scouts Honor? Not for the President
description: Sorry, kids. President Trump was not a boy scout. Comparing his record with the Scout Law  A Scout Is Trustworthy, Loyal, Helpful, Friendly, Courteous, Kind, Obedient, Cheerful, Thrifty, Brave, Clean and Reverent  the most we can claim for him is Clean. Maybe Thrifty, since in 1989, Mr. Trumps charitable foundation issued a $7 check to the Scouts around the same time Donald Trump Jr. submitted his $7 application fee.

title: Response to Knock Knock
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle is the debut crossword of Brian Cox. I suspect well be seeing more of him.

title: A First: Cardinal Pell Appears in Australian Court on Sexual Charges
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Cardinal George Pell, one of Pope Francis top advisers, made his first court appearance in Australia on Wednesday after becoming the highest-ranking Roman Catholic prelate to be formally charged with sexual offenses.

title: Quotation of the Day: Trumps Attacks Leave Sessions Out in the Cold
description: If an early supporter like this is thrown under the bus, then who is safe? You can imagine what the other Cabinet secretaries are thinking.

title: Corrections: July 26, 2017
description: FRONT PAGE

title: People Love You: For Trump, a Welcome Escape From the Capital
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  President Trump was in his element and bathing in the adulation of the crowd. People shouted and cheered and whistled and jumped up on chairs to see him. Finally, the president even invited one of them to take the microphone for a minute.

title: How to Build Resilience in Midlife
description: Much of the scientific research on resilience  our ability to bounce back from adversity  has focused on how to build resilience in children. But what about the grown-ups?

title: Yankees Overcome a Triple Play and Down the Reds
description: With a rooting section of approximately 600 friends and relatives in attendance, Todd Frazier wanted his first home game as a Yankee to be one to remember. He was mostly concerned with how he would respond to the traditional roll call from the right-field bleachers.

title: Four Migrants Die Trying to Cross Rio Grande Into the U.S.
description: At least four people have died since Monday trying to cross the Rio Grande into Texas, the authorities said Tuesday, another deadly sign of the extremes to which migrants will go to reach the United States.

title: Spanish Soccer Federation President Is Suspended
description: One week after ngel Mara Villars arrest in a corruption investigation, his three-decade reign over the Spanish Football Federation came to an end Tuesday when he was suspended from its presidency.

title: Donald Trump, Republican Party, Russia: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Wednesday: Kong: Skull Island and Signed
description: Kong: Skull Island bumps the 1933 King Kong classic into the Vietnam era and supersizes its main attraction. And three music moguls search Atlanta for the next major talent.

title: Sessions Once Again Threatens Sanctuary Cities
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Jeff Sessions on Tuesday moved once again to punish so-called sanctuary cities, announcing that cities and states could lose millions of dollars in federal grants unless they began cooperating with immigration agents.

title: Justice Dept. Nominee Says He Worked on Russian Banks Trump-Related Inquiry
description: WASHINGTON  President Trumps nominee to lead the Justice Departments criminal division, Brian A. Benczkowski, said on Tuesday that he helped Russias Alfa Bank investigate whether its computer servers contacted the Trump Organization.

title: Coast Guard Shelves Plans to Shut Down Potomac Near a Trump Resort
description: WASHINGTON  It is not often that the interests of a quiet rural community overtake those of the president. But after opposition from veterans, Olympians and childrens summer camps, the Coast Guard is retreating from plans to increase security on the Potomac River behind the Trump National Golf Club in Virginia.

title: The Majestic Marble Quarries of Northern Italy
description: The story of Italian marble is the story of difficult motion: violent, geological, haunted by failure and ruin and lost fortunes, marred by severed fingers, crushed dreams, crushed men. Rarely has a material so inclined to stay put been wrenched so insistently out of place and carried so far from its source; every centimeter of its movement has had to be earned. There is no avoiding the tyranny of weight, the art historian William E. Wallace once put it. He was discussing the challenge, in Renaissance Italy, of installing Michelangelos roughly 17,000-pound statue of the biblical David. This was the final stage of an epic saga that, from mountain to piazza, actually began before Michelangelos birth and involved primitive and custom-engineered machinery and, above all, great sweating armies of groaning, straining men. But the tyranny of weight was in effect long before that, and long after, and it remains in effect today.

title: Forces Align Against a New Military Branch to Win Wars in Space
description: WASHINGTON  As legislators look toward consolidating the hefty annual defense spending bill recently passed in the House with its Senate equivalent, one of the most unexpected debates is over a proposal to create a Space Corps, which already is facing high-level opposition from the Pentagon.

title: A Trump Tower of Absolute Folly
description: Donald Trumps campaign against his attorney general, Jeff Sessions, in which he is seemingly attempting to insult and humiliate and tweet-shame Sessions into resignation, is an insanely stupid exercise. It is a multitiered tower of political idiocy, a sublime monument to the moronic, a gaudy, gleaming, Ozymandian folly that leaves many of the presidents prior efforts in its shade.

title: Britain Sees Brexits Threats More Clearly
description: It is now more than a year since the British voted to leave the European Union and nearly four months since Prime Minister Theresa May formally started the two-year clock to negotiate the divorce, and so far the only results are increasingly gloomy prognoses for Britain.

title: The Real Civil War in the Democratic Party
description: As Democrats try to unite around their new Better Deal agenda, the supposed battle between the socialist left and the corporatist center seems to have collapsed into a bland but serviceable slogan, with a reasonably progressive economic agenda that both Senators Elizabeth Warren and Charles Schumer can get behind. So much for that overhyped party civil war.

title: Donald Trumps Dominatrix
description: At this point I think its fair to say that Donald Trump has gone beyond taunting and demonizing Hillary Clinton to a realm of outright obsession.

title: Self-Driving People, Enabled by Airbnb
description: Roughly a decade ago two new platform companies burst out of California. The one that dominated the headlines was called Uber, which created a platform where with one touch of your phone you could summon a cab, direct the driver, pay the driver and rate the driver. It grew like a weed  as all kinds of people became taxi drivers in their spare time. But Uber made clear that its ultimate goal was self-driving cars.

title: Let Black Kids Just Be Kids
description: George Zimmerman admitted at his 2012 bail hearing that he misjudged Trayvon Martins age when he killed him. I thought he was a little bit younger than I am, he said, meaning just under 28. But Trayvon was only 17.

title: Minecraft: The Island Blurs the Line Between Fiction and Gaming
description: The protagonist of Max Brookss new fantasy novel doesnt have a name, a gender or even normal human appendages. Instead of hands, the narrator has clumsy, flesh-toned cubes, just one more weird feature of the strange and unsettling world where the story unfolds, where everything  the sun, clouds, cows, mushrooms, watermelons  is composed of squares.

title: Little League Homer by Yoenis Cespedes Edges Mets Over Padres
description: SAN DIEGO  Yoenis Cespedes, the slumping Mets slugger, tried to stop his swing, but the bat came around enough to make contact with the pitch. The halfhearted effort poked the ball mere inches inside the right field line, and Cespedes took off for his adventure around the bases.

title: Want a Job, Mate? Amazon Is Hiring Aussie Speakers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Think you know the ins and outs of Australian English? Amazon is hiring.

title: Deadly Building Collapse in India Caused by Illegal Alterations, Police Say
description: MUMBAI, India  The Mumbai police on Wednesday arrested a man affiliated with a local political party, accusing him of making illegal alterations to the ground floor of a five-story building that caused it to collapse a day earlier, killing at least 17 people and injuring a dozen others.

title: After 50 Years, Detroit Unrest Remains Vivid
description: In this 360 video, travel through archival photographs to sites of one of the most destructive civil disturbances in American history and hear from a woman who witnessed it.

title: Is It O.K. to Protest Trump by Withholding Taxes?
description: I am increasingly distressed by many of the things that the Trump administration is, and is not, doing. The president himself has declared that not paying taxes makes him smart, and I do not trust that my federal tax dollars will be put to good use. I want to resist the president, his cronies and their destructive agenda(s) any way I can.

title: Why Rashida Jones Changed Her Mind About Porn
description: In 2015, you produced a documentary about young pornography performers, Hot Girls Wanted, that was eventually turned into a new Netflix documentary series. But in 2013, you wrote a pretty strident essay in Glamour against the pornification of everything, where you recount using the hashtag #stopactinglikewhores, in regard to the mainstreaming of, say, V-strings and stripper poles. What changed? I was impulsive. Being old isnt a good excuse for it, but using the word whore was absolutely not appropriate. I didnt even know what slut shaming meant at the time, and I have educated myself. But that was sort of the beginning of my relationship with all this work  I wanted to see if my feelings had any validity in the real world, or if I was just being close-minded.

title: In So Much Blue, a Married Painter Spills Secrets
description: SO MUCH BLUEBy Percival Everett256 pp. Graywolf Press. Paper, $16.

title: Three New Books Discuss How to Confront and Reform Racist Policing
description: CALLED TO RISE A Life in Faithful Service to the Community That Made Me By David O. Brown with Michelle Burford Illustrated. 255 pp. Ballantine Books. $28.

title: New Ethics Chief Has Fought to Roll Back Restrictions
description: WASHINGTON  David J. Apol, named by President Trump last week as the new head of the Office of Government Ethics, has repeatedly clashed with colleagues over his career at the agency as he sought to roll back or loosen ethics requirements on federal employees, including those in the White House, three former senior officials at the agency said.

title: A Fish Master on Eating Tuna (and Other Fish) Responsibly
description: The accolade required hours of classes every week for four months: In 2009, Nick Sakagami of Los Angeles became the only person outside of Japan to be certified as an osakana meister, or fish master. He can identify every fish species and hundreds of subspecies by taste, feel, sight and smell. And he has an expertise in tuna.

title: How Microsoft Has Become the Surprise Innovator in PCs
description: When Microsoft unveiled the first Surface tablet five years ago, it was a spectacular failure.

title: Health Care Vote: Senate Rejects Repeal Without Replace
description: The Senate on Wednesday afternoon rejected a proposal to repeal major parts of the Affordable Care Act without providing a replacement. Follow the live vote tracker to see how each senator voted.

title: In Southeast England, White Cliffs, Fish and Chips, and Deals
description: Much pleasure in life can be derived from the simple act of discovery: finding a good band, an exciting restaurant or a secluded park. Frequent travelers live to unearth those gems, too. Sometimes, though, travel is as much about shared experiences as it is about striking out on ones own.

title: Just How Far Can California Possibly Go on Climate?
description: Over the past decade, California has passed a sweeping set of climate laws to test a contentious theory: that its possible to cut greenhouse gas emissions far beyond what any other state has done and still enjoy robust economic growth.

title: Proposal Would Let Charter Schools Certify Their Own Teachers
description: It is usually a sleepy civic exercise: A proposed change to a specialized bit of state regulations is published in the State Register, officially marking the beginning of a public comment period.

title: Michael Moore Says He Wants to Change Minds. So Why Is He on Broadway?
description: What the hell does Michael Moore want now?

title: Auschwitz Artifacts to Go on Tour, Very Carefully
description: WARSAW  More than 72 years after the liberation of Auschwitz, the first traveling exhibition about the Nazi death camp will begin a journey later this year to 14 cities across Europe and North America, taking heartbreaking artifacts to multitudes who have never seen such horror up close.

title: Who Wants to Run That Mom-and-Pop Market? Almost No One
description: SAN LUIS, Colo.  Each morning as the sun curves over Main Street in this isolated desert town, Felix Romero takes the worn wooden steps from his upstairs apartment to his downstairs grocery.

title: Living in Mill Basin, Brooklyn
description: A peninsula by Jamaica Bay is popular with boaters and sun lovers.

title: Mill Basin, Brooklyn: House-Proud, but Not Too Accessible
description: At the northeast corner of Mill Basin sits a shopping center with a celebrated pizzeria called La Villa. Sniff the air, however, and you wont smell oregano. The odor is infused with salt, decaying plant matter and diesel fuel. The source  an arm of Jamaica Bay  is right behind the mall.

title: Stephen Colbert Says Trump Attacked Boy Scouts Belief in Our Democracy
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: The Daily: On the Senate Floor
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: Republican Party, Jeff Sessions, North Korea: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Dr. G. Yunupingu, Australian Aboriginal Singer, Dies at 46
description: Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu, an Aboriginal Australian singer whose soulful voice and prodigious guitar playing took him from the remote island of his birth to concert halls around the world, died on Tuesday in Darwin, Australia. He was 46.

title: How Tattoos Might Affect Your Workout
description: Tattoos may permanently alter the physiology of skin in ways that affect sweating.

title: Morning Agenda: Starboard Picks Its Next Target, ComScore
description: Starboard Value has already taken on Yahoo and Macys. Its next target: comScore, the media measurement company.

title: New York Today: Where to Shoot Wedding Photos
description: Good morning on this gorgeous Wednesday.

title: Trump Is on Track to Insult 650 People, Places and Things on Twitter by the End of His First Term
description: Six months into his presidency, Mr. Trump is using his Twitter account to insult others with a frequency and intensity not seen since he was a candidate.

title: After 26 Years, Munich Settles Case Over a Klee Looted by the Nazis
description: BERLIN  After 26 years in court, the longest-running German legal wrangle over Nazi-looted art ended on Wednesday with a settlement that will reimburse a family for the seizure of a masterpiece by Paul Klee that was once scorned as the work of a degenerate.

title: Wildfires Force Thousands to Evacuate in Southern France
description: PARIS  Thousands of people were evacuated from homes and vacation sites in southeastern France on Wednesday as strong winds fueled wildfires that had been raging across the region for days.

title: The Luxury Arms Race: Michael Kors and Coach Target Takeovers
description: The global luxury market has long been dominated by three giants, all European  LVMH Mot Hennessy Louis Vuitton, Kering and Richemont. Now, it has two hungry American players with which to contend.

title: Swiss Man Suspected in Chain Saw Attack Is Arrested Near Zurich
description: BERLIN  After a search by hundreds of officers, the Swiss police arrested and charged a 51-year-old man suspected of attacking health insurance employees last week with a chain saw, the authorities said on Wednesday.

title: Citizen Action on Health Care
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: California Today: A Republican Candidate for Governor Talks About Corruption
description: Good morning.

title: How to Be Mindful When Its Hot Outside
description: The high heat and sultry air of summer can exact a toll on mood and physical well-being. Meeting steamy conditions with mindfulness may help us discover that peace and joy are possible, even under the suns most unforgiving rays.  Breon Michel, a mindfulness teacher from Phoenix.

title: $2.4 Million Homes in Colorado, Rhode Island and Florida
description: A beachfront townhouse on Siesta Key, a shingled home near the bay in Bristol and a Tudor-style house in a leafy Denver enclave.

title: $2.4 Million Homes in Florida, Rhode Island and Colorado
description: WHAT A beachfront townhouse with five bedrooms and four full and two half-bathrooms

title: Britain to Ban New Diesel and Gas Cars by 2040
description: LONDON  Scrambling to combat a growing air pollution crisis, Britain announced on Wednesday that sales of new diesel and gas cars would reach the end of the road by 2040, the latest step in Europes battle against the damaging environmental impact of the internal combustion engine.

title: Novak Djokovic Is Out for the Season With an Injured Elbow
description: For 18 months Novak Djokovic played through a right elbow injury until the pain forced him out of his quarterfinal match at Wimbledon two weeks ago. Now, because of the injury, Djokovic will miss a Grand Slam tournament for the first time since he began competing in them in 2005.

title: Trump Says Transgender People Will Not Be Allowed in the Military
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump abruptly announced a ban on transgender people serving in the military on Wednesday, blindsiding his defense secretary and Republican congressional leaders with a snap decision that reversed a year-old policy reviled by social conservatives.

title: The Technology Behind Good Coffee
description: The staff at The Wirecutter and Sweethome, The New York Timess product evaluation sites, seem just a little obsessed with coffee. They have evaluated a lot of brewing and grinding equipment, so I spoke with Michael Zhao, senior editor at The Wirecutter, about their findings.

title: A Farmhouse in the Czech Republic
description: A 19th-century farmhouse offers an acre of peace and quiet and yet is within an hour of Prague.

title: House Hunting in  the Czech Republic
description: A 19th-century farmstead with six bedrooms and five bathrooms renovated with an eye to historic detail is for sale in Racice, a small town near Prague in the Czech Republic.

title: Googles New Parental Control App Has a Flaw: Puberty
description: The only consensus among parents about the right age for a child to have unfettered access to a smartphone is that there is no magic number.

title: Ford Reports a Small Profit, but Its New Chief Faces Slowing Sales
description: Jim Hackett has said little about his plans to revitalize Ford Motor since he was named its chief executive two months ago, but the first earnings report in his tenure points to some of the trouble spots he must address.

title: For Those About to Rock, Bar Matchless Is Ready
description: On a Saturday night in May, Scott Wolf arrived in the band room early at Bar Matchless in a tightfitting denim jacket. His band Bound and Buried was the headliner on a four-band bill at the club, which is in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. The local band Brogues started things off for a small but steadily growing crowd by blasting through a set of pop punk. The thick distorted guitar sounds were loud enough to make a seasoned heavy metal fans ears ring.

title: Five Places to Shop in Seville
description: Seville never used to be a destination for shoppers. Up until about five years ago, travelers to this southern Spanish city could expect to find stores selling not much more than old-fashioned flamenco dresses or touristy knickknacks. The offerings became more inspiring with the 2011 opening of Metropol Parasol, a mushroomlike contemporary structure with Roman ruins and a market underneath and views of the city and countryside from the top. These days, the cluster of surrounding narrow streets lined with 16th- and 17th-century buildings is dotted with hip, locally run boutiques that show off the increasingly modern side of a metropolis steeped in history and tradition.

title: In the N.F.L., Its Quarterback Controversy Season
description: The Patriots, the Falcons, the Cowboys and most other successful N.F.L. teams don't spend much time worrying about who their starting quarterback is going to be. They just pencil in Brady, Ryan or Prescott and hope he doesnt get hurt.

title: Despite Progress, Child Marriage Is Still Legal in All 50 States
description: State legislators in the U.S. can no longer plead ignorance about child marriage in America. Not now that research shows an estimated quarter-million children, at least as young as 10, were married in the United States between 2000 and 2010. National and international news outlets arepaying attention.

title: Britain to Ban New Diesel and Gas Cars by 2040
description: LONDON  Scrambling to combat a growing air pollution crisis, Britain announced on Wednesday that sales of new diesel and gas cars would reach the end of the road by 2040, the latest step in Europes battle against the damaging environmental impact of the internal combustion engine.

title: E.U. Court Urged to Punish Hungary and Slovakia for Resisting Migrant Plan
description: BRUSSELS  A top European Union legal adviser denounced Hungary and Slovakia on Wednesday for refusing to participate in a plan devised in 2015 to relocate migrants from Greece and Italy as the migration crisis reached its height.

title: Philippe de Montebello, Former Met Chief, Joins Acquavella
description: Philippe de Montebello, the former director of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, doesnt exactly need another job.

title: Mostly Mozart Festival: So Percussion and Ksenija Perform
description: The Mostly Mozart Festival has started, which means the return of A Little Night Music  intimate, hourlong programs in Lincoln Centers Kaplan Penthouse. Starting at 10 p.m., these events offer the closest New York can get to an elegant nightclub for classical music.

title: Williamstown Theater Festival: Three Sisters and Lots of Kvetching
description: Just so you know, Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow Moscow, at the Williamstown Theater Festival through Aug. 6, does not portray the mental landscape of beleaguered members of the Trump family in recent weeks. It is a revisionist comic portrait of another clan for whom Russias best-known metropolis towers in the imagination.

title: The Legacy of Lynching, at the Brooklyn Museum, Documents Violent Racism
description: Some exhibitions are as much about life as about art. The Legacy of Lynching: Confronting Racial Terror in America, at the Brooklyn Museum, is a collaboration with the Equal Justice Initiative, founded by the lawyer and MacArthur fellow Bryan Stevenson to target racism in the criminal justice system.

title: Prismatic Park, an Oasis of Art in Madison Square Park
description: With its verdant seven acres, Madison Square Park is one of those oases of foliage and calm amid the concrete mania of Manhattan. Its home to the usual amenities, like playgrounds for dogs and kids, but also some more unusual sights thanks to the parks robust public art program, which has hosted dozens of large-scale sculptures and installations since 2004.

title: Clouseau, Clouseau and More Clouseau: A Pink Panther Fest
description: Peter Sellerss film career was highlighted by two wildly different Oscar-nominated performances 15 years apart: Dr. Strangelove, or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb in 1964 and Being There in 1979. But what might be considered his bread-and-butter role was the ridiculous Inspector Jacques Clouseau in The Pink Panther (1964) and a slew of sequels.

title: Nate Smith Brings Kinfolk to Jazz Standard
description: We dont talk a lot about percussion having a flavor. But on the drummer Nate Smiths Kinfolk: Postcards From Everywhere, released this spring, all sorts of sounds participate in building the rhythm: taut but resonant bass notes, clipped guitar playing, zagging saxophone lines. The result is a sound thats tart, bittersweet and almost nostalgic.

title: Rick and Morty, With Adult Swims Oddest Duo, Returns. Finally.
description: Being a Rick and Morty fan is a sort of exquisite torture, in several ways. For one thing, merely watching this outlandish animated Adult Swim series can hurt the brain. The tales of Rick, a crazed scientific genius, his grandson Morty, and their travels through space and time move so quickly and are such a mishmash of physics, pseudoscientific jargon and pop-culture references that merely keeping up is heavy mental exercise. But another part of the torture is waiting for new episodes; the seasons tend to be rather widely spaced out.

title: No Links to Cuomo? Their Ad Was Labeled Client: Andrew Cuomo
description: At the end of a video promoting Gov. Andrew M. Cuomos immigration policies, a disclaimer noted the advertisements funding source: an obscure anti-discrimination group called New Yorkers United Together.

title: The Strange Case of Martin Shkreli Is Wrapping Up
description: In February 2013, Martin Shkreli was contemplating a deal that involved acquiring shares of Retrophin, the pharmaceutical company he ran, at below the market price.

title: Trump Attacks Sessions Again, This Time Over the Acting F.B.I. Director
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump publicly attacked Attorney General Jeff Sessions for a third consecutive day on Wednesday, questioning why Mr. Sessions has not fired the acting director of the F.B.I. over his wifes political ties to Hillary Clinton.

title: How an American in London Learned to Fear the ASBO
description: LONDON  Dogs cannot safely bark in this city.

title: Ohio Carries Out Its First Execution Since 2014
description: An Ohio prisoner convicted of raping and murdering a toddler in Akron in 1993 was put to death on Wednesday morning, the states first execution in more than three years.

title: Crushed Tomatoes
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: How U.S. Military Policy on Transgender Personnel Changed Under Obama
description: President Trumps announcement on Twitter Wednesday morning that transgender people would be barred from the United States military in any capacity marked a sudden reversal of a policy that had evolved rapidly under the Obama White House.

title: Did We Take Trump Too Seriously?
description: An article in this weeks Sunday Review, Donald Trumps Plan to Save Western Civilization by Stephen Wertheim, a historian at Kings College at the University of Cambridge, argued that in his first six months in office, President Trump has put forward the outlines of a foreign policy doctrine, one focused on the defense of Western civilization. Professor Wertheims article attracted hundreds of comments on nytimes.com and hundreds more on social media. Max Strasser, a staff editor in The New York Times Opinion section, and Professor Wertheim discussed the article and how readers responded to it.

title: Packing Google Maps, but Not an Internet Connection
description: Q. I will use only my Verizon plan iPhone and Google Maps for driving directions in Europe. What plans or workarounds can I use to minimize data use?

title: Taliban Slaughter Soldiers in Pattern of Attacks in Kandahar
description: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan  In a bloody overnight attack in Kandahar Province in Afghanistan on Wednesday, the Taliban routed an Afghan Army outpost, killing dozens of soldiers and raising fears of a concerted insurgent offensive in the province, a former seat of Taliban power that took years of effort by coalition and Afghan forces to secure.

title: A Fictional Patricia Highsmith as Strange as the Real One
description: THE CRIME WRITER By Jill Dawson 246 pp. Harper Perennial. Paper, $15.99.

title: Cheech Marin, Searching for a Chicano Rockwell
German Islamic Extremist Is Convicted of Supporting Terror Group
description: BERLIN  A German court on Wednesday sentenced one of the countrys best-known Islamic extremists to more than five years in prison for raising money and recruiting people for the Islamic insurgency in Syria.

title: The Surprising New PC Innovator? Microsoft
description: Microsoft devices used to be a joke. Even putting those two words together  Microsoft and devices  would elicit a giggle. After all, Microsoft was good at making software, not at making gadgets.

title: Review: A Youthful Experiment Kicks Off Mostly Mozart
description: Give the Mostly Mozart festival credit for trying something different to open its 2017 season on Tuesday at David Geffen Hall. Instead of the typical gala evening of Mozart favorites, the festival orchestra was joined by the wonderful Young Peoples Chorus of New York City for a thoughtful program of symphony and song.

title: On the East River Ferry, a Party Before the Party
description: When Nate Hodges mother-in-law was visiting from Massachusetts, he and his wife, Catherine Greeley, wanted to treat her to a drink before dinner. It was a gorgeous weekend evening in New York City, 75 degrees and sunny, so they wanted to be outside. They could have gone to a cafe with a patio or a rooftop bar, but they opted for a more unlikely venue for cocktail hour: the South Brooklyn ferry to Manhattan.

title: Are You Affected by Trumps Ban on Transgender Service Members?
description: The New York Times would like to hear from people who are affected by President Trumps decision to ban transgender people from military service.

title: A Test for the Market in Initial Coin Offerings
description: The ballooning market for so-called initial coin offerings  which has boomed to $1.3 billion so far this year  just got a reality check.

title: He Gave David Lynch His Start. Now, at 82, Hes a New Director.
description: Ben Barenholtzs many credits  though he dismisses them with a wave  include kick-starting the careers of David Lynch, the Coen brothers and John Sayles.

title: Lawmakers in Russia Call for Retaliation Against New U.S. Sanctions
description: MOSCOW  Russian legislators called on Wednesday for painful measures against the United States in response to plans for new American sanctions, while the Kremlin focused more on the damage to relations between Washington and Moscow.

title: Quantifying the Benefits of Owning a Dog
description: Just how good is dog walking for you? Older dog owners who walked their dogs at least once a day got 20 percent more physical activity than people without dogs, a British study found, and spent 30 fewer minutes a day being sedentary, on average. Regular exercise has well-known benefits for health and longevity.

title: Cheated World Track Medalists to Finally Have a Proper Ceremony
description: When the world championships of track and field begin next month in London, there will be a few extra medal ceremonies.

title: Fed, Leaving Rates Unchanged, Expects to Wind Down Stimulus Relatively Soon
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve moved into the ready position Wednesday for the next phase of its retreat from its post-crisis economic stimulus campaign. In a statement after a two-day meeting of its policy-making committee, the Fed said it would start reducing its bond holdings relatively soon so long as moderate economic growth continues.

title: Portfolio: Dead Malls
description: Dan Bell takes us on a visual journey through some of the dying pleasure palaces of his youth.

title: An Ode to Shopping Malls
description: One day in 2015, Dan Bell left his home in Baltimore and drove into the suburbs to visit the Owings Mills Mall. It was a trip out of memory. As a 9-year-old boy, he had attended the grand opening of this 820,000-square-foot shopping emporium with his family.

title: Mandy Patinkin to Star in The Great Comet
description: Mandy Patinkin is returning to Broadway. The Tony-winning actor will assume the lead male role in Natasha, Pierre & The Great Comet of 1812 for three weeks, from Aug. 15 through Sept. 3. Hell take over from the Hamilton alumnus Okieriete Onaodowan in a show that picked up 12 Tony nominations and continues to perform strongly at the box office.

title: A Virginia Woman Hears a Noise in the Attic, and the Police Find a Man Living There
description: Usually, the floorboards creaking above you in the middle of the night are the house settling. Or perhaps a raccoon. But for a woman in Arlington, Va., it was the footsteps of a man living in her attic.

title: How India and China Have Come to the Brink Over a Remote Mountain Pass
description: On a remote pass through Himalayan peaks, China and India, two nuclear-armed nations, have come near the brink of conflict over an unpaved road. It is one of the worst border disputes between the regional rivals in more than 30 years.

title: Trump Administration Slaps Sanctions on Venezuela and Warns of More
description: WASHINGTON  The Treasury Department imposed financial sanctions on a host of current and former senior Venezuelan officials on Wednesday and threatened to take more stringent action if President Nicols Maduro proceeds with plans for a constituent assembly on Sunday that critics consider a danger to democracy.

title: Sex Assault Survivors and Guns
description: To the Editor:

title: A Photographer Captures the Hellish Battle of Messines
description: By one terrific blow the British on June 7, 1917, smashed the strong German salient south of Ypres [Belgium], where for two-and-a-half years the Allied armies had held the enemy in check, but where all that time they had been harassed by German guns on the Messines-Wytschaete Ridge, the Mid-Week Pictorial said a century ago this week, as it offered readers some of the most amazing pictures yet of the Great War.

title: The G.O.P.s Health Care Hail Mary: Skinny Repeal
description: Margot Sanger-Katz, a New York Times correspondent, explains the implications of a new, more narrow health care bill Republicans are working on.

title: E.U. Rebukes Poland Over Vetoed Bills, but Backs Off Harsher Threat
description: WARSAW  Two days after Polands president vetoed legislation that would have put the courts under the governing partys control, the European Union filed a complaint against the government over the proposed changes.

title: Ticking Watch. Boat Engine. Slowness. The Secrets of the Dunkirk Score.
description: The Christopher Nolan film Dunkirk, about the dramatic rescue of Allied troops from a French beach in World War II, ignores many conventions of war movies  most prominently, a heroic score. Instead of sweeping strings and get-out-the-cavalry horns, Dunkirk is set to a droning beat that ratchets ever up in intensity.

title: Watch a Bolshoi Ballerina in Action: The Eyes Are Most Important
Transgender in the Military
description: To the Editor:

title: Trump Punishes Transgender Patriots
description: So far, President Trump has not succeeded in his plans to steal health insurance from tens of millions of people, break up families by deporting millions of would-be Americans, enrich his fellow 1 percenters with new tax breaks and bar immigrants from entering the country because of their religion.

title: Trumps Contempt for Transgender Heroes
description: Last year, there was a reunion of the crew of the U.S.S. Francis Scott Key. The submarine had been launched in 1966, and was part of the Navys nuclear fleet until its decommissioning in 1993.

title: Digital Artist Yung Jake Scores With Emoji Portraits
description: They flow ceaselessly through the text panels on our smartphones, these ubiquitous ideograms used to convey facts or feelings or perhaps nothing at all. They have come to infiltrate both our memes and our dreams. They appeared on Nippon Telegraph and Telephone mobile devices in the 90s, went global when Apple made them standard on iPhones and have become so universal that Sony has turned them into an animated movie.

title: Mariano Rajoy, Spanish Premier, Testifies in Graft Trial Involving His Party
description: LISBON  Prime Minister Mariano Rajoy appeared in court at a political corruption trial on Wednesday, becoming the first sitting head of the Spanish government to take the witness stand in the countrys modern history.

title: Sessions, Kushner and the Russia Investigation
description: To the Editor:

title: Esperanza Spalding Will Record Exposure in Front of the World
description: Last week at Carnegie Hall, Esperanza Spalding was slashing through a tangle of chord changes on her fretless electric bass. Behind her was a four-piece band; behind it, a symphony orchestra.

title: White House, Jeff Sessions, North Korea: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Migrants in France Say Police Abuse Is Common
description: PARIS  New allegations of routine police harassment of migrants in Calais surfaced Wednesday in a report detailing officers nearly daily use of pepper spray as well as limited access to food and the destruction of migrant shelters.

title: Modern Love Podcast: Alex Karpovsky Reads Uh, Honey, Thats Not Your Line
description: On this weeks podcast, the actor Alex Karpovsky reads the essay Uh, Honey, That's Not Your Line, in which Matteson Perry learns that the Manic Pixie Dream Girl is nothing more than a trope.

title: On Arcade Fires Everything Now, Pop Can Reach Deep and Be a Distraction
description: A light touch doesnt come easily to Arcade Fire. But the band is determined to find one on Everything Now, its fifth studio album.

title: From Colonial Mexico, a Towering Vision of Grace
description: Bound up the steps to the front door of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, open your bag for inspection, pay your $25 or 25 cents for a ticket, and walk straight forward. Youll be in the dim Medieval Sculpture Hall, with its giant iron choir screen  but something unusual, something brilliant, is peeking out beyond it. The usually empty doorway to the Lehman Collection, at the back of the museum, is overwhelmed with dumbstruck apostles, swaddled in silks of rose and lilac; there are prophets with long white beards, backlit by dazzling sun. In the center of it all, beckoning tour groups to his fellowship, is the white-clad, mustachioed son of God, his body halfway between flesh and light.

title: Manhattan Antique Dealers Plead Guilty to Selling Illegal Elephant Ivory
description: The owners of a Midtown Manhattan antiques shop pleaded guilty on Wednesday to illegally selling and offering for sale over $4.5 million in ivory from more than a dozen slaughtered elephants, the authorities said.

title: Case of Zika Virus, Likely Spread by Mosquito, Is Reported in Texas
description: For the first time since last fall, officials in Texas have reported what they believe is a case of mosquito transmission of the Zika virus within the states borders.

title: Key Senator Drops Objection, Clearing Way for Russia Sanctions
description: WASHINGTON  Congresss push to enact far-reaching sanctions against Russia appeared to overcome a final obstacle on Wednesday after a key Senate Republican backed off concerns about a House bill  passed overwhelmingly one day earlier  that would also punish North Korea.

title: Trolls Insulted My Body. So I Made This Music Video for Them.
description: Its Friday night and Im at home, sitting on the couch watching The Great British Bake Off in my jammies. My phone lights up with a notification. Despite everyone I know telling me not to read YouTube comments, I do it anyway because I am a contrarian. I read the following:

title: Mean Streets, Kind Cameras
description: WASHINGTON  Question for the day posed by a timely exhibition: Would someone who lived in a so-called inner city picture it differently than an outsider would?

title: 5 Resort Labels to Inspire Wanderlust
description: The merits of a life of leisure are up for debate, but there is no harm in dressing the part. A slew of new and under-the-radar resort labels are making the case for vacation as a year-round pursuit, not a twice-a-year indulgence. And they may be onto something. Despite the explosion of health and wellness goods on the market, Americans still report higher levels of stress than ever before. Maybe its time to ditch the chakra-balancing crystals and magnesium-infused smoothies and go in for some good old-fashioned sartorial R & R, even if the only place you wear the free-spirited items is to the office. Here, five labels that inspire, and are inspired by, travel.

title: Aleppo Has Little Food or Water, but for a Night, Music
description: Music echoed through the amphitheater of the iconic citadel in Aleppo, Syria, on Tuesday night as the site hosted its first concert since the countrys war began in 2011.

title: 2 Police Officers Are Charged in Assault of Mentally Ill Man
description: Two former police officers in Nebraska were charged with assault after beating and using a Taser on a mentally ill man as they tried to take him into custody for erratic behavior in Omaha last month, an official said on Wednesday. The man later died.

title: Why Skinny Obamacare Repeal Is a Terrible Idea
description: Skinny is often read as good today. We like skinny jeans, skinny models and, apparently, skinny health reform. It is likely that the Senate, which has just rejected repeal-and-replace and repeal-without-replace bills, will vote on a skinny repeal of the Affordable Care Act. What does this actually mean, and what would it produce?

title: Why Is Our Existence as Humans Still Being Denied?
description: In Denver in 1978, just after the July 4 holiday, 19 men and women with disabilities positioned themselves in front of public buses at the busy intersection of Colfax Avenue and Broadway. They chanted We will ride! until city transportation officials were willing to hear their complaints: Namely, that lack of access to public transportation led to disenfranchisement and discrimination, which led to joblessness, homelessness, despair and misery.

title: Foxconn Says It Plans to Build Factory in Wisconsin, Adding 3,000 Jobs
description: Foxconn, the Taiwanese electronics supplier for Apple and other tech giants, said Wednesday it would open its first major American factory in Wisconsin, a boost both for the battleground states economy and the Trump administrations efforts to bolster domestic manufacturing.

title: Your Ventures Not Ready for Prime Time? This Site Can Help
description: When a huge earthquake hit his hometown in Nepal in 2015, Madindra Aryal and his family had to stay in tents without electricity. He and his neighbors lived in complete darkness at night, and they could not charge their cellphones, which meant they were unable to contact worried family members.

title: Review: In the Binge-TV Age, Room 104 Offers a 30-Minute Escape
description: If you think of TV in real-estate terms, it increasingly asks viewers to sign long-term leases. Serial and complex shows, designed to be binge-watched, demand hour upon hour, season upon season. Unpack your bags, a Game of Thrones or The Walking Dead says: Youre going to stay awhile.

title: John McCain Gets Best Care, Then Votes to Deprive Others
description: To the Editor:

title: Death of Pioneering New York Judge Is Ruled a Suicide
description: Putting to rest a mystery that initially puzzled investigators, the New York City medical examiners office ruled on Wednesday that the death of Sheila Abdus-Salaam, the first black woman to serve on New York States highest court, was a suicide.

title: Is It Wrong to Get Separate Checks? Readers Debate Apps Like Venmo
description: In his recent article, Thanks to Venmo, We Now All Know How Cheap Our Friends Are, Teddy Wayne argued that instead of easing payments between friends, payment and bill-splitting apps like Venmo (Divvy is another) encourage pettiness in people requesting payment. Such apps make the payee less likely to courteously round down, instead expecting to be reimbursed for every penny.

title: Review: In Two Israeli Plays, the Promise of Peace Keeps Receding
description: We know how to wage war. When waging peace, the strategies are less certain. That tenuous battle has inspired two fitfully involving Israeli plays at this years Lincoln Center Festival: an adaptation of David Grossmans novel To the End of the Land, produced by HaBima National Theater and the Cameri Theater of Tel Aviv, and Yitzhak Rabin: Chronicle of an Assassination, directed by the filmmaker Amos Gitai.

title: Dying: A Memoir Is a Bracing Illumination of Terminal Illness
description: DYINGA MemoirBy Cory Taylor141 pages. Tin House Books. $18.95.

title: F.C. Barcelona President Josep Maria Bartomeu on Touring, Taxes and a Potential Neymar Transfer
description: By F.C. Barcelonas standards, it has been a trying couple of years. The clubs archrival, Real Madrid, won last seasons Spanish league title and has captured three of the last four Champions League titles. Barcelonas manager, Luis Enrique, announced his resignation before the end of last season, and another Spaniard, Ernesto Valverde, has slid into the regularly hot seat he vacated. Sandro Rosell, the teams former president, was arrested in May on money laundering charges. Lionel Messi was found to have violated Spanish tax laws, and Barcelonas current president, Josep Maria Bartomeu, and the star forward Neymar  currently the focus of multimillion-dollar transfer rumors  will both stand trial on corruption charges related to Neymars transfer to the club in 2013.

title: When the White House Lies About You
description: Last week the White House told a lie. It was a small lie and, given the epic scale of this administrations mendacity, an inconsequential one. It just happened to be about me.

title: For Transgender Service Members, a Mix of Sadness, Anger and Fear
description: COLORADO SPRINGS  Joining the Navy was one of the best decisions Alec Kerry said she had ever made. The other was coming out as transgender.

title: Republican Party, Russia, Venezuela: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: In Detroit, Black Lives Caught in a Prehistory of the Alt-Right
description: Racial slurs fly fast and furious in Kathryn Bigelows Detroit, but the most troubling and divisive words uttered onscreen are variations on the simple pronouns they and them. The words may be perfectly neutral in themselves, but when used to separate one group of people from another they take on an insidious, implicitly violent connotation.

title: Minneapolis Police Change Body Camera Policy After Fatal Shooting
description: Minneapolis police officers will be required to turn on their body cameras as soon as they start responding to 911 calls, part of a policy overhaul announced on Wednesday as fallout continues from the fatal shooting of an unarmed Australian woman by an officer who was wearing a camera but not recording.

title: A Reporters East Africa File Cabinets Yield Untold Stories
description: On one of my last nights in Nairobi, Kenya, after serving as The New York Timess East Africa bureau chief for more than a decade, I sat down on the office floor under one of those grim energy-saver light bulbs that gave off a cold bluish light, pulled open the file cabinets and began excavating.

title: Review: In Girl From the North Country, Rolling Stones Gather Regrets
description: LONDON  The Irish playwright Conor McPherson has gone a-wanderin in a Minnesota of the mind, a bleak and soulful place conjured by the songs of Bob Dylan. As portrayed in Girl From the North Country  the truly sui generis new work written and directed by Mr. McPherson, with a multitude of songs by Mr. Dylan  this cold corner of the United States is a place where it is all too easy to lose your way.

title: One Day, Three Events, Seven Falsehoods From Trump
description: In just a few hours on Tuesday, President Trump made seven misleading statements: about Middle East politics, during a joint news conference with Prime Minister Saad Hariri of Lebanon; about veterans affairs reforms, in remarks to American heroes; and about jobs and health care, to supporters in Ohio. Heres an assessment.

title: Daughter of Slain Police Officer Is Born, 2 Years After Fathers Death
description: When New York City Police Officer Wenjian Liu and his partner were shot and killed in their patrol car in Brooklyn in December 2014, Officer Liu had been married not quite three months. That night, as his family and his fellow officers grieved, his wife asked the hospital to retrieve his sperm, so that someday she might have his child.

In reality, it is a Goldilocks-like search by Republicans for a bill that can get the bare minimum number of votes needed for the party to claim victory.

On the 100th anniversary of his birth and only a decade since his death, in 2007, the Milanese maestro best known for his red Olivetti portable typewriter and as the guru of the revolutionary postmodern design group Memphis remains a magnificent irritant and an exemplar of originality.

description: LOS ANGELES  One by one, the prosecutor in the murder case against Robert A. Durst has brought reluctant witnesses to Superior Court here to obtain testimony in a case that spans the country, 36 years and at least two deaths.

Lhota, the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, announced a series of measures aimed at improving the system, including removing seats from some cars to accommodate more passengers, adding countdown clocks and lengthening trains on the C line.

title: Quotation of the Day: Seatless Subway Cars Could Mean More Room for a Floor Show

title: The Year of the Goat
description: Scout Raskin owns three dogs, a cat, turtles and a pair of hermit crabs. Still, she longed for a country pet to round out the menagerie at her home in a semirural neighborhood in Los Angeles County. A horse was too big for the backyard, a chicken impossible to cuddle. That is why in March she found herself at a Jack in the Box in Lancaster, Calif., a desert town on the western edge of the Mojave Desert, where she met a goat breeder with two Nigerian dwarf kids in the back of his Honda Odyssey.

title: A Call to Activism for Outdoor Apparel Makers

title: China and India File Rival Claims Over Tibetan Medicine

India granted asylum to the Dalai Lama, the Tibetan spiritual leader, in 1959. Three years later, the two countries fought a border war. Now they are in a standoff over an area disputed by China and Bhutan, the Himalayan kingdom whose claim is supported by India.

This was obvious pandering to regressive generals and right-wing zealots as well as an effort to shift the focus from his dysfunctional White House.

title: How to Make a Movie Out of Anything  Even a Mindless Phone Game
description: In 2013, a movie producer named Tripp Vinson was thumbing through Variety when he stumbled upon a confounding item: Phil Lord and Christopher Miller, a pair of writers and directors, were working on something called The Lego Movie. Vinson was baffled. I had no idea where they were going to go with Legos, he says. Theres no character; no narrative; no theme. Nothing.

title: Walking to Work From the Lower East Side
description: Megan Woods love for travel began when she was a Peace Corps volunteer in Paraguay. Later, working as a travel writer and editor, she moved to New York, where she lived mostly with roommates.

title: Remains of the Day
description: For more than 50 years, the German novelist Christa Wolf kept an unusual diary: She recorded the events of just one day  Sept. 27. The project began as an assignment by a Russian newspaper, but she discovered she couldnt stop. Until her death in 2011, she faithfully jotted down what she ate on that day, and where she went, what she saw and whom. I began to await with a certain sense of tension what this day of the year, as I soon called it, would bring me each time, she wrote. Noting down the details became a sometimes delightful, sometimes inconvenient duty. It also became an exercise in preventing blindness to reality. The final volume of the diary, One Day a Year: 2001-2011 (Seagull Books, $21), edited by her husband, Gerhard Wolf, and translated by Katy Derbyshire, was published this spring.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Duolingo
description: I didnt buy a smartphone until I was forced to in 2013, when my ancient flip was put out of its misery by a spilled can of Vanilla Coke. As a new convert, I quickly came to believe my phone would soon improve my life. I began downloading apps that promised to make me better: more organized, better read, more cultured. I was convinced I could swipe my way to self-improvement.

title: Health Care Debate: Obamacare Repeal Fails as McCain Casts Decisive No Vote
Review: Dressed to Kill, Atomic Blonde Also Shoots to Kill
description: Atomic Blonde is going to make an excellent highlight reel. It already is one, in a manner of speaking, given that its strengths are lavishly violent, inventively choreographed fights that have been glued together by nonsense and Charlize Theron. The nonsense involves spies chasing secrets in Berlin just before the fall of the wall, which may suggest John le Carr but plays closer to a dumb and dumber take on Boris and Natasha. Mostly, the movie is an excuse to watch a beautiful, deviously clever female avatar as she is stripped naked, dolled up and repeatedly beaten down only to rise again.

title: Switching Careers Doesnt Have to Be Hard: Charting Jobs That Are Similar to Yours

Then it halted production, and he was laid off. At 33, with two children and a mortgage, he couldnt find a stable new job of the kind he had trained for, because all the oil and coal mining companies in the area were shutting down.
