description: 181 Range Road, Southport

title: Where Charlotte and Jane Meet
description: At the University of New Hampshire in the 1970s, John Pfordresher was teaching Wuthering Heights when he confessed to his students that he hadnt read Jane Eyre. One of them, Pfordresher told me, in a voice heavy with chastisement, informed me that Id better read Charlotte Bronts novel soon. I did, with astonishment. Four decades later, Pfordresher, now an English professor at Georgetown University, has published The Secret History of Jane Eyre: How Charlotte Bront Wrote Her Masterpiece.

title: The Pilot in the Cockpit? In Japan, He Might Be a Retiree
description: NAGASAKI, Japan  Shigekazu Miyazaki is spending what should have been his retirement 25,000 feet in the air.

title: Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston Preparing a New TV Series
description: Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston will star in and executive produce a television series about morning news shows and the New York media landscape, Stephen Huvane, a representative for Jennifer Aniston, said on Friday.

title: Watermelon Grows Up
description: My earliest watermelon memories have all taken place in or near water, I realized the other day.

title: How the Panama Papers Changed Pakistani Politics
description: The Pakistani Supreme Courts decision to dismiss Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was based on corruption accusations stemming from the Panama Papers, a trove of leaked documents from the Panamanian law firm Mossack Fonseca.

title: Private Equity Giant Lone Star Shakes Up North American Ranks
description: Lone Star Funds, a big private equity firm that specializes in buying up distressed assets  soured mortgages in particular  is undergoing a shake-up in the management of its North American operations.

title: Nancy L. Zimpher on Setting a Bold Vision
description: This interview with Nancy L. Zimpher, chancellor emeritus of the State University of New York (SUNY), was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: Charlie Gard Dies, Leaving a Legacy of Thorny Ethics Questions
description: LONDON  Charlie Gard, the incurably ill British infant who died on Friday, could not hear, see or even cry. But his case captured the attention of the pope and the United States president, and raised difficult ethical issues that reverberated around the world.

title: In New Condos, Art Is Now a Crucial Part of the Deal
description: At 50 Greenpoint, a new 44-unit condominium in Brooklyn, passers-by will find a surprise.

title: Queens High-Rises to Have Industrial Space Downstairs
description: A developer is proposing a project in Long Island City, Queens, that will offer something that has long been a no-no in New York: factories and apartments on the same site.

title: For $350 in Rent, a Tenant Becomes a Landlords Helper
description: Most bad-roommate stories end with someone moving out. Sometimes, its the meddlesome party who is exorcised, but more often than not, the reasonable roommate is the one who leaves, sacrificing his space, and sometimes his security deposit, to salvage his sanity. As far as happy endings go, relief is usually the extent of it.

title: One Dead in Knife Attack at German Supermarket
description: BERLIN  A man wielding a large knife fatally stabbed one person and wounded five others on Friday during an attack at a supermarket in Hamburg, Germany, the police said. The assailant was arrested as he tried to flee.

title: Gurneys Offers $2 Million Oceanfront Co-ops
description: In the latest sign that Montauk, N.Y., has gone upscale, Gurneys Montauk Resort & Seawater Spa has replaced 11 hotel rooms at the former Panoramic View with six oceanfront co-ops priced from $2.2 million to $2.8 million.

title: Mr. Anthony Scaramucci Esq.s Guide to Workplace Etiquette
description: To paraphrase Tolstoy, all happy workplaces are alike, but each unhappy workplace is uniquely unhappy. (Whither the Russian masters and their earthy, poetic wisdom?) As such, I, Anthony Scaramucci, a veteran of numerous offices, have deigned to jot down a few thoughts I have compiled over the years on how one should comport oneself in a workplace setting in order to maximize professionalism, courtesy and morale:

title: Diversity in Arts Groups
description: To the Editor:

title: More Students File Federal Aid Form Under New Rules
description: The number of students filing a crucial financial aid form has risen, suggesting that recent changes that have made it easier to file are working, a new analysis finds.

description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass.  The comedian Julie Klausner had a rocky start to her trip to Cape Cod as a guest of the Provincetown International Film Festival.

description: To the Editor:

title: Mervyn Rose, 7-Time Grand Slam Champion in Tennis, Dies at 87
description: Mervyn Rose, an Australian tennis player who won seven Grand Slam tournament titles in the 1950s and later coached champions like Billie Jean King and Margaret Smith Court, died on Sunday in Coffs Harbour, Australia. He was 87.

title: The Next Great Point Guard? Layshia Clarendon Makes Her Case
description: SEATTLE  During the W.N.B.A. off-season, Atlanta Dream point guard Layshia Clarendon was reading a  Sports Illustrated article about the United States womens basketball team that won the gold medal at the 2016 Olympics. She came across a passage about the star point guards on that team  Sue Bird and Lindsay Whalen  that surprised her.

title: Live Event: Discussing Data Protection at a New York Times CryptoParty
description: Welcome to Times Insider Events  live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.

title: Indias High Court Denies Abortion for 10-Year-Old Girl
description: NEW DELHI  The Supreme Court of India refused on Friday to allow an abortion for a 10-year-old girl who is at least 28 weeks pregnant. Indian law generally forbids abortions after the 20th week, though the courts may approve exceptions.

title: Health Care in Rwanda
description: To the Editor:

title: Fight Plastic Pollution
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Obamacare Is Still in Peril
description: In a dramatic last-minute spectacle, the latest Republican plan to destroy the Affordable Care Act was defeated early Friday because of the courageous votes of three senators: Susan Collins, John McCain and Lisa Murkowski. This will come as an immense relief to millions of Americans who stood to lose their health insurance, but it would be nave to think that this is the end of the road for the repeal-Obamacare movement.

title: Uzbekistan Reveals That Ex-Leaders Daughter Is in Custody
description: MOSCOW  The office of Uzbekistans prosecutor general confirmed Friday that Gulnara I. Karimova, the once-powerful daughter of the man who led Uzbekistan for more than two decades, was in state custody.

title: Queens Man Found Guilty of Hiring Gunman for Midtown Murder
description: A Queens man accused of hiring a hit man who carried out a brazen daytime killing on a Midtown Manhattan street more than four years ago was convicted on Friday of second-degree murder and other charges.

title: What to Do With the Kids This Summer? Put Em to Work
description: FREMONT, Neb.  Summer break 1985 was defined by my 4:30 a.m. alarm. The bus rolled up at 5, and my friends and I stumbled on, fighting off sleep until we arrived at the fields. Detasseling corn was a rite of passage in this Nebraska town: In order to cross-pollinate top-notch seed corn in those days, you needed people, lots of them, to walk through the fields to pull corn tassels manually from individual rows.

title: What Is Your Experience of Being L.G.B.T. in America?
description: The New York Times would like to hear from L.G.B.T. people about how their day-to-day experiences are affected by the state, city or town in which they live.

title: Summer Nights
description: Benefits to mark the opening of the Mostly Mozart Festival, the Olana State Historic Site and the Richard B. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts at Bard College.

title: Summer Nights
description: The opening night gala for Lincoln Centers Mostly Mozart Festival, in its 51st year, was held at the David Geffen Hall on July 25, and honored the award-winning Amazon Original show Mozart in the Jungle. The Olana Summer Party took place in Hudson, N.Y., on July 22, for the art organizations 50th anniversary. Also on July 22, the 2017 SummerScape Gala was held in Red Hook, N.Y, benefiting the Richard B. Fisher Center for the Performing Arts at Bard College. Dinner was followed by a raucous after-party staged by Susanne Bartsch.

title: Calls for Court Reform as Legal Guardians Abuse Older Adults
description: Terri Black had always planned to care for her widowed father in her home if he ever became too frail to care for himself. In June 2013, Mrs. Black, an only child, decided it was time: Her fathers longtime companion in Las Vegas had informed her that she could no longer handle his dementia, diabetes and other health issues, and asked the daughter to take him.

title: The Mind-Boggling Ascent of Amazon and Jeff Bezos
description: Amazon and its founder, Jeff Bezos, are having a moment.

title: 2 Psychologists in C.I.A. Interrogations Can Face Trial, Judge Rules
description: A federal court judge refused on Friday to drop a lawsuit against two psychologists who helped devise the C.I.A.s interrogation program after the Sept. 11 terrorist attacks, clearing the way for the case to proceed to a trial in September.

title: A Mobile Office for Farm-Based Dinners Travels the Country
description: Jim Denevan, Chief executive, Outstanding in the Field, Santa Cruz, Calif.

title: Books and Memories
description: Friends of the literary agent Ed Victor gathered in Manhattan to remember him.

title: One Last Party for the Agent and Bon Vivant Ed Victor
description: The memorial at the Upper East Side apartment of Tina Brown and Harold Evans for the literary agent Ed Victor felt like a cocktail party. And that was fitting, given that the man receiving tribute had distinguished himself as a bon vivant on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Trump Takes Aim at Pathetic Mayor. De Blasio Thinks He Knows Who He Means.
description: President Trump, in an address to law enforcement officers on Long Island on Friday, appeared to take a swipe at the elected leader of his hometown, Mayor Bill de Blasio.

title: Why The Times Published Scaramuccis Profanities
description: The Reader Center is a newsroom initiative that is helping The Times build deeper ties with our audience.

title: The Incredible Jessica James Is a Bold Woman in Progress
description: One of the best scenes in The Incredible Jessica James comes two-thirds of the way through the movie. Jessica, arguing with a guy shes sort of been seeing, delivers a kiss-off: Im freakin dope. That bold declaration not only represents a strong young woman but is also a gift for fans of the actress who plays her, Jessica Williams, the former Daily Show correspondent and current co-host of the 2 Dope Queens podcast.

title: Right and Left React to Skinny Repeal Defeat and Scaramuccis Interview
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: A Rare Victory for Science in an F.D.A. Move
description: The Food and Drug Administrations crackdown on cigarettes is a rare victory for science in the Trump era.

title: Reince Priebus Is Ousted Amid Stormy Days for White House
description: WASHINGTON  Reince Priebus, the White House chief of staff who failed to impose order on a chaos-racked West Wing, was pushed out on Friday after a stormy six-month tenure, and President Trump replaced him with John F. Kelly, the secretary of homeland security and retired four-star Marine general.

title: Rhythmic Bite: This Weeks 8 Best Classical Music Moments on YouTube
description: In addition to writing reviews, features and news during the week, our critics and reporters collect the best of what theyve heard: notes that sent shivers down their spines, memorable voices, quotations that cut to the heart of the story. This week, were offering a glimpse into the research weve done on YouTube for articles.

title: What Were Reading
description: New York Times reporters and editors are highlighting great stories from around the web. You can receive What Were reading by email, and let us know how you like it at wwr@nytimes.com.

title: At Troubled City College, Presidents Job Remains Unfilled
description: When the president of the City College of New York resigned unexpectedly in October during a financial scandal, the school quickly named an interim leader and said it planned to pick a replacement by the end of the academic year.

title: Open Thread: This Week in Style News
description: Each week, the Open Thread newsletter will offer a look from across The New York Times at the forces that shape the dress codes we share, with Vanessa Friedman as your personal shopper. The latest newsletter appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Why Outside Groups Arent Spending in the New York Mayors Race
description: Seven months ago, Mayor Bill de Blasios campaign had an ominous warning for supporters: Powerful forces had already spent $13 million against us in the election and were planning to pour more money into the race to ensure the mayor did not get a second term.

title: After 30 Hospitals in 2 Hours
description: The speaker of this poem might be someone as loony and lonely as Emily Dickinson. The fly in the second line has a Dickinsonian buzz. The speaker is enchanted, but I cant quite grasp the her here. Who is she? Who could be spoken of this way? Dont send mail to me explaining why it may or may not be a mother. In my not grasping it, I get to pretend her is a divinity or a devil or the earth or the speaker speaking of herself. Selected by Terrance Hayes

title: A Brief History of Emoji Art, All the Way to Hollywood
description: The Emoji Movie is the apotheosis of Hollywoods consumerist blockbuster trend, where the smartphone is recast as a playground, and tech companies spin their products into sparking baubles to sell to children. In the film, three emoji characters chase their dreams while sailing down Spotify streams, scaling a level of Candy Crush and ascending into the cloud through every childs most beloved app, Dropbox.

title: Starring Nebbishes and Noodges, Yiddish Cinema Makes a Comeback
description: A Yiddish-language feature made with nonprofessional actors on the streets of Brooklyn? Joshua Z. Weinsteins Menashe is not the product of a time machine but the belated rebirth of a venerable tradition.

title: Review: Daughters of Destiny on Netflix Explores Caste Struggles in India
description: The four-part Netflix documentary Daughters of Destiny is a celebration of a pioneering school for the children of Dalits, members of the lowest group in the oppressive caste system that still shapes Indian society. Much of it takes place in classrooms and dormitories. But its at its best when it leaves the school grounds and follows the children home, into a harsh and unchanging world whose realities seem hopelessly at odds with the ideals of the school.

title: Terrible, Thanks For Asking with Nora McInerny
description: Nora McInerny, a self-described notable widow, talks with another woman who recently lost her husband, and together they find humor in their grief.

title: Daniel Boulud to Close DBGB Kitchen and Bar Next Month
description: Daniel Boulud has announced that he will close his downtown brasserie-style restaurant, DBGB Kitchen and Bar, on Aug. 11. He said the eight-year-old restaurant was not doing enough consistent business throughout the week to justify keeping it open.

title: Senate, North Korea, Nawaz Sharif: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Taking the Pulse of the Near Threatened Platypus Is a Tricky Task
description: The platypus is legendarily weird.

title: Scaramucci Did Not Invent the Word Paranoiac
description: Among the various, unexpected bits of language that the new White House communications director used to describe the White House chief of staff at the time in an interview published on The New Yorker website on Thursday, one word faced charges of being not being real.

title: Monicas 3 Movies to Stream or Rent This Weekend
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Alabama May Be Trump Country, but Its Standing With Sessions
description: PAINT ROCK, Ala.  At a senior center here in the northeast corner of Alabama, one decree ordinarily rises above the rules of Rook and dominoes: No talking about politics or religion. But by late this week, after days of watching President Trump excoriate and belittle Attorney General Jeff Sessions, some seniors were ready to let the rule slide so they could defend an Alabamian.

title: Scientists Give a Chrysanthemum the Blues
description: A blue human is a cold, dead or sad human. We dont want to be blue. And flowers dont appear to, either.

title: Trump Makes Sanctions Against Russia Official
description: Even before he signed the bill, the Russian government retaliated by seizing two American diplomatic properties and ordering the United States to reduce its embassy staff members in Russia by 755 people.

title: In Boy Scouts Speech, Trump Hails and Puts Down Creator of Levittown
description: LEVITTOWN, N.Y.  It was an odd tangent in a speech to the Boy Scouts, unusual even by the standards of President Trump, when he spoke of spotting the once-mighty housing developer William Levitt at a celebrity-filled party in New York.

title: Europes Luxury Retailers May Be Returning to Form
description: LONDON  On Londons Bond Street, home to some of the most expensive retail space in the world, only one store needs to instigate crowd control, the luxury brand of the moment: the Italian fashion and accessories powerhouse Gucci.

title: Celebrating Two of Rocks Big Voices, Chester Bennington and Chris Cornell
description: The Popcast is hosted by Jon Caramanica, a pop music critic for The New York Times. It covers the latest in pop music criticism, trends and news.

title: Airport Checklist: Boarding Pass, ID, Stress
description: Air travel, once viewed as efficient, exclusive  even glamorous  now sometimes seems like a chore. The acidic exchange on Twitter recently between Ann Coulter and Delta Air Lines, which changed her seat assignment, was a fresh reminder of the tense and sometimes combative atmosphere at airports across the nation that has put both travelers and airline employees on edge.

title: Turkey Frees 7 Journalists, but Others Remain Behind Bars
description: ISTANBUL  A Turkish court ordered the release Friday of seven journalists of the opposition newspaper Cumhuriyet, but left the four most prominent editors and executives in jail, in a sign that the government remains determined to prosecute its most vociferous critics.

title: To Curb Violence, Start Time of Caribbean Festival Is Changed
description: In the city that never sleeps, will it be like moving the New Years Eve ball drop to noon?

title: Quotation of the Day: Resignations in Japan Reflect a Glass Ceiling Still Intact
description: We are put in these positions all the time where we have to play the feminist card and the feminine card at the same time.

title: Sharifs Resignation Comes as U.S. Debates How to Pressure Pakistan on Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON  In most countries where the United States has national security interests, the toppling of a prime minister would prompt hurried meetings in Washington and concern over how the change in government will affect American strategy in the region.

title: F.D.A. Delays Rules That Would Have Limited E-Cigarettes on Market
description: Electronic-cigarette makers won a major reprieve on Friday when the Food and Drug Administration delayed regulations that could have removed many of their products from the market and opened the door to endorsing e-cigarettes as a means to get smokers to quit.

title: A Trip to the Dentist Becomes the Latest Twist in Aaron Judges Eventful Season
description: For the most part, Aaron Judge has avoided the injury bug that has burdened the Yankees this summer. But on Friday, he did require some medical attention  from the dentist.

title: Susan Collins and Lisa Murkowski, the Health Vote Heroines
description: Were you expecting the Republican health care bill to go down with such a thud this week? Definitely a moment to remember. Unless, of course, you accept Donald Trumps interesting theory that it all worked out exactly the way he wanted.

title: Scaramuccis Vulgar Rant Spurs Newsroom Debate: Asterisks or No Asterisks?
description: I can probably say that word, but I just wont, the CNN host Don Lemon said on Thursday night, as he tangled with the obscenity-laced quotations that were displayed on screen.

title: A 73-Year-Old Man Is Severely Burned in Queens by an Exploding Container
description: A 73-year-old man was severely burned on Friday after he opened an oatmeal container that had been left at a home in Queens and it exploded, the police said.

title: Penn Station Repairs Are Halfway Done as Riders Adapt to New Routes
description: Emergency repair work on the tracks and switches at New Yorks Pennsylvania Station is more than halfway finished, with 12 of the 20 planned repairs completed, according to data from Amtrak in a report published on Friday.

title: Knicks Sign Ramon Sessions to Bolster Backcourt
description: Faced with the prospect of going into the season with a thin corps of inexperienced point guards, the Knicks came up with a modest solution on Friday, signing the 31-year-old veteran Ramon Sessions to a one-year, $2.33 million contract.

title: The Republican Women Behind the Vote
description: Senator John McCain shocked his party when he turned his thumb down and voted no to repeal the Affordable Care Act. But it was two staunch female Republican senators  Lisa Murkowski of Alaska and Susan Collins of Maine  who fought the Senate repeal from the start.

title: Pakistan, Ousting Leader, Dashes Hopes for Fuller Democracy
description: Pakistans latest ouster of an elected leader looks, at least on the surface, refreshingly democratic.

title: The No Guardrails Presidency
description: In 1993 The Wall Street Journal published a famous editorial called No Guardrails, which tried to locate the source of the moral chaos that had engulfed much of America. How, in T. S. Eliots phrase, did so many become undone? the editors wanted to know.

title: Behind Legislative Collapse: An Angry Vow Fizzles for Lack of a Viable Plan
description: WASHINGTON  The closing argument was a curious one: Vote yes, Republican leaders told the holdouts in their conference. We promise it will never become law.

title: John Kelly, New Chief of Staff, Is Seen as Beacon of Discipline
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump frequently referred to John F. Kelly as one of my generals, the three senior military leaders he recruited for his team. On Friday, Mr. Trump decided to see whether Mr. Kelly, a retired four-star Marine Corps general, could impose a new sense of discipline on an unruly and chaotic West Wing.

title: Trump, on Long Island, Vows an End to Gang Violence
description: BRENTWOOD, N.Y.  Hours after another defeat at the hands of the Republican-held Senate, President Trump launched into a speech about immigrant gang violence on Friday and wound up delivering a de facto campaign rally with a spray of Long Island police officers applauding behind him.

title: An Embattled White House Gets a General
description: On Friday, President Trump named John Kelly chief of staff, presumably to bring order to an increasingly dysfunctional White House. Mr. Kellys first and biggest challenge is to bring discipline to the president, since the chaos starts with him.

title: Trump to Sign Russia Sanctions Bill, White House Says
description: WASHINGTON  The White House said on Friday night that President Trump would sign legislation imposing sweeping sanctions against Russia and curtailing his own power to lift them by himself, bowing to the near-universal bipartisan will of Congress at the risk of escalating tension with Moscow.

title: One Lighting Up the Dance Floor
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Todays puzzle took me about twice as long as yesterdays. Your mileage may vary (YMMV, as the kids say), but I didnt have as many toeholds today. I knew the lower 15-letter entry (MAN TO MAN DEFENSE) but not the upper one (ESSENCE MAGAZINE), so the northern part of this grid was knottier. But thats the way the weekend goes.

title: Corrections: July 29, 2017
description: WEEKEND

title: Masahiro Tanaka, Flirting With Perfection, Leads Yankees to Victory
description: In the midst of a rather imperfect season, Masahiro Tanaka briefly flirted with perfection on Friday at Yankee Stadium.

title: Mets Acquire Closer A.J. Ramos From Marlins, Capping a Busy Day
description: SEATTLE  Two weeks before the Mets flurry of roster moves on Friday, Sandy Alderson, the teams general manager, outlined the teams road map. The Mets were not going to rebuild during this disappointing season, but rather pause to retool the roster.

title: Tracking the Roller Coaster Relationship of Reince Priebus and Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  Reince Priebus was ousted Friday as President Trumps chief of staff, after weeks of speculation about his status within the White House. His departure culminated in a very public display of a rivalry with the new White House communications director, Anthony Scaramucci.

title: The Day Nixon Began His Comeback
description: Richard Nixons triumphant march to the presidency began on July 29, 1967, along the shores of a small, wooded lake an hours drive north of San Francisco.

title: Life on Mars: Mirages of Earth
description: Six people are living in isolation for eight months on a volcano in Hawaii as part of a NASA-funded study to simulate human exploration of Mars. In the fifth episode of this 360-video series, experience the virtual environments the crew uses to relieve stress.

title: In New Orleans, a Tasteful Lodging in an Art Deco Gem
Reince Priebus Is Forced Out as Trumps Chief of Staff
description: Reince Priebus, who has served as President Trumps chief of staff for six months, has been pushed out of the White House. Michael D. Shear, a reporter for The New York Times, explains what this shake-up means.

title: In Pivotal Moment, Tesla Unveils Its First Mass-Market Sedan
description: FREMONT, Calif.  After a meteoric rise that made it, at least briefly, the most valuable car company in America, Tesla arrived at a moment of truth on Friday night as it delivered the first of its mass-market sedans to their new owners.

title: Artificial Intelligence Is Stuck. Heres How to Move It Forward.
description: Artificial Intelligence is colossally hyped these days, but the dirty little secret is that it still has a long, long way to go. Sure, A.I. systems have mastered an array of games, from chess and Go to Jeopardy and poker, but the technology continues to struggle in the real world. Robots fall over while opening doors, prototype driverless cars frequently need human intervention, and nobody has yet designed a machine that can read reliably at the level of a sixth grader, let alone a college student. Computers that can educate themselves  a mark of true intelligence  remain a dream.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Daughters of Destiny and Mad Max: Fury Road
description: Daughters of Destiny follows five girls from Indias lowest caste who are hoping to change their fates. And Mad Max: Fury Road might just be even better than watching Charlize Theron in Atomic Blonde.

title: Who Gets to Call the Game?
description: It was another early summer baseball game last year at Chicagos friendly confines, and in my expert opinion, the Cubs center fielder Dexter Fowler was playing too shallow. The newfangled analytics backed up my conclusion, and I could also draw on my playing days: having stood in the outfield in Wrigley Field, knowing the numbers can lie to you, especially given Wrigleys unpredictable ricochets, ivy-covered entanglements and temperamental weather extremes.

title: Polands Court Crisis Cools Off, but Its Far From Over
description: WARSAW  A 25-year-old psychologist, Anna Suchodolska joined the recent protests against the governments moves to place Polands courts under its thumb. She was relieved when the president unexpectedly vetoed the laws this week.

title: As Venezuela Prepares to Vote, Some Fear an End to Democracy
description: One by one, the markers of Venezuelas democracy have been pushed aside.

title: Good Example of Profanity Use: Stepping on a Lego Brick
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment. Some comments were edited for length and clarity.

title: Soccers El Clsico Comes to Miami. So Does the Circus.
description: MIAMI  An excitable, well-heeled crowd gathered in the Brickell City Centre shopping complex, camera phones poised.

title: Utility Helps Wean Vermonters From the Electric Grid
description: WALTHAM, Vt.  In a new low-income development that replaced a trailer park here, rooftop solar panels sparkle in the sun while backup batteries quietly hum away in utility closets.

title: Loss of Fertile Land Fuels Looming Crisis Across Africa
description: LAIKIPIA, Kenya  The two elders, wearing weather-beaten cowboy hats with the strings cinched under their chins, stood at the edge of an empty farm, covering their mouths in disbelief.

title: More Cruises for Millennials
description: Cruise lines have long been wooing millennial travelers with high-tech amenities like fast internet, thrilling shipboard adventures like skydiving, zip lines and demographically pitched late-night dance parties. Now one cruise company is making a fuller proposal by launching the first millennial-targeted cruise line.

title: Drag Queens, a Metal Head and a Lot of Cowboy Hats in Tijuana, Mexico
description: In May and June, Jake Michaels was in Tijuana, a city he has visited several times in the seven years since he first began driving down from Southern California to attend soccer matches with friends along the border. He set out to explore the themes of music, family and tradition in Mexican culture, employing the vibrantly painted buildings as backdrops.

title: A Doctor Gives Gwyneth Paltrows Goop an Examination
description: Dr. Jen Gunter, an obstetrician and gynecologist in the San Francisco Bay Area, didnt mean to pick on Goop, Gwyneth Paltrows lifestyle and wellness e-commerce company. In fact, shes a fan of Ms. Paltrows acting.

title: Alisyn Camerota, Formerly of Fox News, Has a Story to Tell
description: Amanda Gallo, the idealistic heroine of the new novel Amanda Wakes Up, is a morning anchor at FAIR News, a cable news network that brands itself as True and Equal, goes easy on right-wing provocateurs and mandates miniskirts and leg bronzer for its blond female hosts.

title: Keeping Up, on Camera, Is No Longer Just for the Kardashians
description: This spring, John Henry, a 24-year-old entrepreneur and the founder of a Harlem-based nonprofit, had a very strange first date. The woman he had taken to a SoHo restaurant seemed to know a suspicious amount about the places hed been in recent weeks and the conversations hed had. This, Mr. Henry slowly realized, was a byproduct of his recent decision to have a videographer film large swaths of his daily life: his work, travels, lunches and even subway commutes, which Mr. Henry had then posted on Facebook and Instagram.

title: For Jenny Allen, She and Her House Were Sort of in This Together
description: MARTHAS VINEYARD, Mass.  Not long after Jenny Allen left New York City to live full-time here, her once-sturdy farmhouse had a nervous breakdown. The pump to the well gave out, the water heater flooded the furnace, the pipes froze and an ancient tree crashed through the roof. It was 2013 and Ms. Allen, the journalist, humor writer and performer, had just separated from Jules Feiffer, the cartoonist and author to whom she had been married for 30 years, when the house began behaving like a kindergartner who had toughed it out all day at school only to have a meltdown at dismissal. You could see its collapse as a proxy for Ms. Allens own experience. It was like the house knew that someone was there to take care of it so it just went  Ms. Allen paused. It just went boing like a house in a cartoon.

title: Dear Sugars: How to Reclaim Vacation From Entitled Relatives
description: In a heated moment, a mother reveals a dark chapter from her childhood to her daughter, then immediately regrets it. What now? In this weeks episode, the Sugars tackle this and several other questions, including how to handle a brother-in-law who treats your vacation as his own free childcare; what to do when your best friends husband asks you to lie; and why we sometimes recoil at very public displays of grief.

title: After North Korea Test, South Korea Pushes to Build Up Its Own Missiles
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea announced Saturday that it will soon start talks with the Trump administration about allowing Seoul to build more powerful ballistic missiles to counter the North, but current and former American officials said the move would have little effect on the most urgent problem facing Washington: North Koreas apparent ability to strike California and beyond.

title: Apple Removes Apps From China Store That Help Internet Users Evade Censorship
description: HONG KONG  China appears to have received help on Saturday from an unlikely source in its fight against tools that help users evade its Great Firewall of internet censorship: Apple.

title: Burundians, Fleeing Political Violence, Find Welcome in Canada
description: OTTAWA  In the days since six Burundian students slipped away from a robotics competition in Washington, D.C.  with at least two of them making their way across the border to Canada  many have questioned what propelled the teenagers to avoid returning home.

title: Russias Villages, and Their Way of Life, Are Melting Away
description: BARUTA, Russia  With its winding dirt lanes framed by lilacs, quaint wooden houses and graceful onion-domed church, the tiny farming hamlet of Baruta was once a veritable postcard of Russian bucolic bliss.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: The End of the iPod, Plus Uber News
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Taking Risks, in Life and Love
description: Adria Natalia Armbrister and Glaymann Franck Makouangou were married July 28 at the Atlantis in Paradise Island, Bahamas. Pastor Melvin Grant, a licensed marriage officer of the Bahamas, officiated.

title: U.C. Irvine Rescinds Acceptances for Hundreds of Applicants
description: Just two months before they were to begin classes, 499 young men and women who had been accepted to the University of California, Irvine, received letters informing them that their acceptances had been rescinded.

title: Trump Tells G.O.P. Senators Not to Be Total Quitters on Health Bill
description: President Trump on Saturday scolded Congress for looking like fools and urged Republican senators not to be total quitters as he insisted that his push to overhaul the nations health care law remained viable, the day after it was rejected by the Senate.

title: Suspect in Hamburg Attack Was Known to German Police
description: BERLIN  The German police said Saturday that the 26-year-old man accused of killing one person and wounding five others with a knife in Hamburg was known to them as a recently radicalized Islamist, but that they did not believe he posed an imminent danger.

title: We Need a Radical New Approach on North Korea
description: With its latest provocation  a ballistic missile launch in the direction of Japan  North Korea is reminding Washington that its boast of having weapons capable of reaching the heart of the United States may not remain propaganda for much longer. The threat from Pyongyang should be one of President Trumps most urgent priorities.

title: Will a Landlord Accept an Out-of-State Guarantor?
description: Q. My friends and I are planning to move to New York City from Ohio. We are all aspiring opera singers, so our combined income is not adequate to qualify for an apartment. We have cash saved, but do not have jobs yet, so we dont have proof of employment. Instead, we plan to ask relatives to guarantee our lease. Do landlords accept guarantors who live outside the tristate area? If we have more than one guarantor, does each one have to earn enough to guarantee the entire lease, or will a landlord consider combined income?

title: For Female Baseball Reporter, Writing About, and Making, History
description: As the national baseball writer for The New York Times in the 1990s, Claire Smith became an ace at packing for two-week, six-city excursions. But preparing for the trip she will take this weekend to Cooperstown, N.Y., had her flustered.

title: When Cooperstown Almost Changed From Museum to Mausoleum
description: The plaque gallery at the Baseball Hall of Fame in Cooperstown is a place of reverence for fans, who can gaze at the bronze images of 312 players, managers, umpires and executives affixed to the walls.

title: Variety: Split Decisions
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Thanks to Fred Piscops dedication to the format, Split Decisions puzzles outlive their inventor, George Brederhorn. Theres not much to comment on because the splits that trip me up seem totally random. I think your brain randomly sees some correctly and some wrong. I have noticed that a stubborn knothole will suddenly reveal itself if you take a break from solving.

title: 2 From Baseballs Front Offices, Not Its Fields, Get a Cooperstown Moment
description: The Baseball Hall of Fame has held induction ceremonies in Cooperstown, N.Y., since 1939, when the first four classes were honored at once. Yet it has taken until now for two living executives to be inducted at the same time.

title: Ousted Pakistan Leader Passes Baton to Brother, Shehbaz Sharif
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  With his term as Pakistans prime minister cut short, and with his governing party facing critical national elections in less than a year, Nawaz Sharif announced publicly on Saturday that he was choosing his younger brother, Shehbaz Sharif, to be his long-term replacement as prime minister and as the partys standard bearer.

title: Renault Sport Gives Its Engineering Interns a Head Start
description: SILVERSTONE, England  In a Formula One season dominated by Ferrari and Mercedes, Renault Sport Racing is trying to make the leap from the ranks of the also-rans with unorthodox partnerships, new thinking in hiring and gambles on new technology.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Trump Tries to Regroup as the West Wing Battles Itself
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump enters a new phase of his presidency on Monday with a new chief of staff but an old set of challenges as he seeks to get back on course after enduring one of the worst weeks that any modern occupant of the Oval Office has experienced in his inaugural year in power.

title: How Schumer Held Democrats Together Through a Health Care Maelstrom
description: WASHINGTON  Over the past week, as Senate Republicans feverishly cobbled together their doomed health care bill, Chuck Schumer, the Democratic leader, made several quiet visits to the private hideaway office of John McCain, Republican of Arizona, near the Senate chamber on the Capitols first floor. Senator McCain, who recently received a brain cancer diagnosis, was nervous about the bill, which he thought would harm people in his state, and elegiac about members of his storied family, reminiscing about them at some length.

title: North Koreas Nuclear Arms Sustain Drive for Final Victory
description: A mystery has long surrounded North Koreas nuclear and missile programs.

title: If Americans Love Moms, Why Do We Let Them Die?
description: HOUSTON  We love mothers, or at least we say we do, and we claim that motherhood is as American as apple pie.

title: A Threat to Nuclear Arms Control
description: A quarter-century after the end of the Cold War, the United States and Russia still possess thousands of nuclear weapons. Even so, some administration officials and members of Congress are pushing wasteful and dangerous plans to expand the numbers and capabilities of those weapons, threatening a web of arms control agreements that have ensured the stability of Russian and American arsenals that contain fully 90 percent of the worlds 15,000 nuclear weapons.

title: The Empty Majority
description: When we think about the ebb and flow of majorities in American politics, we like to imagine that there is a clear link between politics and policy  between gaining power and having an agenda to implement, between winning votes and responding to substantive challenges, between F.D.Rs majorities and his New Deal or Reagans victories and his Reaganomics.

title: Voters Love Lesbians
description: Like other minorities, L.G.B.T. people are seriously underrepresented in our countrys political offices.

title: President Trumps Really Weak Week
description: WASHINGTON  Donald Trump was promising to destroy a vile criminal cartel.

title: We Asked People to Say Something Nice About Trump. Heres What We Heard.
description: Yes, its true that Hillary Clinton got more votes, but he got the votes of more than 62 million people  and I am pretty sure I dont know any of them. You can make a rude joke about Donald Trump in places like Washington and the Upper West Side of Manhattan, and be confident that nothing you say will give offense.

title: Mr. McCain and The Mooch
description: Anthony Scaramucci, the new White House communications director, likes to talk about the sense of responsibility and privilege he feels in his role near the apex of American public life. Im here to serve the country, he declared at one particularly laughable moment during his pornographic rant last week to The New Yorker, in which he assaulted his own colleagues, threatening to fire some of them and unleash the F.B.I. on others.

title: From Voyeur to Friend
description: VALERIE MONROE They have floor-to-ceiling windows, my neighbors across the street, and they seldom use their shades. My apartment is a couple of floors up and a wide street away. Not so wide that I cant see many of the details inside their home. Several years ago, I watched them move in: a petite blond woman about my age and her husband.

title: Empathy Gadgets
description: The device slipped over my arm like a blood pressure cuff. Eight domino-size electrodes were pressed against my skin. I heard a series of beeps and felt a small electrical pulse, like a pinprick. Then, before I knew it, my arm was quivering like a bowl of gelatin.

title: Man Is Charged After Girl Reports Being Raped Twice in One Night
description: One man was charged and the police were looking for a second suspect after a 14-year-old girl in Birmingham, England, reported that she had been raped in two separate attacks on the same night, the British Transport Police said on Sunday.

title: The Scars From Bell-Ringing Football Tackles
description: As tens of thousands of football players, from professionals to peewee league children, head to summer training camps across the nation, there is new and compelling evidence linking the games head-snapping tackles to the degenerative brain diseases suffered in the declining years of men who played the game.

title: Want Teenage Boys to Read? Easy. Give Them Books About Sex.
description: What interests teenage boys? Youre smirking, but this is a question that occupies many of us in the field of young peoples literature. Its well-documented that girls are reading more than boys, a statistic of increasing concern.

title: How We Make Black Girls Grow Up Too Fast
description: It was over a plate of ribs at my aunts dining room table when I learned that being a woman is about what men are allowed to do to you. I was 15 years old. Mike Tyson was the most famous boxer in the world.

title: Conservatives and Health Care
description: To the Editor:

title: When Life on Earth Was Nearly Extinguished
description: It has been called the Great Dying.

title: White Economic Privilege Is Alive and Well
description: Is the white working class losing economic ground because of policies intended to improve the lives of black people? Anxiety and resentment among some white voters about those policies certainly seemed to benefit Donald Trumps campaign last year, with its populist, ethno-nationalist message.

title: By Design
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Woohoo! Im blogging a celebrity constructor, Isaac Mizrahi. This is a special collaboration between Mr. Mizrahi, the New York designer, and the veteran crossword constructor David J. Kahn to commemorate the 75th anniversary of The New York Times Crossword

title: How to Repair the Health Law (Its Tricky but Not Impossible)
description: Republicans have failed to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act. Now, can it be repaired?

title: Yankees, After More Brett Gardner Heroics, Celebrate With Care
description: Aaron Judge slowly circled his Yankee teammates on Saturday, looking uncertain about joining the crowd that had gathered around Brett Gardner. Remembering the dental damage from a similar celebration, Judge covered his mouth as he finally entered a sea of high-fives and a shower of sunflower seeds to congratulate Gardner on his second game-ending hit in three days.

title: Quotation of the Day: Disappearance of Fertile Land Fuels Looming Crisis in Africa
description: We know taking another mans land is like taking his wife.

title: Police Criticize Trump for Urging Officers Not to Be Too Nice With Suspects
description: President Trumps admonition that the police should not be too nice while transporting suspects drew laughter and cheers from a crowd of officers on Friday, but police officials swiftly made it clear they did not find the words funny.

title: Claire Smith, a Pioneer in Sports Writing, Is Honored at Cooperstown
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  Claire Smith was at the forefront of a velvet revolution in sports writing, a soft-spoken woman who did not knock down clubhouse doors so much as righteously persist and stand until they opened.

title: With the Trade Deadline Near, the Mets Joke and Lose
description: SEATTLE  The uncertainty of these final days before the nonwaiver trade deadline on Monday can elicit a range of reactions. Addison Reed, the Mets closer who has been traded twice in his career and can see the writing on the wall by now, has handled the situation with both levity and earnestness.

title: Corrections: July 30, 2017
description: METROPOLITAN

title: Introducing The New Washington
description: In President Trumps Washington, cabinet secretaries and political aides have become household names. We know their nicknames. We know their rivalries. But we dont really know them, or their motivations.

title: Stacey Maldonado, Michael-Sean Spence
description: Stacey Elizabeth Maldonado and Michael-Sean Spence were married July 29 at Westbury Manor, an event space in Westbury, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Calvin O. Butts, the pastor of Abyssinian Baptist Church in Manhattan, officiated.

title: Olivia Fleming, Matthew Rubin
description: Olivia Kane Fleming and Matthew William Rubin were married July 29 at Hayfield, a private estate in Maplecrest, N.Y. Brad Johnsmeyer, a friend of the groom, became a Universal Life minister to officiate.

title: Casey Pallenik, Bradford Simmons
description: Catherine Elizabeth Pallenik and Bradford Alden Simmons were married July 29 at the Oaks Waterfront Inn in Easton, Md. The Rev. Stephanie Nagley, an Episcopal priest, officiated.

title: Caroline Fiore, Joseph Cardillo
description: Caroline Elizabeth Fiore and Joseph Pollara Cardillo were married July 28 at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Patrick in Brooklyn. The Rev. Gregory McIlhenney performed the ceremony.

title: Xochitl Cubero, David Renteln
description: Xochitl Isabel Cubero and David Alexander Renteln are to be married July 30 at the Athenaeum, the faculty club at the California Institute of Technology in Pasadena. Philip Mezey, a friend of the couple who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, is to officiate.

title: Rosalie Love, Mark Weng
description: Rosalie Elizabeth Love and Dr. Mark K. Weng were married July 26 in Decatur, Ga. Matthew J. McCoyd, a magistrate judge, officiated at the DeKalb County Courthouse. Earlier this month, the couple had a ceremony at the Wilobe Farm Barn, an events space in Pidley, England, that was led by Leigh Chambers, a humanist celebrant, and that included elements of a traditional Chinese wedding.

title: Rachel Zestar-Postrk, Joseph Carvalho
description: Rachel Maria Zestar-Postrk, a daughter of Hellena M. Postrk and Lawrence P. Zestar of Lafayette, Calif., was married July 29 to Joseph Alexander Carvalho, the son of Sherri Houston Carvalho and Alcides Carvalho of Rock Hill, S.C. Edward G. Postrk, an uncle of the bride who became a Universal Life minister for this event, officiated at Madrona Manor, a hotel in Healdsburg, Calif.

title: Mark Robertson, Derek Zasky
description: Mark Allen Robertson and Derek Spencer Zasky were married July 29 at the Roxbury Barn and Estate in Roxbury, N.Y. The Rev. Laurie M. McNeill, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Francine Rubin, Pierre-Franois Quet
description: Francine Rachel Rubin and Pierre-Franois Damien Quet were married July 29 at Manhattanville College in Purchase, N.Y. Frederick Salanitro, the town justice of Eastchester, N.Y., officiated at Reid Castle.

title: Shannon Vonk, Kevin Foote
description: Shannon April Vonk and Kevin Mackenzie Foote were married July 29 at Blessed Sacrament Roman Catholic Church in Bolton Landing, N.Y. The Very Rev. Kevin J. Mullen performed the ceremony.

title: Deborah Theodore, Daniel Seltzer
description: Dr. Deborah Anne Theodore and Daniel Lewis Seltzer were married July 29 at Wave Hill, a public garden and cultural center in the Bronx. Sarah Seltzer, the grooms twin sister, who became a Universal Life minister for the occasion, officiated.

title: Abigail Coster, Alejo Cabranes
description: Abigail Flynn Coster, a daughter of Sarah Grygiel Coster and Dr. Jeffrey S. Coster of Clifton, Va., was married July 25 to Alejo Richard Stith Cabranes, a son of Kate Stith and Judge Jos A. Cabranes of Bethany, Conn. Jesse M. Furman, a judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, officiated in his chambers at the Thurgood Marshall United States Court House in New York. On Aug. 5, Alex J. Konik, a friend of both from law school, is to lead the couple in their vows at the Salamander Resort in Middleburg, Va.

title: Bethany Arazoza, Leonard Fishman
description: Bethany Arazoza and Leonard Fishman were married July 29 at Oak Hill Country Club in Rochester. Cybele Fishman, the groom's sister, who was ordained by the Church of Spiritual Humanism for the occasion, officiated.

title: Katharine Orf, Jamie Waldegrave
description: Dr. Katharine Mallory Orf and James Victor Waldegrave were married July 29 in Dornoch, Scotland. The Rev. Susan Brown, a minister of the Church of Scotland, performed the ceremony at Dornoch Cathedral, where she is the minister.

title: Anneke Green, Becket Adams
description: Anneke Esther Green and Thomas Becket Adams were married July 24 in Washington,. The Rev. Stuart McAlpine, an interdenominational minister, performed the ceremony at Christ Our Shepherd Church.

title: Courtney Cox, Ryan Gisriel
description: Courtney Mary Cox and Ryan Charles Thomas Gisriel were married July 29 at Holy Family Catholic Church in Chicago. The Rev. Charles Reichenbacher, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony.

title: Elizabeth LaGiusa, Seth Peskin
description: Elizabeth Ann LaGiusa and Seth Adam Peskin were married July 29 in West Orange, N.J. Rabbi Stuart Berman officiated at the Manor, an events space, with the Rev. Dominick Cutrone, a Roman Catholic priest, assisting.

title: Deanna Howes, Peter Spiro
description: Deanna Isabelle Howes and Peter Michael Spiro were married July 29 at the Roman Catholic Cathedral of St. Matthew the Apostle in Washington. The Rev. Michael J. Sheeran performed the ceremony, with the Most Rev. Gintaras L. Grusas, the archbishop of Vilnius, Lithuania, taking part.

title: Nina Lesavoy, Charles Brady
description: Nina Lesavoy and Charles William Brady were married July 24. The Rev. Dr. Bruce B. Lawrence, an Episcopal priest, officiated in the grooms apartment in New York.

title: Abby Zielinski, Jeffrey Brown
description: Abby Kathryn Zielinski and Jeffrey William Brown were married July 29 at their own home in Philadelphia under a provision of Pennsylvania law allowing self-uniting marriages. On Aug. 4 the couple is to take part in a ceremony led by Matthew Zielinski, a cousin of the bride, at Villa Le Fontanelle in Florence, Italy.

title: Katharine Enna, Adam Hobson
description: Katharine Anne Enna and Adam Sloan Hobson were married July 29. The Rev. Robert A. Rost performed the ceremony at the Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church in Kansas City, Mo.

title: Allison Greenberg, Michael Melnitzky
description: Allison Stacy Greenberg and Michael Besobrasow Melnitzky were married July 29 at Maritime Parc, a restaurant and event space in Jersey City. Cantor Charles D. Romalis officiated.

title: Clay Floren, Andrew Elmets
description: Clay Lander Floren and Andrew Koehler Elmets were married July 24 at the Manhattan Marriage Bureau. Angel L. Lopez, a staff member in the New York City Clerks Office, officiated. On Aug. 5, Melissa Floren Filippone, a sister of Mr. Floren, is to lead the couple in their vows at the Palcio de Seteais, a hotel in Sintra, Portugal.

title: Kristen Bellstrom, J.L. Novosad
description: Kristen Lee Bellstrom and J. L. Novosad were married July 29 at the Four Columns Inn in Newfane, Vt. The Rev. Tom Hall, a United Church of Christ minister and the grooms stepfather, officiated.

title: Jamie Farnsworth, Andrew Finn
description: Jamie Lynn Farnsworth and Andrew John Finn were married July 29. The Rev. Jerry L. Hancock, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at the Edgewater, a hotel in Madison, Wis.

title: Olubimpe Ayeni, Adetokunbo Ajayi
description: Dr. Olubimpe Adediwura Ayeni and Adetokunbo Jackson Ajayi were married July 29 at the Knox College Chapel in Toronto. The Rev. Dr. Sarah Travis, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

title: Leslie Lugo, Mark MacKeigan
description: Leslie Allan Lugo and John Mark MacKeigan were married July 29 at Birks Heritage Chapel at McGill University in Montreal. The Rev. Rosemary Lambie, a United Church of Canada minister, performed the ceremony.

title: Melody McCloskey, Charles Ebersol
description: Melody Brooke McCloskey and Charles Duncan Ebersol were married July 29 at Blackberry Farm in Walland, Tenn.

title: Carr Holland, Maxwell Mundy
description: The Rev. Jule Carr Holland III and Dr. Thomas Maxwell Mundy are to be married July 30 at the Siasconset Union Chapel in Siasconset, Mass., on Nantucket. The Rev. J. Cooper Conway, an Episcopal priest, is to perform the ceremony.

title: Megan Cahn, Mac Glovinsky
description: Megan Elizabeth Cahn and Mac Alexander Glovinsky were married on July 29 at the Farmhouse by the Sea, an events space in Matunuck, R.I. Richard F. Gallagher, the grooms maternal grandfather and a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Lydia Wright, William Most
description: Lydia Anne Wright and William Brock Most are to be married July 30 on Marrowstone Island in Washington State. The grooms brothers, James R. Most and Alexander N. Most, who both joined the American Marriage Ministries, will take part in the ceremony with James R. Most officiating, at the home of the brides grandparents Joan Anliker and William L. Anliker of Nordland, Wash.

title: Sardius Chen, Channing Verbeck Jr.
description: Dr. Sardius Chen and Channing Pierce Verbeck Jr. were married July 29 at the Greystone Mansion in Beverly Hills, Calif. Eduard Einstein, a friend of the couple who became a minister with American Marriage Ministries for the occasion, officiated.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: The Ghost Writer and A Little Chaos
description: Is your government getting you down? Try Roman Polanskis escapist version with its real estate porn. Or swoon with a couple of royal bodice-rippers starring Alan Rickman, Matthias Schoenaerts and Mads Mikkelsen.

title: Australia Tightens Airport Security, Saying Police Foiled Bomb Plot
description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Australian authorities tightened security at airports across the country on Sunday after disrupting what they described as an elaborate plan to detonate a bomb on a plane.

title: Sydneys Original Infinity Pools
description: Take a 360-degree dip in some of the more than 100 ocean baths and rock pools in New South Wales, Australia.

title: A Pentagon Correspondent Keeps Sight of the Person Inside the Uniform
description: In the time that Ive been covering the American military, I have fought the urge to vomit during a catapult takeoff from an aircraft carrier in the Persian Gulf, convinced myself that I was dying of blood loss when the Humvee I was in was run over by a tank in Iraq, and battled nerves and stomach heaves from an ejection seat of a B-1 bomber, wondering what the heck I thought I was doing 27,000 feet in the air.

title: Imran Khan, Strongest Contender to Lead Pakistan, Is No Shoo-In
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  In 1992, when Pakistan won its only Cricket World Cup, Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif was asked by a television host if the team captain, Imran Khan, a national heartthrob, would be right for his party if Mr. Khan went into politics.

title: Global News Quiz: Russia Sanctions, North Korea Milestone, Pakistan Change, Iran Partner
description: Did you stay on top of the most important stories last week? Test your knowledge of international events with our quick quiz, recapping major news headlines and featured articles from across the globe. To take the quiz, click on an answer, and the correct response will be revealed after you choose.

title: Philippine Mayor Accused of Drug Ties by Duterte Dies in Police Raid
description: MANILA  A mayor who had been accused by President Rodrigo Duterte of involvement in drug trafficking was killed along with his wife and 10 other people in coordinated police raids early Sunday, the authorities said.

title: Scaramucci, Priebus, Nawaz Sharif: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: In China, Designer Goods Delivered to Your Doorstep
description: BEIJING  In China, legions of delivery personnel power the worlds largest e-commerce boom. Known for their careening three-wheeled carts, they terrorize pedestrians and sometimes dump their packages on doorsteps and desks with the delicacy of a restaurant employee tossing out yesterdays leftovers.

title: In a Rohingya Refugee Camp, Soccer Is a Joyful Escape
description: COXS BAZAR, Bangladesh  Mohammed Ismail prickled with adrenaline.

title: Their Identities Denied, Afghan Women Ask, Where Is My Name?
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  These are some of the terms Afghan men use to refer to their wives in public instead of their names, the sharing of which they see as a grave dishonor worthy of violence: Mother of Children, My Household, My Weak One or sometimes, in far corners, My Goat or My Chicken.

title: China Shows Off Military Might as Xi Jinping Tries to Cement Power
description: BEIJING  Chinas president, Xi Jinping, has opened a public campaign to deepen his grip on power in a coming leadership shake-up, using a huge military parade on Sunday, speeches and propaganda, along with a purge in the past week, to warn officials to back him as the nations most powerful leader in two decades.

title: Car Bomb Kills at Least 6 and Injures 13 Others in Mogadishu
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia  A car bomb exploded near a police station in Somalias capital, Mogadishu, on Sunday, killing at least six people and wounding at least 13 others, according to a police captain.

title: Russia Showcases Global Ambitions With Military Parades, One in Syria
description: MOSCOW  Russias global military ambition was on display Sunday when the country celebrated Navy Day with large military parades not only in St. Petersburg, but also off the coast of Syria.

title: Food From Around the World, Homegrown in New York
description: Efrain Estrada grows so many peppers, eggplants, okra and squash that he sends the extras to his relatives in Puerto Rico.

title: Yankees Acquire Starter Jaime Garcia From Twins, Then Lose to Rays
description: A year ago at the nonwaiver trade deadline, the Yankees began dismantling an aging, overpaid and underproductive roster in favor of a rebuilding program that was expected to take at least two years.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. You know what would be a cool thing to make today? This chicken wrapped in an all-butter pie crust situation that Julia Moskin picked up from the Boston chef Barbara Lynch a few months ago. Its not difficult! You just make and roll out a big sheet of pie dough, wrap it around a chicken youve stuffed with sauted vegetables, and bake it on a sheet pan for an hour. Let it rest for a couple of hours and serve. Crisp pastry, juicy chicken, super fragrant vegetables  thats a nice Sunday dinner, no?

title: Big Rigs, a Human Smuggling Mainstay, Often Become Rolling Traps
description: SAN ANTONIO  In one truck, the migrants crouched in the dark in a three-foot crevice between the trailers ceiling and the top of medical-supply boxes. In another, smugglers crammed 73 men, women and children into a trailer filled with rotting watermelons, to try to disguise their scent for Border Patrol dogs.

title: When an Artist Calls the Shots: Mark Grotjahns Soaring Prices
description: Sitting in his expansive studio in the Echo Park section of Los Angeles last year, the abstract painter Mark Grotjahn refused to answer questions about the way he does business. More recently, he declined several requests to discuss his success  namely the auction high of $16.8 million set this spring at Christies (more than double Mr. Grotjahns top price to date, $6.9 million in 2010).

title: Sunday Times of London Fires Writer Over Article Called Anti-Semitic
description: DUBLIN  The Sunday Times of London has fired the writer of an op-ed article denouncing the campaign by women of the British Broadcasting Corporation for equal pay after the column sparked widespread accusations that it was anti-Semitic and misogynistic.

title: Free Lunch at the Library
description: ELMWOOD PLACE, Ohio  Before opening their doors at noon, the librarians squeeze tables and chairs between the book stacks to prepare for the onslaught of hungry children. Usually, two or three dozen show up, but occasionally, up to 70 do.

title: Childrens Books Missed These Immigrant Stories. So Students Wrote Them.
description: Greatness surrounds Melissa Cabrera when she attends classes at Bronx Community College. That should not be surprising, because the campus is home to the Hall of Fame for Great Americans, where busts of scientists, scholars and statesmen, among others, line a grand colonnade that wraps around Gould Memorial Library, an architectural treasure designed by Stanford White.

title: In a U.F.C. Classic, Great Loses Out to Greatest
description: On Saturday night in Anaheim, Calif., the Ultimate Fighting Championship belt  thick, black leather, covered in golden plates studded with diamonds  was wrapped around the beleaguered former U.F.C. light-heavyweight champion Jon Joness waist for the first time in two and a half years. And then Jones collapsed to his knees with emotion.

title: Jersey Shore Towns Scramble for Revenue as Sandy Aid Dries Up
description: TOMS RIVER, N.J.  The streets of Ortley Beach here were once considered ground zero for the destruction from Hurricane Sandy in 2012, with houses and debris strewn about for months. Today, vacant lots still dot the blocks, but they are outnumbered by new homes and a beach as crowded as ever.

title: A New Way for Therapists to Get Inside Heads: Virtual Reality
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Dawn Jewell recently treated a patient haunted by a car crash. The patient had developed acute anxiety over the cross streets where the crash occurred, unable to drive a route that carried so many painful memories.

title: Putin, Responding to Sanctions, Orders U.S. to Cut Diplomatic Staff by 755
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin announced Sunday that the American diplomatic mission in Russia must reduce its staff by 755 employees, an aggressive response to new American sanctions that seemed ripped right from the Cold War playbook and sure to increase tensions between the two capitals.

title: MTV Mines the Past for Its Future: Total Request Live
description: On a recent Wednesday afternoon, Chris McCarthy, the newish president of MTV, was standing at a corner of 44th Street and Broadway and gazing up at the second floor of Viacoms Manhattan headquarters.

title: Jury to Decide: Were Shkrelis Gambles to Save His Drug Company Criminal?
description: Martin Shkreli had bounced back from failure before. But over a few weeks in December 2012, it looked as if he might lose everything for good.

title: Apple Removes Apps From China Store That Help Internet Users Evade Censorship
description: HONG KONG  Software made by foreign companies to help Chinese users skirt the countrys system of internet filters has vanished from Apples app store on the mainland.

title: D.L. Menard, the Cajun Hank Williams, Is Dead at 85
description: D. L. Menard, the Cajun singer and songwriter who wrote The Back Door, a ubiquitous bayou standard, died on Thursday at his granddaughters home in Scott, La. He was 85.

title: More New Yorkers Opting for Life in the Bike Lane
description: On one of Brooklyns busier commuter streets, bicycles now outnumber cars.

title: Republicans Worry That White House Disarray Is Undermining Trump
description: President Trump and Republicans in Washington have shaken the confidence of their supporters after a punishing and self-inflicted series of setbacks that have angered activists, left allies slack-jawed and reopened old fissures on the right.

title: Miami Arts Centers Windfall Brings a New Leader and Expansion Plans
description: Call it an art world Cinderella moment. ArtCenter/South Florida, a scrappy nonprofit in Miami Beach, has long been overshadowed by the areas newer cultural arrivals; its founding mission of providing affordable artist studios is nowhere near as fancy as starting a museum or partying at the annual Art Basel Miami Beach fair.

title: Thousands Evacuate Outer Banks After Power Outage
description: Thousands of people were evacuated from Hatteras and Ocracoke Islands in North Carolinas Outer Banks after a construction mishap damaged the areas main power line, plunging the islands into darkness and shutting off air-conditioners.

title: The Emoji Movie Starts Strong as Dunkirk Stays at No. 1
description: LOS ANGELES  The disconnect between Hollywoods taste and that of the masses has rarely been more sharply drawn as it was over the weekend, as the stylish Atomic Blonde sputtered and The Emoji Movie pushed past horrified critics to become a box office success.

title: Scott Vestal Wins Steve Martin Banjo Prize
description: Scott Vestal received the Steve Martin Prize for Excellence in Banjo and Bluegrass on Saturday night in a surprise ceremony at the 45th annual RockyGrass Festival in Lyons, Colo.

title: Russia, Nawaz Sharif, North Korea: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Heritage On Health, 1989
description: Every once in a while people make the point that much of what eventually became Obamacare came from, of all places, the Heritage Foundation  that is, the ACA is basically what conservatives used to advocate on health care. So I recently reread Stuart Butlers 1989 Heritage Foundation lecture, Assuring Affordable Health Care For All Americans  hmm, where have I seen similar language?  to see how true that is; and the answer is, it really is pretty much true.

title: Israel Court Rejects Appeal for Elor Azaria, Soldier Who Shot Wounded Assailant
description: JERUSALEM  When an Israeli soldier fired a single shot through the window of a home in a West Bank settlement this month, wounding a Palestinian assailant and putting an end to a stabbing rampage that killed three people, many Israelis hailed the soldier as a hero.

title: Trump Is Wrong if He Thinks Symphonies Are Superior
description: We write symphonies, President Trump proclaimed on July 6 during a speech in Warsaw.

title: David E.H. Jones, Scientist Whose Alter Ego Challenged Conventions, Dies at 79
description: In Greek mythology, Daedalus was a cunning craftsman who occasionally outsmarted himself. The labyrinth he designed to contain the bovine Minotaur was so disorienting that even Daedalus got lost. He fashioned waxed wings that enabled him and his son, Icarus, to flee Crete, but Icarus drowned when the wax melted as he defiantly overreached and soared too close to the blazing sun.

title: The Cold War Meets Romeo and Juliet at a Festival for Musicals
description: A few minutes into A Wall Apart, during the propulsive opening number, I noticed something that hadnt happened at either of the other shows I saw over the weekend at the New York Musical Festival: My leg was moving in time to the beat.

title: Heng on China and Indias Dolam Standoff
description: China and India, two nuclear-armed nations, have come near the brink of conflict over a contested region in the Himalayas at the point where Bhutan, China and India meet. The standoff began in June after Chinese troops began working to extend a road through the Dolam Plateau. It is one of the worst border disputes between the countries in more than 30 years.

title: Venezuela Vote Marred by Violence, Including Candidates Death
description: BOGOT, Colombia  The legitimacy of Sundays election to overhaul Venezuelas Constitution was under threat as many voters avoided the ballot box, nations across the region rejected the predetermined result and the streets erupted in the deadliest day of unrest in three months.

title: Ubers Search for New C.E.O. Hampered by Deep Split on Board
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Some members of Ubers eight-person board were excited about the idea of Meg Whitman becoming the ride-hailing companys next chief executive.

title: No, Its Not Too Late. Theres Only One Real Finish Line in Life.
description: Welcome to the Smarter Living newsletter. Editor Tim Herrera emails readers once a week with tips and advice for living a better, more fulfilling life. Sign up here to get it in your inbox every Monday morning.

title: Hacks and Leaks Pose New Challenges for Journalists. Next Up: Germany.
description: BERLIN  To come here as an American on the eve of Germanys next national political campaign is to go back in time to our own recent past, before the hacks and the (Wiki)leaks led to the paralyzing debate over whether Russia intervened in our presidential election.

title: Hot Spot for Tech Outsourcing: The United States
description: For years, American companies have been saving money by offshoring jobs  hiring people in India and other distant cubicle farms.

title: Consumers May Be More Trusting of Ads Than Marketers Think
description: The early results from a recent study that Kent Grayson, a Northwestern University marketing professor, did on consumer skepticism left him feeling a little, well, skeptical.

title: Mix a Carwash With Some Corn for a Touch of El Salvador in Queens
description: Its not every day you see a cornfield next to a carwash in New York City.

title: For Baby Boomers, Dismay, and Opportunity
description: To the Editor:

title: The Bail System and Its Injustices
description: To the Editor:

title: Justice for Terror Suspect
description: To the Editor:

title: Hawaiis Nuclear Defense
description: To the Editor:

title: Seat-Free Subway Cars?
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Frank Ocean Transmits Intimacy on a Grand Scale
description: There were times Friday night when Frank Ocean was on stage kneeling or squatting, meaning that to the overwhelming majority of the many thousands of fans watching him on the grass on Randalls Island, he became a speck, if that. During these stretches, though, on the huge screen behind him, he was often shown in full, his hunched figure taking up almost the whole view  a man in contemplative pose, a man curling into himself for protection, a man trapped in a box.

title: Review: Siesta Key Returns to Reality Televisions Awkward Youth
description: The shift from Laguna Beach: The Real Orange County to The Hills was the most portentous of the reality-show era. What began in 2004 as a sun-kissed, sometimes-bumbling lark finished in 2010 as a neo-romantic, industrial-smooth juggernaut. Teenagers who predated the constant self-broadcasting of the social-media era rapidly became television stars, doing their best to play the roles of teenagers who did not know they were being filmed. The genre had gone sentient. It would never look back.

title: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: Reading With Patrick
description: Michelle Kuo, the daughter of Taiwanese immigrants, was an avid young reader, and writes in her new memoir that she felt summoned when she read these words from the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr.: So the question is not whether we will be extremists, but what kind of extremists we will be.

title: Womens Business Success
description: To the Editor:

title: Bamboo-Eating Bear
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  David Steinberg lived in the Seattle area for a while and today he visits the old place and gives us all a tour.

title: Remembering Nana
description: Dear Diary:

title: Sage Advice From the Gold Standard of White House Chiefs of Staff
description: WASHINGTON  When a new White House chief of staff takes over, the smart ones check in with James A. Baker III, the only man to have occupied the office two different times for two different presidents and who is widely considered to be the gold standard.

title: Owners of D.C. United Soccer Team Are Said to Consider Selling
description: The owners of D.C. United, Washingtons Major League Soccer team, are quietly weighing a sale of the franchise, people briefed on the discussions said on Sunday.

title: Top European Banks Will Report Earnings, and U.S. Job Figures Are Due
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: For Perhaps the Last Time, the Royals Are Going for It All, Together
description: BOSTON  Mike Moustakas was out of the Kansas City Royals lineup Sunday, on the eve of the nonwaiver trading deadline. Under different circumstances, this might have been alarming. Moustakas is approaching free agency, and his breakout season  including 30 home runs so far  will most likely price him out of the Royals range.

title: Shipwreck in the Arctic
description: To the Editor:

title: Tim Raines Is Enshrined as an Expo, and Hes Happy About It
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  Over the weekend here, it was as if the 1994 baseball season had never ended abruptly with a players strike that began Aug. 12, when the Montreal Expos owned the best record in the game. Or as if a new, privately financed stadium had magically been built in Montreal, allowing the Expos to remain in Canada instead of relocating to Washington after the 2004 season and becoming the Nationals.

title: Queens Man Badly Burned in Explosion Was Not Intended Target, Police Say
description: The black scorch marks, still visible on the side of George Wrays house on Sunday, were a reminder of a week of unaccustomed violence that has left residents of Southeast Queens unsettled.

title: Quotation of the Day: For Migrants, Peril on 18 Wheels; For Smugglers, a Profit Machine
description: I thought my final moment had arrived. We were desperate. We were like chickens spinning on a rotisserie.

title: Putins Bet on a Trump Presidency Backfires Spectacularly
description: A little more than a year after the Russian effort to interfere in the American presidential election came to light, the diplomatic fallout  an unraveling of the relationship between Moscow and Washington on a scale not seen in decades  is taking its toll.

title: Mets Weigh Trade Options and Fall Again to Mariners
description: SEATTLE  The visitors clubhouse at Safeco Field after the Mets 9-1 loss to the Seattle Mariners on Sunday resembled most such postgame scenes on travel days.

title: At Cooperstown, a Good Day for Bud Selig, but Not a Perfect One
description: COOPERSTOWN, N.Y.  On the grand occasion of his Hall of Fame induction on Sunday, and on his 83rd birthday to boot, Major League Baseballs commissioner emeritus, Bud Selig, had to endure a certain amount of catcalls, which is not the normal soundtrack in Cooperstown.

title: Review: Tina Howes New Englanders Thrash in the Shallows of Singing Beach
description: Tina Howes Singing Beach, produced by Theater 167 at Here, needs a lifeguard. While it returns to themes and situations she has movingly explored in other works, this sometimes absurdist play about a family in crisis splashes and thrashes under Ari Laura Kreiths direction. It goes under almost from the get-go.

title: No Corrections: July 31, 2017
description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, July 21, 2017.

title: David Beckham Closes In on M.L.S. Franchise. Will Miami Care?
description: MIAMI  The midday sun was beating down on a forlorn, nine-acre section of the Overtown neighborhood last month, and there wasnt a soul in the streets. Boarded-up shops faced the lots on one side, and public housing on two others. High-rise apartments and office towers in downtown Miami, markers of the citys rapid resurgence, glistened not far off.

title: Game of Thrones Episode 3 Recap: The Mad Queen
description: Remind me not to cross Cersei.

title: Indias Favorite Designer Makes a Bid for Western Acclaim
description: The Duchess of Cambridge, Priyanka Chopra and Sonam Kapoor have worn her designs. Last year, Fortune India ranked her No. 21 on its list of the countrys most powerful women. Her clothes and jewelry are sold in India, the Middle East and Africa.

title: Londons New Subway Symbolized the Future. Then Came Brexit.
description: LONDON  Up an alley, beyond some hoarding, through what can feel like Harry Potters secret portal, the underworld of an unfinished Crossrail station sprawls beneath the traffic and commotion of Tottenham Court Road.
