Escalator banks descend through a sleek, silent black ticket hall where towering, empty, white-tiled passageways snake toward the new, vaulted train platform, curving like a half moon into the subterranean darkness.

title: Russia, North Korea, Venezuela: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Whats on TV Monday: What Maisie Knew and The Bachelorette: The Men Tell All
description: Rock on with Julianne Moore and Tilda Swinton as superstars wreaking havoc on their loved ones. Or hear what the men have to say about Rachels behavior during her love quest.

title: Twin Peaks Season 3, Episode 12: Hornes Aplenty
description: Because Twin Peaks doesnt take place in the real world per se, its been fascinating in this revival to see just what aspects of modern life David Lynch and Mark Frost see fit to include in their story. Ive already mentioned the unusually futuristic computers in the otherwise retro Twin Peaks police station; but throughout the series so far thereve been more conventional signs that its taking place in the 2010s. The Double R Diner now touts its RR2GO service, for example; and at the Great Northern, Ben Horne is taken aback when he receives Agent Coopers old room key in the mail, because the hotel hasnt used metal keys in years.

title: Why We Shouldnt Think About College as a Business
description: We conventionally think of college as a place where you can discover new ideas, indulge curiosities and learn for the sake of learning. As tuition skyrockets and becomes less accessible for everyone, however, students have been compelled to think of college from a business perspective instead. In the 2010s, much of the discussion surrounding higher education is less about education and more about its suitability as an investment, like real estate or publicly traded stock.

title: No Longer Seeing the World Through Mens Eyes
description: Women Photograph, a new organization dedicated to helping female visual journalists address obstacles in photojournalism, has announced the recipients of its first grants to support personal projects.

title: HSBC to Buy Back Up to $2 Billion in Shares
description: LONDON  HSBC said on Monday it would buy back as much as an additional $2 billion in shares as it reported better-than-expected earnings in the second quarter.

title: Britain Joins the Shift to Electric Cars
description: The drive to switch to electric cars went a mile further last Wednesday when Britain joined France in pledging to end the sale of new gas and diesel cars by 2040. Norway and India have also said they want to get rid of gas and diesel cars, and at least 10 other countries have set targets for electric cars. All that is good news for the planet and for human health, even if caveats and challenges abound.

title: Who Ate Republicans Brains?
description: When the tweeter-in-chief castigated Senate Republicans as total quitters for failing to repeal the Affordable Care Act, he couldnt have been more wrong. In fact, they showed zombie-like relentlessness in their determination to take health care away from millions of Americans, shambling forward despite devastating analyses by the Congressional Budget Office, denunciations of their plans by every major medical group, and overwhelming public disapproval.

title: Satan in a Sunday Hat
description: Donald Trumps foul-mouthed, preening, narcissistic flack, Anthony Scaramucci, made a string of jaw-dropping statements last week  including accusing chief strategist Steve Bannon of using the president for rapacious self-aggrandizement, comparing this impulse in Bannon to autofellatio  but perhaps none were more telling and important than this statement on White House leaks Scaramucci made last week on CNN:

title: Trump Goes Rogue
description: In Donald Trumps White House, Reince Priebus and Sean Spicer were more than chief of staff and press secretary. They were the presidents connection to the Washington establishment: the donors, flacks and apparatchiks of both parties whose influence over politics and the economy many Trump supporters wish to upend.

title: Try Showing Your Subway a Little Love
description: A smoky trash fire this month on a stretch of subway tracks in Harlem trapped hundreds of passengers on stalled trains and created a torrent of rush-hour delays across much of the underground system. It did another thing as well: It showed that, sometimes, New York riders are their own worst enemies.

title: Pakistans Prime Minister Falls, Again
description: For those hoping for signs of a deepening of democracy in Pakistan, the ouster of Nawaz Sharif provides no help. On the surface, the decision of the Pakistani Supreme Court to disqualify Mr. Sharif and his family from holding office over allegations of corruption seems a triumph for the rule of law, but the way it was done smacks too much of political infighting to celebrate, and the ensuing confusion is in no ones interest. Nor is there much to cheer about for the future of Pakistans troubled relations with the United States and India.

title: My Grandfather, the Secret Policeman
description: In my family, weve lived without God for a hundred years. Its had its ups and downs.

title: The Hacking Wars Are Going to Get Much Worse
description: Reports this month that the United Arab Emirates orchestrated the hacking of a Qatari news agency, helping to incite a crisis in the Middle East, are as unsurprising as they are unwelcome. For years, countries  in particular Russia  have used cyberattacks and the dissemination of disinformation through social media and news outlets to provoke protests, sway elections and undermine trust in institutions. It was only a matter of time before smaller states tried their hand at these tactics.

title: What the Government Schools Critics Really Mean
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif.  When President Trump recently proposed his budget for school choice, which would cut more than $9 billion in overall education spending but put more resources into charter schools and voucher programs, he promised to take a sledgehammer to what he has called failing government schools. That is harsh language for the places most of us call public schools, and where nearly 90 percent of American children get their education. But in certain conservative circles, the phrase government schools has become as ubiquitous as it is contemptuous.

title: The Universe Doesnt Care About Your Purpose
description: Keys in hand, I took a deep breath. I flipped the ignition and the memories of my Papa rushed back, just as the familiar rumble of his Thunderbird kicked in.

title: No Longer Seeing the World Through Mens Eyes
description: The first Women Photograph grants to support personal projects by female visual journalists have been presented to Alex Potter, Lujan Agusti, Gabriella Demczuk and Nha Hirve. Women Photograph, a new organization, aims to help women gain opportunities in an industry that has historically been dominated by white men and has been rife with sexism.

title: Older Lawn Bowlers Put Their Hands Up to Save Club, With a Beyonc Twist
description: SYDNEY, Australia  When members of the Save Chaddy Bowls committee in Melbourne uploaded their parody of the Beyonc hit Single Ladies to defend their club against the threat of a new stadium, they thought they might draw a bit of attention.

title: Divorce Report Capped Scaramuccis First Week. There Was No Second Week.
description: WASHINGTON  Anthony Scaramucci, the White House communications director whose flair for gale-force showmanship makes his new boss look almost tame, had an explosive first week on the job  so explosive that the president removed him from the role on Monday. The news of his ouster, at the hands of John F. Kelly, a new chief of staff tasked with instilling order in the West Wing, followed a particularly chaotic weekend in Mr. Scaramuccis personal life.

title: Pandora: Disneys New Avatar-Themed Section
description: Embark on a journey, inspired by the movie "Avatar," to the Moon of Pandora with a Times reporter and a Walt Disney Imagineer.

title: On Justice Ginsburgs Summer Docket: Blunt Talk on Big Cases
description: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg is the most outspoken member of the Supreme Court, sometimes to her regret. Last year, she issued a statement saying that her criticisms of Donald J. Trump during the presidential campaign had been ill advised. In the future, she said, I will be more circumspect.

title: That North Korea Vacation? Itll Soon Be Out of the Question for Americans
description: The United States government has decided to bar Americans from visiting North Korea, the first time in years that the State Department has moved to block travel to another country.

title: New Dangers Stalk Syrian Children Still Haunted by Horrors Under ISIS
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The boy did not want to see a beheading, so he held his mothers hand tight and tried to close his eyes. But seeing it was mandatory when the Islamic State ruled his hometown in northern Syria: If you were out on the street, you had to watch.

title: Claudia Rankine on the Legacy of Gwendolyn Brooks
description: THE GOLDEN SHOVEL ANTHOLOGY New Poems Honoring Gwendolyn Brooks Edited by Peter Kahn, Ravi Shankar and Patricia Smith 278 pp. The University of Arkansas Press. Paper, $29.95.

title: 2 Die in Attack on Iraqi Embassy in Kabul by Islamic State
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Attackers entered the grounds of the Iraqi Embassy in Kabul, the Afghan capital, after a suicide bomber blew himself up at an entrance gate shortly before noon Monday, an Afghan official said.

title: How to Prepare Preschoolers for an Automated Economy
description: MEDFORD, Mass.  Amory Kahan, 7, wanted to know when it would be snack time. Harvey Borisy, 5, complained about a scrape on his elbow. And Declan Lewis, 8, was wondering why  the two-wheeled wooden robot he was programming to do the Hokey Pokey wasnt working. He sighed, Forward, backward, and it stops.

title: Vladimir Putin, Venezuela, Game of Thrones: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Daily: A Day With I.C.E.
description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: On iPhone or iPad | On Android via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: On Heels of Typhoon Nesat, a Second Storm Hits Taiwan
description: HONG KONG  Taiwan was battered Monday by the second large storm in days, in the wake of a typhoon that flooded streets, injured scores of people and forced more than 10,000 to flee their homes.

title: Binge Drinking Drops Among Teenagers
description: American adolescents are binge drinking less than they used to, according to a new report.

title: What Back to School Looks Like to Our Readers
description: As the 2017-18 academic year approaches, we invited you to submit a photo that represents this time of transition, be it to kindergarten, college or grad school. Here are some responses, in readers own words, lightly edited and condensed.

title: Dry Eyes Deserve Attention
description: Putting carboxymethylcellulose sodium in ones eyes two, three or more times a day may not sound like a great experience. But I can assure you that it can be. Drops of this chemical, called a topical lubricant, help to keep my eyes from burning, avoiding bright lights, becoming red and itchy, and generally feeling miserable.

title: Perella Weinberg Hires Tech Specialist to Court More Traditional Companies
description: Many investment banks are eager to stock up on technology specialists who can advise Silicon Valley denizens on mergers, initial public offerings and other transformative transactions.

title: Your Go-To Guide for Dorm Room Essentials
description: Theres nothing as daunting as a naked dorm room waiting to be outfitted. What to buy? The folks at The Sweethome, a product review site owned by The New York Times Company, know what youre going through. They spent more than 150 hours evaluating dorm essentials. Here are a few of their picks, and you can find more product choices and details here.

title: Sending Sons Off to College, and Finding Solace in a Big Box Store
description: Everyone assumed I was going to fall into a depression after my twin sons went off to college  and so did I. I heard stories about women lying down on the distant childs bed and sobbing and I thought, Thats going to be me.

title: Morning Agenda: Splits in Uber Board Slow C.E.O. Search
description: Travis Kalanick may not be the chief executive at Uber anymore. But that hasnt prevented him from trying to influence the search for a new leader.

title: New York Today: The Greenest Block in Brooklyn
description: Good morning on this sunlit Monday.

title: Jeanne Moreau, Femme Fatale of French New Wave, Is Dead at 89
description: Jeanne Moreau, the sensual, gravel-voiced actress who became the face of the New Wave, Frances iconoclastic mid-20th-century film movement, most notably in Franois Truffauts Jules and Jim, died on Monday at her home in Paris. She was 89.

title: When Children Lose Siblings, They Face an Increased Risk of Death
description: Of all the possible tragedies of childhood, losing a sister or brother to early death is almost too awful to contemplate. Yet it is startlingly common. In the United States, 5 to 8 percent of children with siblings experience such a loss.

title: Campus Political Fights Come Home for the Summer
description: College in the summer: Dorms and quads are quiet, and it seems that the whole community is catching its breath. No marches, sit-ins, shout-downs, protesters giving professors whiplash. No arguments over free speech, Black Lives Matter, Israeli boycotts, abortion, Bernie Sanders, Hillary Clinton, President Trump.

title: Court Directs F.A.A. to Revisit Issue of Shrinking Airline Seat Space
description: The Federal Aviation Administration can no longer ignore what a federal judge called the Case of the Incredible Shrinking Airline Seat.

title: Discovery to Buy Scripps, Owner of Food Network, in $11.9 Billion Deal
description: The cable TV business is a real fixer-upper.

title: Trumps Loyalty Problem
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: After Russias Retaliation, Embassy Workers Brace for a Shock to the System
description: MOSCOW  The last time the Kremlin forced a sweeping reduction of local staff at the American Embassy in Moscow, a young diplomat named Steven Pifer found himself working four days a week on arms control, as usual. But on the fifth day, he navigated the capital in a big truck to move furniture or haul mammoth grocery loads.

title: California Today: Tens of Thousands of New Jobs, and One Worry: Robots
description: Good morning.

title: Homelessness, Poverty and Injustice: Touring Hong Kongs Darker Side
description: HONG KONG  Among the crowds on Kweilin Street in the run-down Hong Kong neighborhood of Sham Shui Po, Alla Lau darted between street signs, peering at the backs of them until she found what she was looking for. She beckoned a group of tourists, mostly white, in flip-flops and with American accents.

title: John Kelly, Asserting Authority, Fires Anthony Scaramucci
description: WASHINGTON  John F. Kelly, President Trumps new chief of staff, firmly asserted his authority on his first day in the White House on Monday, telling aides he will impose military discipline on a free-for-all West Wing, and he underscored his intent by firing Anthony Scaramucci, the bombastic communications director, 10 days after he was hired.

title: Inside Avatar, the Theme Park Version
description: The first time I saw the 2009 film Avatar, I was pulled into its world. The gorgeous habitat of the moon of Pandora was rich and alive onscreen in a way that made me feel as if I were there, able to touch its floating mountains.

title: Stopping Old Podcast Episodes From Self-Destructing
description: Q. I use the Apple Podcasts app, but the episodes never stick around after I play them. If I want to listen again I have to redownload them. I dont sync my shows with other devices, either. Does this mean the space is getting tight on my iPhone?

description: From Where Should We Begin? with Esther Perel

description: From Conversations With People Who Hate Me with Dylan Marron

title: Confederate Inspires #NoConfederate
description: The Game of Thrones creators  concept for a new drama  set in an alternate reality where slavery is still legal  inspired a social media campaign that was a trending topic on Twitter on Sunday night: #NoConfederate.

title: A Better Democratic Slogan? Come Up With Your Own
description: To the Editor:

title: Video Shows Airport Attendant Punching Passenger Holding a Child
description: Cellphone cameras recorded the exact moment on Saturday when passengers of easyJet Flight 2122 lost what was left of their patience. It was 10:17 p.m. in Terminal 2 of the Nice Cte dAzur International Airport in southern France.

title: Reality Bites
description: Good morning. Heres what I think would be a nice thing to cook for dinner tonight, tail end of July in America in 2017: A bowl of corn chowder followed by a brick of simply grilled wild salmon and a few florets of grilled broccoli, with some caramel peach skillet pie for dessert. Simple, nourishing, super-delicious.

title: Sam Shepard, Actor and Pulitzer-Winning Playwright, Is Dead at 73
description: Sam Shepard, whose hallucinatory plays redefined the landscape of the American West and its inhabitants, died on Thursday at his home in Kentucky. He was 73.

title: The Best Path to Long-Term Change Is Slow, Simple and Boring
description: Many of lifes choices fall into two categories:

title: Bitter Feud Divides New Yorks Orthodox Jewish Politicians
description: The idea that a New York City councilman would forgo running for re-election to take charge of a multimillion-dollar nonprofit with a big name and a citywide footprint  and very likely get a big pay bump along the way  would normally amount to a blip of a story.

title: Caregivers Are Too Slow to Reach for EpiPens, Study Finds
description: A severe, rapid allergic reaction calls for a dose of epinephrine as soon as possible. The medicine counteracts potentially dangerous symptoms, such as a plunge in blood pressure and closing of the airways. In extreme cases, it can mean the difference between life and death.

title: Discovery Deal Hinged on the Scripps Family
description: The Discovery Communications cable deal rests on some rosy assumptions.

title: New Options for That Grilled Cheese Sandwich
description: Anne Saxelby, an owner of Saxelby Cheesemongers in the Essex Street Market, gets around to adding a new cheese about once a month. The latest is Calderwood, a firm but satin-textured mountain cheese from Jasper Hill Farm in Vermont. It gets its name from the Randi Albert Calderwood Cropping Center, a facility near the Vermont cheesemaker that dries bales of hay. The cheese is aged in hay, bits of which cling to its sturdy, herbal-scented rind. The interior of the cheese, a first-rate melter, has a fruity aroma and flavor with a tart aftertaste: Calderwood, $24.99 a pound, Saxelby Cheesemongers, Essex Street Market, 120 Essex Street (Delancey Street), 212-228-8204, saxelbycheese.com.

title: Philippe Jordan Will Lead the Vienna State Opera. Can He Bring Peace?
description: One of the most prestigious  but historically most tumultuous  posts in the opera world has been filled. The Vienna State Opera announced on Monday that its next music director would be the Swiss conductor Philippe Jordan, who will begin in fall 2020.

title: The Origins of Indian Curry in New York
description: The history of Indian restaurants in New York could perhaps be traced to J. Ranji Smile, a colorful personality who arrived here from India in 1899 and cooked Indian dishes at Sherrys restaurant. By the early 1900s, restaurants devoted to the cuisine had started opening. In a public talk, Sarah Lohman and Vivek Bald, two historians, will discuss Mr. Smile and the history of curry in American cuisine: The Original Celebrity Chef: The King of Curry, Aug. 10 from 7 to 8:30 p.m., $10 ($5 for members), Brooklyn Historical Society, 128 Pierrepont Street (Clinton Street), Brooklyn Heights, 718-222-4111, brooklynhistory.org.

title: An Encore for the Native Americans Who Shook Up Rock n Roll
description: Plenty of rock n roll songs have been banned from the airwaves because of their lyrics, but Rumble was the first to be banned because of its very sound. Recorded by Link Wray & His Ray Men in 1958, the instrumental pioneered the use of distortion, feedback and the power chord, a mix that made stations in New York and Boston so nervous they refused to play the song for fear that it might incite violence. According to popular lore, the hit song got its name because it reminded listeners of a gang fight, or at least a musical invitation to one; in Pulp Fiction, its the tune that plays while Uma Thurman and John Travolta share a $5 milkshake and a tense silence.

title: An Ice Cream Shop That Recalls Harlems Past
description: Thomfordes ice cream parlor on West 125th Street in Harlem was in business from 1903 to 1983. Chain ice cream stores filled the gap when it closed, but Nicholas Larsen, an alumnus of Telepan and Blue Hill, has opened an independent shop in the neighborhood with his wife, Petrushka Bazin Larsen. At their Sugar Hill Creamery, homemade ice creams and sorbets include vanilla, soursop and salted caramel crunch. Floats, milkshakes, sandwiches and hand-packed pints are also available: Sugar Hill Creamery, 184 Lenox Avenue (West 119th Street), 212-634-9004, sugarhillcreamery.com.

title: A Formidable Crumb Cake as Only Grandma Can Make
description: Susan Owenss idea of taking the crumb cake recipe of her mother, Marie Felice, to market has turned into a business success for both women, as well as for Ms. Owenss daughter. Ms. Felice, nicknamed Nene, began baking in Paterson, N.J., with her own mother more than 50 years ago. The family now lives in Charleston, S.C., where it produces the cakes, which freeze well. Plain, some chocolate variations and blueberry are among the flavors: Nenes Treats, $39 to $45 per cake, 3 for $89, 6 for $149, goldbely.com; more stores on nenestreats.com.

title: As Addison Reed Departs the Mets, Prospects Are on Their Way
description: SEATTLE  As the Mets have sought in recent days to look beyond the disappointments of 2017 and begin to revamp their roster for next season, they have had two main goals: bolstering their bullpen and clearing a path for their two top prospects.

title: Lovers Share Colonies of Skin Microbes, Study Finds
description: Couples who live together share a lot of things: beds, bathrooms, food, toiletries. But one thing they might not expect to share? Skin bacteria.

title: What Does Your Microbiome Say About You?
description: There are many, many microbial species living in or on your body. What secrets can they tell?

title: Spicy Condiments Ripe for Experimentation
description: A collection of unusual condiments inspired by the flavors of Africa, Asia and the Middle East is a versatile resource for the cook. Try cumin-scented eggplant caponata on chicken; tomato and sultana chutney in an omelet; spiced raisin or lemon-sultana marmalata with cheese or yogurt; and white pumpkin and almond murabba, a kind of preserve, over grilled fruit. Dabbed on flatbread, they make for quick cocktail nibbles: Le Bon Magot condiments, $13 for 8 ounces, lebonmagot.com.

title: Is This Dog Dangerous? Shelters Struggle With Live-or-Die Tests
description: Bacon, a cream-colored retriever mix, took a behavior test recently at an animal shelter here. He flunked.

title: Hotel Boom in SeaTac Is Unfettered by $15 Minimum Wage
description: When SeaTac, Wash., became the first city in the nation to pass a $15-an-hour minimum wage in 2013, Jeff Robinson, the citys director of community and economic development, said critics warned him that it would scare away businesses.

title: Scarred Dog Sentenced to Death. Reporter Haunted.
description: I need to explain why I didnt write about how Elsey, a sweetheart of a dog, wound up being sentenced to death.

title: 2 Chainzs Style? Its More Like 7 Chains
description: The rapper 2 Chainz (born Tauheed Epps) loves jewelry so much that he usually wears more than two chains at a time, even when he sleeps. This month and next, hell be traveling the country on his Pretty Girls Like Trap Music tour. He also hosts a GQ video series focused on his love for luxury goods.

title: Where to Stream 5 Great Sam Shepard Movies
description: Sam Shepard, who died last week at 73, was a true renaissance man. As a playwright, he was the toast of Broadway and a Pulitzer Prize recipient. And he had no trouble making the transition to screens small and large, winning over audiences as an actor and earning respect within the industry as a skilled pen-for-hire. His body of work, rich and varied as it is, reveals a man with infinite empathy and intellectual curiosity. Here is a small sample of his works and appearances:

title: Critics for The New York Times on Sam Shepards Plays, Books and Movies
description: Sam Shepard, who died last Thursday at age 73, was a polymathic writer who collected acclaim and accolades as a playwright, actor and author. The New York Times has covered Mr. Shepards career since the mid-1960s. Below are highlights from our reviews.

title: Dr. Raj Panjabi Goes the Last Mile in Liberia
description: Dr. Raj Panjabi, 36, is a co-founder and the chief executive of Last Mile Health, a charity that brings medical care to some of the most remote corners of Liberia.

title: Using Nuclear Weapons
description: To the Editor:

title: What Gives the Sycamore Its Smell?
description: Q. What gives rise to the distinctive odor I detect from sycamore trees?

title: Warrant Issued For Ancient Vase
description: The warrant issued to the Metropolitan Museum of Art for a 2,300-year-old vase.

title: Fung Tu, Jonathan Wus Innovative Chinese Restaurant, Will Close on Aug. 31
description: Fung Tu, Jonathan Wus innovative Chinese restaurant on the Lower East Side, will close after dinner on Aug. 31. Mr. Wu and his business partner, Wilson Tang, plan to reopen the restaurant as Nom Wah Tu in September. Mr. Tang owns Nom Wah Tea Parlor in Chinatown and newer branches of Nom Wah, including Nom Wah Kuai in the Canal Street Market, in which Mr. Wu is also involved. The new restaurant will offer a revised menu incorporating dishes associated with Chinatown like dim sum and other plates for sharing, all with Mr. Wus creative touch. The move comes in response to customer feedback, which also led the partners to plan to lower prices and to turn the space into a more casual setting: 22 Orchard Street (Canal Street), 212-219-8785, fungtu.com.

title: Hackers Threaten Game of Thrones, as HBO Confirms Cyberattack
description: HBO confirmed on Monday that the network had been the target of a cyberattack, as an anonymous hacker boasted about leaking full episodes of upcoming shows along with written material from next weeks episode of Game of Thrones.

title: 3,000 Hits: Who Else Will Get There?
description: Adrian Beltre of the Rangers got his 3,000th hit on Sunday, becoming the 31st player to attain one of baseballs most hallowed marks. Ichiro Suzuki is the only other active player to get there.

title: A Dangerous, Silent Reservoir for Gonorrhea: The Throat
description: The human throat houses billions of bacteria, most of them harmless. But one species is becoming more common, and it is anything but benign.

title: Police Fatally Shoot Emotionally Disturbed Man Holding Knife in Brooklyn
description: A man whose mother called the police to report that he was acting erratically was fatally shot on Monday by one of the police officers who responded to the familys apartment in Brooklyn, the police said.

title: Los Angeles Makes Deal to Host the 2028 Summer Olympics
description: LOS ANGELES  Los Angeles officials announced a deal Monday with the International Olympic Committee to play host to the 2028 Summer Olympics, giving up a bid for the 2024 Games to Paris and bringing the Olympics back to the United States for the first time since 2002.

title: Chicago Cubs Give Steve Bartman a World Series Ring, Bejeweling an Infamous Hand
description: On Oct. 14, 2003, a Cubs fan named Steve Bartman innocently reached up for a foul ball at Wrigley Field and initiated a cascading series of events that knocked his famously frustrated team right out of the postseason.

title: Persian Gulf Rivals Competed to Host Taliban, Leaked Emails Show
description: LONDON  In their long-running rivalry, the United Arab Emirates has often accused its neighbor Qatar of abetting Islamist militants, citing as one prime example the 2013 opening of a Taliban embassy in the Qatari capital, Doha.

title: Defying E.U. Court, Poland Is Cutting Trees in an Ancient Forest
description: WARSAW  Defying an order from the European Unions highest court, the Polish government said on Monday that it would continue logging in Bialowieza Forest, the last primeval forest in Europe and a habitat for hundreds of bison.

title: The Rugged Style of Sam Shepard
description: Probably no one else was more at ease in a pair of Levis and a simple T-shirt than he.

title: When It Came to Style, Sam Shepard Was an Endangered Species
description: He was, for so many, the archetypal American male given flesh and form (and a leather jacket). He was born in the heartland and worked on ranches in Duarte, Calif., where his family owned an avocado farm. He rode horses, sheared sheep, picked oranges, delivered newspapers. He had a volatile relationship with his father, a World War II fighter pilot who developed an alcohol problem, something that would later afflict the son.

title: Will Shark Lovers Love Unabomber? Asking for a Cable Network.
description: Lets be honest: Prestige television and Shark Week are not phrases that go together naturally. Yet during its recent rather frivolous annual shark-themed programming stunt, the Discovery Channel was heavily promoting as laudable a series as TV has offered this summer: Manhunt: Unabomber, an eight-parter that begins on Tuesday night.

title: View From the River Caf: 40 Years of Feasts and Firsts
description: Dining at a coveted window seat in the luminous River Caf, which rests on a former coffee barge in the shadow of the Brooklyn Bridge, even the most jaundiced New Yorkers have to concede that the magic endures.

title: The Eclipse That Revealed the Universe
description: So this is what it is like to play cosmic pinball. The worlds move, and sometimes they line up. Then you find yourself staring up the tube of blackness that is the moons shadow, a sudden hole in the sky during a total solar eclipse.

title: Only Six Nations Have Evaluated Readiness for Global Pandemic
description: Of the worlds countries, only six  three rich ones and three poor ones  have taken the steps they should have to evaluate their ability to withstand a global pandemic, according to a recent report sponsored by the World Bank.

title: Yankees Acquire Sonny Gray From Oakland as Trade Deadline Arrives
description: A year ago at this time, Yankees General Manager Brian Cashman had to persuade Hal Steinbrenner, the teams general managing partner, to take a most un-Yankee-like approach to the trade deadline, advising him to shed well-known and highly paid players in exchange for unproven prospects.

title: Kenyan Election Official Is Killed on Eve of Vote
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  A senior election official in Kenya was found dead Monday, intensifying anxiety over whether the country can hold a fair and peaceful vote next week in a tightly contested presidential election.

title: Instagram Turbocharges the Watch Market
description: On Thursday, it was a stylishly retro 1962 Bulova Super Compressor on @analogshift that won my heart. On Wednesday, it had been an elegantly understated 1970 Rolex Submariner, courtesy of @jasonheaton, that quickened the pulse. Tuesday had brought its own obsession, a vintage Heuer 3647 Carrera chronograph, regrammed on @hodinkee.

title: Chop Off This Worms Head and It Can Still Detect Light
description: The planarian flatworm is a smooshed noodle of an organism that can be found all over the planet. It has a triangular head occupied by a rather primitive version of a brain and two black dots for eyes. You can chop off this head, and it will grow back in about a week  eyes, brain and all. And you can hack away at the critter until all thats left is a tiny speck of worm dust  and the thing will still grow back.

title: Former Arizona Sheriff Joe Arpaio Is Convicted of Criminal Contempt
description: Former Sheriff Joe Arpaio committed a crime by defying a court order to stop detaining suspected undocumented immigrants, a judge ruled on Monday, in the latest rebuke for a once-popular politician who was voted out of office last year.

title: How to Save Your Sperm
description: Is humanity killing itself off? In a study published last week, a team of epidemiologists found that sperm counts among men in the United States, Europe and Australia have declined by more than 50 percent between 1973 and 2011. Alongside the deleterious effects of cigarette smoke, especially during critical stages of prenatal development, the authors of the study point out that exposure to certain synthetic chemicals has been associated with decreased fertility.

title: Anthony Scaramucci, Russia, John Kelly: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Chaotic Weeks at the White House
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: In Rebooting Justice, a Call to Help the Lawyerless in Court
description: The current debate over how to solve the health care crisis provides a relevant backdrop to a provocative new book that proposes a wide range of solutions to the crisis in another sector whose availability in extreme circumstances can also mean the difference between life and death: legal services.

title: Soho Rep Will Return to Its Longtime Theater With Two New Plays
description: After a period of uncertainty and turmoil, Soho Rep will return to its longtime home with a new season that includes new works from Aleshea Harris and Jackie Sibblies Drury.

title: Is the U.S. Trying to Kill the Iran Nuclear Deal?
description: In July, President Trump reluctantly agreed to confirm that Iran is complying with the terms of the nuclear agreement. But now, analysts say he is actively looking for ways to get the United States out of the deal.

title: As Amazons Influence Grows, Marketers Scramble to Tailor Strategies
description: Amazons rapidly expanding influence on a wide portion of the American public has become impossible to ignore  and it is giving rise to a whole new side of the advertising industry.

title: Slight Drop in The Great Comet Ticket Sales Amid Casting Uproar
description: Box office sales for Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812 have slumped since Josh Groban left the company, and a recent casting uproar has resulted in even more uncertainty over future ticket sales.

title: How to Survive a Rip Current: First, Dont Fight It
description: Around 2 a.m. on Sunday, Zuzana Oravcova, 24, went swimming with a friend at Point Pleasant Beach in New Jersey. About 17 hours later, Jevoney White, 19, did the same at Smith Point Beach on Long Island.

title: Jeanne Moreau Was a Cinema Giant. Heres Where to Stream 5 of Her Greatest Roles
description: The French actress Jeanne Moreau was a lion of international cinema, projecting ferocious intelligence, unapologetic independence and staggering beauty throughout a career that spanned more than six decades, with nearly 150 acting credits to her name. Overwhelmed? Here are five streamable films to get your started.

title: In TV Spectacle, Man Convicted of Child Rape-Murder Is Executed in Yemen
description: SANA, Yemen  In a televised execution attended by thousands of Yemenis chanting approval, a man convicted of raping and killing a toddler was placed face down in a public square in Yemens capital on Monday and shot with an automatic weapon at point-blank range.

title: Dont Refrigerate This Butter Dish
description: There are a couple of arguments for storing butter at room temperature. Left in a dish on the kitchen counter, its ready to spread at all times, and cooks will have soft butter without waiting. Joelle Mertzel, an entrepreneur, has created Butterie, a butter dish for the countertop, with a convenient built-in flip-top lid. The company had butter left at room temperature for three weeks tested for yeast, mold, bacteria and rancidity, and it was fine: Butterie, BPA-free plastic with spreader, $12.99 Bed Bath & Beyond stores, bedbathandbeyond.com; $13.99 (more colors available online), butteriedish.com.

title: Jeanne Moreau Was a Cinema Giant. Heres Where to Stream 5 of Her Greatest Roles
description: Antonioni. Malle. Welles. For over six decades, the French actress collaborated with the worlds best directors.

title: Scaramucci Is Out After Only 10 Days
description: President Trump removed Anthony Scaramucci from his job as White House communications director at the request of John Kelly, the new White House chief of staff. Mr. Scaramucci served in his post for only 10 days.

title: Republican Senator Jeff Flake Rails Against Trump, but to What End?
description: Conscience of a ConservativeBy Jeff Flake140 pages. Random House. $27.

title: Review: Park Plays Draw Inspiration From the Queens Landscape
description: She is the greatest of all time, so magnificent that these three devotees need not even utter her name as they gather to burn sage in her honor. Serena Williams is their own personal deity, and in Ngozi Anyanwus snappy and hilarious G.O.A.T., they are praying to the goddess Nike and the ghost of Arthur Ashe for Ms. Williams to win a Grand Slam.

title: Four TV Shows to Watch This Week
description: Watching is The New York Timess TV and film recommendation newsletter and website.

title: Prosecutors Dilemma: Will Conviction Lead to Life Sentence of Deportation?
description: The drunken-driving case seemed straightforward, the kind that prosecutors in Seattle convert into a quick guilty plea hundreds of times a year: a swerving car, a blood-alcohol level more than twice the legal limit, a first-time offense that caused no injuries.

title: Losing the Fight Against Dad Bod
description: Over avocado toast and coffee at Cafe Cluny in the West Village, Michael Bailey held up his iPhone to show an image of himself taken 15 years ago, back when he was a fit model for a major clothing line. This was the photo he recently posted on his Facebook wall on his 52nd birthday.

title: Review: Flawed but Fascinating Dvorak Opera in a Rare Staging
description: The conductor Leon Botstein is driven by a compelling conviction that comes with a warning. He has argued for decades that classical music risks boring itself to death through the endless repetition of a canon of staples. Mr. Botstein tirelessly champions neglected works that were significant in their time but have slipped into obscurity.

title: A Touchy Topic?
description: Dear Diary:

title: Right and Left on the Russia Sanctions and Putins Response
description: The political news cycle is fast, and keeping up can be overwhelming. Trying to find differing perspectives worth your time is even harder. Thats why we have scoured the internet for political writing from the right and left that you might not have seen.

title: Apples Silence in China Sets a Dangerous Precedent
description: A year ago, the Federal Bureau of Investigation made an extraordinary demand of Apple. To get inside a dead terrorists iPhone, law enforcement officials wanted the company to create a hackable version of the software that runs all iPhones.

title: Scaramucci, Kelly, Russia: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Guilty Plea From Man Arrested With Guns at Holland Tunnel
description: JERSEY CITY  Five months after losing his daughter to an overdose, John Cramsey, a gun range owner from Pennsylvania, embarked on a crusade against drugs.

title: Comic Books, in Black and White
description: Three black teenagers in Bedford-Stuyvesant are shot by police officers in a case of mistaken identity. One of them, Kareem Jenkins, survives and learns a secret: Only black people have superpowers. How does the world react as the truth is exposed?

title: Q. and A.: The Cryptic Humanity of Melisandre on Game of Thrones
description: The last time she was on Dragonstone, the red priestess Melisandre was on a mission to convert and support Stannis in his bid for the Iron Throne. It didnt turn out well, for him or his family. So she moved on to Plan B (or C): to bring ice and fire together, to make sure Jon Snow and Daenerys Targaryen joined forces. After glimpsing Jons arrival from afar, she shared a few cryptic words with Varys, a fellow foreign-slave-turned-royal-councilor: I have to die in this strange country, just like you.

title: Corrections: August 1, 2017
description: NATIONAL

title: Upstate County Jails Are Challenged for Sending Juveniles to Solitary
description: A year after the Department of Justice banned putting juvenile inmates in federal prisons into solitary confinement, a small network of inmate advocates has undertaken an effort to end the practice in some of upstate New Yorks county jails.

title: Misty Copeland Becomes a Face of Este Lauder, and Ballet Takes Note
description: Supermodels and actresses have generally been the ones to land high-profile, lucrative modeling contracts to promote major cosmetics companies. Enter the ballerina.

title: Scaramuccis Brief, but Volatile, Tenure
description: Anthony Scaramucci burst into the White House as a game-changing character in the continuing drama of the Trump administration. Brandishing mirrored aviator sunglasses and an expletive-heavy vocabulary, he immediately inserted chaos, conflict and showmanship into the reality show at the White House.

title: At Competitive Stuyvesant, Alumni Are Waging a Bitter Contest
description: Accusations of bullying, sham elections, secret financial deals  these are not charges that are usually associated with a high school alumni association.

title: Medal of Honor Goes to Vietnam Medic Who Ran Through Hell on Earth
description: WASHINGTON  It was clear almost as soon as the May 1969 assault began that the orders  to attack Nui Yon Hill, near the city of Tam K, Vietnam  were flawed. The North Vietnamese and the Vietcong had the American position surrounded on three sides.

title: Lee May, the Big Bopper for the Reds, Dies at 74
description: Lee May, a slugging first baseman with the Cincinnati Reds who was traded to the Houston Astros for Joe Morgan after the 1971 season and missed the Reds becoming one of baseballs greatest teams a few years later, died on Saturday in Cincinnati. He was 74.

title: With Logan Lucky, Soderbergh Hopes to Change Films Business Model
description: LOS ANGELES  I want movie studios to keep their grubby paws off my money. And I want complete control over how my films are marketed.
